Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend”
Reviews.Author: MargaretJay
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here with my husband 16 to 18 March 2012, courtesy of the Tesco voucher scheme. I always feel something of a cheapskate when I stay at a hotel on this basis but then I do spend a lot of money in Tesco: it used a lot of vouchers for one weekend. It was splendid! From arriving an hour before check in: a few people arrived at the same time and immediately more staff swung into action so no queuing. Our room was ready though we were early and we had been given an upgrade to a king size room which was beautiful, roomy, very very clean. It also had everything we might need. Little extras requested were promptly dealt with. Indeed staff throughout our stay were wonderful, so pleasant, polite, eager to help, checking that everything was ok without being intrusive or fussy. Just right. Our Tesco deal included breakfast which would otherwise have cost £29 which is quite expensive, but quality and choice of food was excellent. Poached eggs exactly right! Staff in the restaurant were lovely too. The location is great of course. I tend to like the hotels I stay in as I do my research in advance but this is the first time I can truly say I found no fault. i like to try different hotels when I visit London exploring different areas etc but now feel I have to go back here as it was so so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyJoey
Reviews.Content: We felt like royalty in the gorgeous corner suite! Honestly, you could live in this very large suite. Absolutely everything was first-class all the way. The location is wonderfully convenient for shopping and sight-seeing. Don't forget to go take a look at the ballroom that used to be an ice-skating rink!! And look at the book written about the Hotel. I don't think I could ever stay any place else in London after this fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Services, and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cabbqking
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. It is right across from Hyde Park, and exactly one mile to Buckingham Palace. Then easy / short walk to Abbey, Big Ben, Downing Street, etc. The hotel is nice by European standard. Lobby is large, and comfortable with two restaurants. The executive lounge is relatively small, but has great breakfast. Evening hour snacks are not that good. I have an upgraded room and it was large in size and very nicely done. The bathroom is nicely done with marble, etc. Room seems to be updated during the recent years. There is a taxi stand right at the back door. Overall, I like the location, and like the hotel. But it is darn expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MaNa99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grosvernor House for the first part of our recent honeymoon and loved it. My only complaint would be that we had to wait a few hours to check in (due to our flight arriving early from the US), although I do not view this as a big complaint. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to the executive floor (due to being a gold member). The room was great, and we had a "city view" of Mayfair, Big Ben, and the London Eye. We also received complimentary chocolate covered strawberries once we got into our room because of our honeymoon. Being right on Park Lane is great, and having tube stops at either end of Hyde Park is very convenient. We brought the tube in from Heathrow to Hyde Park Corner, then walked up to the hotel, which really wasn't too long of a walk with a large suitcase. The concierge desk was always able to help out with restaurant ideas and also helped set up a day trip to Windsor/Stonehenge/Bath. Overall a great trip, and staying at this great hotel just made the honeymoon that much more special.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Respite, Near the Heart of Oxford and Bond Streets”
Reviews.Author: CaryPlanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Grosvenor House on Park Lane for five days. We stayed using Marriott points. We were checked in immediately upon arrival and had no wait at the reception. As Gold Marriott Rewards Members, we were given a lovely upgrade to an Executive Floor Room (7th floor) with an amazing view of the American Embassy, the London Eye, and Big Ben! The room had a large, extremely comfortable king size bed with wonderful crisp, clean, white linens and duvet. It had two chairs, a desk, and a bench at the end of the bed (no sofa). It was spacious and roomy for a large city. We also had ample closet space and a decent sized marble bathroom with wonderful shower (handheld and rain). The toilet was close enough to the sink that you could almost kiss it! But it is an old hotel that has been renovated. The paint is all new and the furniture is elegant and in perfect condition as was the carpeting. Luxurious fluffy robes and slippers await you to enjoy your daily paper delivered to your door. Elegant molding and a tray ceiling complete the details. Thick curtains block the morning light, and sheers allow you to enjoy the blue lights of the London Eye, if you prefer. The room had a nice flat-screen with a DVD player. The concierge floor (accessible by Gold and Platinum Marriott Members and those on the executive floor) has a nice selection of DVDs for free loan. Our DVD player did not work at first. We had four staff members try their hand at getting it to work. After a couple of hours of different ones attempting to help us, finally we brought a new one. (To turn it on, go to channel 1 then press the - negative button once to get to the DVD screen. It wasn't explained anywhere and the staff usually didn't know the trick either.) The concierge/executive lounge is large and spacious and is nicely appointed with comfortable furniture--mostly two person tables, but also a couple of couches and a flat screen tv. The view is only of a brick building across the street (the Washington DC concierge lounge has a fabulous view). But there are several wonderful staff on hand at all times to help arrange use of their meeting room or to help you make reservations for dinner or find directions to a museum or theatre. Staff were very friendly and would inquire about our show the next morning and see if the directions had been easy to follow. They also have board games for children to borrow as well. Breakfast is hearty and delicious and is served from 6 to 11 am. It appeared to be fully replenished the entire time. It included cereals, muffins, pastries, meats, cheeses, scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon and sausage links, juices, milks (skim, semi, and not), coffee, espresso, tea, hot chocolate, fruit (fabulous fresh pineapple!), and more. Afternoon tea is served from 2:30 to 5. We popped back from touring a couple of times by 4:30, but found most of the food already cleaned up and put away. Once we found a couple of scrumptious, still warm scones left, but usually just dried fruit and nuts or a few cookies were left. Hot drinks, bottled water, and chilled sodas (ginger ale, bitter lemon, pepsi, diet pepsi, and a few others) were available all day. Wines and more were available for free from 5:30 to 9:30. Canapes were available from 6 to 8 pm. The two nights we were there during this time, they served cut fresh vegetables such as cucumbers, carrots, peppers, cauliflower, cheeses, grapes, hummus and pita, mini spring rolls with duck, chicken, or vegetables, and mini hot dogs rolled in pastry. Cookies also appeared at times--white chocolate with macadamia nuts and cranberry/raisin ones. All meals were served with lovely china and silverware. We arrived by tube, taking the Picadilly (dark blue) line from Heathrow and changing to the Central (red) line to the Marble Arch stop. it's an hour trip, not the 30 minutes the Marriott website advertises. Make sure you know what terminal your flight will be departing before you make your return trip--check the Heathrow website before you leave the hotel. The Tube has different stops for Terminal 4, Terminals 1 to 3, and Terminal 5. Traveling before 9:30 am is more expensive, but was less than 3 pounds for a child under age 15 and under 8 pounds for an adult. A chauffered car (can be arranged by the hotel) is about 80 pounds. A taxi is a similar fee. If you want to save your pounds to see a few extra shows, get an oyster card for an adult and a daily travel card for a child for the Underground, if you don't have much luggage and can handle a few stairs and a 10 minute walk. Make sure you are at the JW Marriott, not the Marriott--both are on Park Lane, a quarter mile apart. Because we were celebrating my son's arrival in teen hood, the staff provided a lovely cheesecake with Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the plate--delivered to our room on our first evening's arrival. We were very impressed by the concierge staff's willingness to e-mail answers to questions we had before arrival (since we are Marriott Gold Members). But they did not seem to know places to recommend for picky American children to eat. The good news is there is a McDonald's 10 minutes walk away--just beyond the Marble Arch Tube Station, on the left. Additionally there is a Pizza Hut at the same tube station--but take a right instead. It looked very small from the outside, but go downstairs and there is a nice modern roomy dining room. They have thin and thick crust, had many specials, and appeared to have some good buffet specials at lunch and again from 3 to 5 pm. A six slice pizza was only 8 pounds. We wish we had tried it before our last night there, as it was difficult to find things my picky eater would enjoy. We found hamburgers but not hot dogs and almost never found mac and cheese or chicken tenders in London. There were many sandwiches shops on almost every street. We truly have no complaints about this lovely hotel, which is well maintained and staffed. The rooms were quiet and comfortable and nicely appointed. If you are an Underground user, the Grosvenor Marriott is mere steps away from the tube, while the JW is a 10 minute walk. We had also debated using St Pancras. It was connected to St Pancras and Kings Cross, eliminiating the need to walk outdoors, but the station is extremely large and would involve a good little walk as well. St Pancras has many sandwich and small sit down cafes indoors and two McDonalds are a few steps away. But we are glad we decided on the Park Lane location of the Grosvenor House instead, because its location was more central in town and closer to the sites we most wanted to see and the Tube lines that more quickly accessed more of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: UnTjus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grosvenor House JW Marriott for 4 nights. We had a really great room, it was big and, clean and comfortable. Next to our own bed at home, it was the best bed we ever slept in. We had a room towards the back of the hotel and it was very quiet and nice. 500 meters from underground station Marble Arch at Oxford Street. They have a couple of nice restaurants, fitness center and a little cafe, the food is supposed to be good but we never had the time to try it. We will certainly return another time.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent”
Reviews.Author: DaisyW92
Reviews.Content: We had 5 rooms of 2 booked for here after a black tie ball in the ballroom, there was a huge amount of hassle and waiting around to be checked in, took almost an hour for the process to be completed as there was not sufficient staff to do the job. However the hotel was clean and shiny, and the lobby smelled beautiful(!) but this did not fully extend to the rooms, we had suites booked for our party, they were huge and wonderfully furnished, but it was basic things that let it down - improperly folded flat sheets on the bed, dated shower curtain (would much rather have glass shower doors) a few chips here and the in the marble of the bathroom. Minor things, but not what you expect from a 5* Park Lane Hotel. The bed was enormous, with fat and soft pillows and high quality linens, and the food was excellent. Overall, a mixed review, but would definitely keep staying there as the views are spectacular and the experience is rather sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Just gets better..”
Reviews.Author: bewlaybros Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of lines to reiterate what a great hotel this is. We stay here on a regular basis and usually get an upgrade. This particular time was no exception and we were given a huge suite overlooking Hyde Park (actual cost approx Â£1500 per night! ouch!). Probably the best hotel room I have ever stayed in! I have never had a bad stay here and hence it comes highly recommended. Enjoy. PS I have stayed in other JW's and this is the best one so far.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok but not superb”
Reviews.Author: Jakkov
Reviews.Content: Average rooms & good staff. But it is not a high standard as others JW that I have been. This one is just normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great classic hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: rustycat83
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 10 days for a business trip. The hotel is in a great location on Park Lane, just across from eastern end of Hyde Park. Within easy walking distance are many fine restaurants in the Mayfield area as well as Oxford Street shopping, museums, Buckingham Palace, Harrods, U.S. embassy and the list goes on. The hotel, while old, has been well updated and the rooms were large (by London standards) and furniture was new. King bed was comfortable and the room/hotel was very quiet both day and night. The service staff was friendly and promptly addressed any requests. No complaints. Will definitely stay here on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myles_na_gcopaleen
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Booked 2 deluxe rooms with breakfast for a family of four. They gave us 2 rooms with adjoining doors so it was very easy to walk between both rooms. Quality of the furnishings, beds and bathrooms were very good. Rooms were very quiet - no problems with noise. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast, and this was excellent. Fantastic selection from the buffet and plenty more made to order. Would recommend this highly.

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy the atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: LRMacKenzie
Reviews.Content: We attended the IET annual dinner recently which was being held in the Grosvenor House; we stayed in the hotel overnight. We really enjoyed it. We were upgraded to a suite when we arrived. It was very well appointed. We had the use of the executive lounge which was terrific. I think this is a good quality hotel with great ambience and good service. But oh! London prices!

Reviews.Title: “Just love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: snoopy46
Reviews.Content: Our first visit 2 years ago was amazing,I loved the hotel it's easy to get about from the hotel but just loved everything about the hotel,drinks at night,breakfasts fantastic,the steakhouse was Amazing! Bedrooms and bathrooms spot on and I'm looking forward to returning.....

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: P0WDERM0NKEY
Reviews.Content: I've been there for a number of big conferences but not stayed there until recently. Put simply, these guys are good. The hotel part works very well, nice rooms, a "turn down service" in the evening completely reset my room. The big dinner capability is amazing. They do a miraculous job of catering for around 1200 people (IMHO). The location is a lovely part of London. My only negative is that on the lower floors the mobile signal isn't good. Higher up, I found a great 3G signal on Vodafone. I guess the problem is they need a big mast in the middle of Hyde Park, which isn't that likely! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Pire classical elegance”
Reviews.Author: WarringtonWainwright
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions on reward points, and having seen some other Marriottâ€™s other London offerings I think this is my favourite . Itâ€™s slightly less convenient for most things than the St Pancrass, or Renaissance on Holborn; but in terms of true elegance I donâ€™t think it can be beaten. The Grosvenor provides classical elegance, nothing tacky or ostentatious and not modern in terms of minimalist furniture or small square bathroom sinks. The staff at reception have always been helpful and the residents lounge is excellent serving: a good breakfast, afternoon tea, evening snacks and evening pre-dinner drinks including a full range of spirits, beers and champagne all complementary (note this is only for executive guests or Marriott Gold/Platinum members). My limited experience of the bar downstairs is good although itâ€™s very expensive and doesnâ€™t serve draft beers, only bottles. The rooms are very comfortable with (as advertised on the website) marble bathroom suites and (not well documented) amazing showers which are almost powerful enough to blast the skin right off your body if turned up to full power. The beds are excellent and always provide a wonderful nightâ€™s sleep. The rest of the room is usual high quality hotel fare: large flat screen TV, document safe, fridge, desk, bathrobes, and even an umbrella in the wardrobe in case of rain. The only problem Iâ€™ve had with the Grosvenor House is ironically the address, Park lane is well known for being a nice part of town but isnâ€™t ideally convenient for most things except for Hyde Park, the Embassies in Grosvenor Square, The Royal Albert Hall and West End shopping. The hotel is about half way between two tube stations (Marble Arch and Hyde Park Corner) each about 300m down the road; and is easily served by taxis which do make travel reasonable. That said there are better located hotels for sightseeing, and certainly for the east end of London e.g. The City/Canary Wharf. Overall I obviously love this hotel itâ€™s a great place to stay. The only thing I would say is that in terms of Marriotts the St Pancrass Hotel is also worth considering as my potential other London pick, especially if modern is your thing, or if it is perhaps better positioned for where you want to be in town.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice buy VERY expensive”
Reviews.Author: KBM37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as we loved the location and go to Marriott Hotels whenever possible. It was clean and beautifully kept. We did NOT eat breakfast there as we felt it was way too expensive. The hotel has great ambiance and nice rooms. Be prepared to spend money to go there!

Reviews.Title: “an exellent and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghadajeddah
Reviews.Content: it's 5 minute walking to oxford street,the hotel is comfortable and one of the best hotels in london

Reviews.Title: “Once Bitten Twice Shy”
Reviews.Author: klh717
Reviews.Content: I visit London 1 to 3 times a year and have stayed at this hotel through priceline booking twice and was delighted with the stay. To save time in seaching for other hotels on my London trip in future, I decided to book directly through the hotel web site for my 3 nights stay two months ahead of my arrival, hoping to make this hotel my choice of accommodation. In order to have a good rest, I decided to take the day flight instead of night flight. Upon my arrival at 9+pm at the hotel, we were allocated on the 1st floor room and I was absolutely disappointed with the room as the previous reviewer wrote, the room is really small with two 3' single bed joined together and with a thick wall outside the window and have very limited signal on my mobile & 3 internet dongle. Bathroom is small and a display of empty shower cap box (luckily I have a spare one in my toiletries bag and too tired to call for it). On the next morning I really cannot receive my call properly due to poor signal and I decided to ask for a room change as I told the receptionist that I did not want to make it my last stay at this hotel as I'm returning in March 2012, luckily she can allocate another room but told us to pack and leave our luggage in the room and they will bring our luggage to the new room upon our return. As we went out around 9am and returned from New Bond St (about 500+m walked) at 12:30noon all wet as me & my College daughter were caught in the rain without a room (previous room key returned), we waited for 15 min without anynews and I told the same receptionist again that we really need a room to change before we proceed to our next lunch appointment at The Metropolitan Hotel. We finally got another room with a street view on the same floor but have to transfer our own luggage. On the check out at 9am, we called for concierge twice to deliver our luggage down but ended up having to do it ourselves. The nearest tube is Marble Arch & Oxford Street shopping which is 643m away from the hotel, if you do not mind the walking distance than this is a good choice of hotel. To have a peace of mind on my next visit in Mar 12'. I have booked Sofitel London Heathrow for 3 nights and hope to come back with a good review.

Reviews.Title: “Grosvenor House - Elegance In The Best Part of London”
Reviews.Author: EBJ11
Reviews.Content: The Grosvenor House is a beautiful hotel in the best part of London. From the moment you walk in and see the gorgeous, HUGE flower arrangement in the lobby, you know you will be staying in a truly elegant place. The staff is very friendly and helpful and check in was easy. The rooms are beautifully appointed and large compared to the other two hotels we stayed in during this trip. The bed was comfortable and had really nice linens. I loved the closet area that had drawers AND shelves as well as an in-room safe. Let me tell you about my favorite- The Bathroom!. There is a large tub/shower combo and everything is marble but the best part is the dual shower heads- one regular sized hand-held (typical in England) and a fabulous, BIG waterfall above you (see my pics). Washing your hair after a long day walking for miles to see the sights is absolute HEAVEN and I am real picky about showers- especially water pressure. It was such a luxurious touch and you will LOVE it. The toiletries are nice and as in all the hotels we visited in England, there is a heated towel rack. There was only one thing that I was disappointed with- there are NO electrical outlets inside the bathroom.....HELLO??? don't the women in England do their hair ??. If you are like me and NEED a blow dryer and flat iron to even walk out the door without scaring people, you will be more than slightly annoyed by this. After my fabulous shower, I had to do hair at the desk- right next to the TV. Good thing my husband was in a pub at the time and didn't have to sit there listening to 1875 watts on High ! Like I said before- the room was lovely, comfortable, luxurious and quiet- so I forgive them this one small thing. I can only speak for the rooms on our floor (lower) and we had no view. Hotel Internet costs a fortune in London- go to the Pubs with free WiFi if you can. There is really nice gym and a few nice places to eat and drink within the hotel. I also loved seeing the info on the history of the place. If you stay here, keep in mind that this is a very upscale hotel. People are dressed WELL- do not go thinking that your ratty jeans and tennis shoes will be acceptable. In fact- one of the things I LOVED about London is that it's a very sophisticated city and everyone is well dressed, clean and elegant. Take nice stuff- even if you are just sight seeing. We were with a friend that was wearing jeans and tennis shoes and tried to go in the American Bar at The Savoy- no dice. If you do wear jeans- wear good ones and NICE shoes. The Grosvenor is located in a lovely neighborhood across from Hyde Park. You can walk, take The Tube or a taxi to anywhere you need to go quite easily. We loved taking the trains everywhere- I suggest getting a Day Pass- you can go anywhere, all day for one small fee. Be prepared to WALK but trust me- you will LOVE it .London is truly wonderful and if you want a really posh yet friendly experience- stay at Grosvenor and enjoy ! I

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: lulumai
Reviews.Content: Luxury accommodation, exceptional staff and service and a breakfast to die for! The location is ideal, overlooking Hyde Park and ten minute walk from Oxford Street, or 20 minutes the opposite direction to Harrods. I would definitely stay here again (if I am lucky enough!). I would reccommend booking the hotel as a package as we saved a lot of money this way.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea in the Park Room”
Reviews.Author: Eccleston3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tea with plenty of free refills and excellent service. Scrummy food and lots of extras included. Very good value for money. They even give the children a toy with their tea. Nice room with views over the park.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Bev306
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel - made to feel really special.Were lucky enough to have a room upgrade (which made it an even better experience).Little disappointed with breakfast (even though there was a lot of choice) - even so would recommend this hotel (despite price!)

Reviews.Title: “Old British Charm with Exceptional Standards”
Reviews.Author: Arlington7175
Reviews.Content: As you can tell from our past reviews, we are very loyal to the Marriott. While under the Marriott name, the Grosvenor House has a a long rich history that the Marriott has preserved but incorporating Marriott's high customer service standards. This is an extremely large hotel, so if you prefer a boutique option, this is not the right place for you. If you are looking for a full service luxury hotel, located in a premier part of London but just enough off the tourist track to be comfortable, then this is a good option. The design and furnishings are very traditional which are appropriate for the architecture of the hotel, but I'm simply noting this if you prefer a contemporary option. The beds and sheets meet a Marriott/JW Marriot's high standards. Also, housekeeping was exceptional. Breakfast in the main restaurant is expensive (I believe close to $US 40 per person), but it is very good food with plenty of fresh fruits and other choices. Service was always reliable too. Also, they will make eggs to order, special toasts, or waffles and bring to your table if not served on the buffet and is included in the price. Breakfast was inclued in a package deal; otherwise, we may not have paid the price, but it was so filling, we never ate lunch. We had gold member access, so also frequented the Elite/gold member's lounge. I did stick my head in to see the lounge at breakfast and it seemed way too small for the size of the hotel. It felt very crowded and harried. It did have a few warm food options, but it was mostly fruit and breads, and did not seem as stocked as well as it should be. We also stopped for afternoon tea one day in the lounge. It was ok, but once again did not seem to be very well stocked. I dont think the hotel has set aside enough resources/space for the size of the hotel and likely number of gold members. Overall the staff was very nice and helpful, from the desk staff to bell staff to housekeepers to concierge. We would consider staying again or may try to the other Marriott at Park Lane which is slightly closer to the tube station, since Marriott has lots of West End London options.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but pricey. Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: missacorah
Reviews.Content: I won a competition to stay here (could never have afforded it otherwise) and had an amazing time!Our car doors were opened for us on arrival and we were made to feel welcome and important. The foyer was huge yet still inviting but you really could get lost in the place. We stayed in a huge apartment type room with its own bathroom. The decor, especially the drapes were very regal with a modern twist. Staff when approached were helpful and professional. We attended a function at the hotel in the evening and this was just exquisite with delicious food, entertainment and decor. Breakfast was on an upstairs floor that you needed to obtain a passcard to gain entry to. This was in a small suite and taken in relaxing armchairs and coffee tables and was help yourself. I actually found the food running out wasnt readily filled up in this part of the hotel and the 2 young members of staff didnt seem to have a huge amount of customer service skills between them. Breakfast was the only part of this hotel that let it down. A little foreword for you also -dont eat anything out of the room fridge - prices start at Â£3.50 for a Dairy Milk! We were warmly thanked as we checked out. A lovley stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very pricey!”
Reviews.Author: joanneheyes
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely but had no tea or coffee making facilities which I think is ridiculous for a 5* hotel. When we rang down and asked for tea for one it came with a Â£12 price tag! In a nutshell it's a nice hotel in a good location but i have stayed in Thistle hotels which are as good!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: awenzl
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the JW in January. I stayed with my brother-in-law so I requested two twin beds. We were placed in a handicapped accessible room on the second floor. It had twin beds and an extra large bathroom. However, the shower was extremely uncomfortable. It consisted of an overhead faucet surrounded by a curtain (no glass or tub); the gap between the faucet and the curtain was too small so the curtain would cling to your body. I survived, but if I had been traveling with my wife, we would have had to switch rooms. Other than this inconvenience, the hotel was nice but not overly luxurious. My Marriott Gold status gave me access to the Concierge Lounge. We visited it each morning for breakfast. It had a good selection of breakfast items, and the Lounge was well staffedâ€”a definite advantage to staying at this hotel if you have the status. I liked the general location of the hotel, but if I was going again, I would stay at the Marriott Marble Arch. It is a five minute walk up Park Lane from the JW, and is adjacent to the Tube stop. This would have been more convenient. Overall, I would rate my stay as satisfactory considering the class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Burns Nite Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ClaireQPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night to celebrate a Burns Nite in the Great Room in the hotel. So to stay there and go to the ball in the same place without having to go out was really wonderful. Check in was a little wait, but nothing to worry about. As the hotel was not full we got upgraded to a superior room which was really large and very unexpected. Lovely furnishings, very comfy bed, and great bathroom and lots of lovely little extras. I especially loved the ground floor bar area where they serve afternoon tea - with a pianist tinkling away in the background. The staff were excellent. The hotel was very clean, for such a large place. Only one observation - there could have been tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but that aside I will definantely be going back. Value for money it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Howard M
Reviews.Content: Rambling old Hotel nicely redone by Marriott. Decorated in the traditional Marriott style, rooms are comfortalble and range from Very Large with nice views to rather small and dark. Service has typical Marriott style if a bit impersonal at times. Excellent location in Mayfair while close to Oxford Street shopping. Decent, if expensive, restaurant options and lots of other options at all price points in the neighborhood. Nice gym and park across the street for exercise options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DenisEire
Reviews.Content: good quality, friendly staff, cannot put my finger on it, but it just did not feel like it hit the right buttons. gym was the standard marriott city centre fair utilizing converted rooms. staff were friendly, f&b ok, well located to shopping on regent and oxford street, close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: cymruseren
Reviews.Content: My partner took us to the Grosvenor as an anniversary treat and it was amazing. Doormen in top hats opened the doors for us and we could only marvel at the foyer and reception they were so grand. Check in was very welcoming though they didn't mention when breakfast was served until so we had to ask later (it's 11am). We had a 3rd floor room on the corner of the building so we had 3 big windows and lots of space, with a bed so vast you couldn't reach each other from either side. Beautiful marble bathroom with 2 different shower heads (we used the giant one, heaven!). My only minor gripe would be the lack of tea and coffee facilities in the room, yes it's a 5 star hotel but I do expect to be able to make myself a cup of tea when I fancy one (I wasn't prepared to pay the room service prices for one cup of tea) and it's easy enough to tuck a kettle and such away in a cupboard if they're concerned about it spoiling the look of a room. Having stayed in other 5 star Marriots where tea and coffee facilities are freely available I was rather surprised. Aside from that we had a wonderful stay, the bed was extremely comfy and breakfast was amazing, you can quite easily eat enough to last you all day. We had dinner at the JW Steakhouse one night which I can highly recommend for the quality of food and the service. We'll definitely be coming back next again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite London Marriott, so far”
Reviews.Author: MarkInHouston
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Marriott I have stayed at in London, and is easily my new favorite. I got a nice one-class upgrade, thanks to status. The staff was very nice and helpful. There are some things to do around the hotel, which is the problem with their St Pancras property... The bathroom was very nice, as well. It might have been the first hotel bathtub that was clean enough and nice enough to take a bath in. Nothing bad to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room but only what you should expect from a top price hotel.”
Reviews.Author: happy1507
Reviews.Content: Lovely room - I was upgraded. Reception staff excellent, genuine and going the extra mile to provide first class service. We ate in the JW Steak house which has good reviews on all the websites, however the service here was extremely poor, the specials were promoted by the staff but when we ordered them they had 'sold out' of three out of 5 of the main course choices. The staff ignored us when we arrived and we had to wait over 5 minutes to be seated (they were having a conversation amongst themselves). The tables were dirty from uncleared plates although the restaurant was very quiet customer wise. What out for the advertised prices on the room rates - VAT is excluded.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: rd3audi
Reviews.Content: Lovely place but couldnt afford to stay there long , great location for all over London though

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations”
Reviews.Author: Philip A
Reviews.Content: In September 2011 I made a reservation for two rooms and notified in advance that I would be arriving early at 12noon. Upon arrival at check-in it seemed rather chaotic, only one room was ready. Eventually, after another 90mins both rooms were ready. One room was a good size with a limited view of the outside world, the other room was of smaller size and a view of an inner courtyard resembling a prison - both these rooms were booked and charged as Executive rooms - I made my feelings of disappointment known. Having been to this hotel many years ago, I was expecting to use the swimming pool (beautiful as I remember it) only to find that it is not used at all - another disappointment. Also, there used to be a very good restaurant in the hotel which served English/French cuisine and a piano being played in the background - that has now gone to be replaced with a steak restaurant which is very downmarket. I was silly enough to leave some ties and silk handkerchiefs behind and I requested the hotel send them on to me - the ties arrived but no handkerchiefs (I can only assume they had been stolen). Overall, great expectations turned into a great disappointment - the hotel is not what I would describe as five star - a great pity.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Ian J
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Grosvenor House, it's been years since I last stayed. Room was very comfortable and well appointed, large bathroom with ample towels, robes and quality toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: kimbo25
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here a couple of weeks ago. We had a standard double room which was quite large with a good size bathroom. The bathroom however was a little dated. Nothing wrong with it. Just a few tweaks. The bed was amazing. Very very comfy and great pillow. Takes about 15-20 mins walk max to get to Knightsbridge and about the same to Oxford street. There are no bars or restaurants in the immediate area, but not far.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night and could not really appreciate it to the full extent of the services/facilities available. Large reception and many beautiful communal areas. Itâ€™s a beautiful historical building perfectly located. Beautiful was also the room I was given, it was also very large with a large bathroom. Service was up to the expected standards. Next time I will be in London for pleasure I will definitively try to book a room at the Grosvenor.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work during a conference. Room was a decent size (by European standards), lots of wardrobe space for clothes. Furnishings are not as high-end as I would otherwise expect from a JW Marriott, but clean. Location is right by Hyde Park and convenient to many tube stations. I liked that they provided 2 bottles of water each day; one day they didn't end up making up my room (the cleaners' schedule and mine kept conflicting), I called down to see if they might bring up the water anyway -- within 5 mins I had 4 bottles of water. Good service. Staff generally pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Buckingham Palace and USA Embassy”
Reviews.Author: boat33
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 Nights, Very Nice 5 star Hotel at 5 star price. The Rooms are excellent. Very Modern and luxurious and I had basic room, Take Tour of the hotel lots of history, special the converted Ice skating ring that queen used to visit when She was young. With World 2 history for USA forces in London. The cost is expensive for groups, unless its high end, But its great for that special occasion in London.. Breakfast is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Show and Stay Break”
Reviews.Author: MauriceIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel,as part of a package which included tickets to see a Westend show,and it was faultless,the staff were very polite and helpful,and on booking in we were given a complimentary upgrade to a Superior room, which was very comfortable,it also included breakfast which was also of a very high standard.the hotel is very clean and comfortable throughout, and we are already planning a return visit,although not cheap it is well worth the extra

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: 44Jon
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great service, took note of all our pre-check-in requests, and had excellent facilities

Reviews.Title: “five stars hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: siba1711
Reviews.Content: I suggest this hotel for those who would like to stay in the center of london. Marble Arch ,Oxford street and Hyde Park within walking distanca .Good hotel,kind staff and great service.the room was spacious comaring with the other london hotels.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Stay”
Reviews.Author: Luv2WorldTvl
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at this hotel and still love it. Very traditional and elegant hotel, comfy beds, large room. Staff all were very nice to deal with, including those in the business center. Great location, easy walk to the stores on Oxford Street, but hotel itself actually in quiet location. No noise from hallway or outside (we had a courtyard room, top floor, with view of Hyde Park). Rooms made up the moment you left in the morning, and turndown at night was most welcome. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “When in London...Elegance”
Reviews.Author: ceccina
Reviews.Content: Another late review but this one was five stars no doubt about it. The on site steakhouse is first rate. The manager came to say hello, we started speaking italian and then it was espresso corretto on the house. Great location for seeing the City. In Rome go for local charm, in London go for elegance. We were here in August while the Royal family was away so we got to tour the palace. Too cool. Go for the club floor where you have complimentary breakfast, evening snacks and cocktails, and free wifi for the teens. Worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious Christmas Weekend”
Reviews.Author: WildWilliam
Reviews.Content: Three couples stayed December 17, 2011 at the beginning of our Christmas trip, then ended by staying 2 more nights, the 24th and 25th. All 3 nights were truly first class - Marriott at its best. Elegant, very well equipped rooms, serviced by friendly, courteous staff - not stuffy, just perfectly attentive. Located on Park Lane across from Hyde Park, a couple of short blocks south of Oxford Street shopping and a few minutes walk north of Harrods. Great in-house, as well as local area restaurants. Very surprised, on Christmas morning, to find a full size red stocking on our door knob, with large, chocolate Santa Claus, white chocolate snowman, and a large, mixed bag of nuts and dried fruit! Excellent rates for London hotel, whether using the cancelable "senior" rate of 169 pounds, or the pre-paid internet rate of 159 pounds. One of the best hotels in one of the best locations in one of the best cities in Europe! Go if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Grosvenor House and wi -fi”
Reviews.Author: Gillian O
Reviews.Content: I think it is disgraceful that having paid Â£274 for a room for the night the hotel charge for wi-fi connection - I get free wi-fi on my bus from Oxford. I will NOT stay at a JW Marriott hotel again in protest for them being so money grubbing!!

Reviews.Title: “Grosvenor, New Year Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: hammered66
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights over the new year at this hotel to celebrate new year & my wife Rachel's 50th birthday. We arrived on the 30th december an hour too early to get into our room. We were then offered an upgrade to a Park View suite after waiting for about ninety minutes, my wife's face when we walked into the rooms was well worth the wait. She & I loved the suite & the excellent service we received during our stay. All the staff at this hotel were polite, pleasant & very attentive which made our stay all the better, thank you & a happy new year to all the staff. Whenever we are in London we will always book the Grosvenor House Hotel, its magic!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gib_jac
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay in this hotel but we got such a good offer we thought we should give it a go. We were not disappointed. We had no problem checking in and what a pleasant and helpful receptionist she was. We went to the rooms and the luggage followed almost immediately. The room was at the back and was clean, spacious and had everything you needed i.e. hair dryer, ironing board and iron etc. The bed has to have been the most comfortable one I have slept in and the cotton sheets felt like silk they were so smooth. The hotel also ranks as one of the quietest we have ever slept in. You normally hear some of the small noises of a hotel functioning around you but not hear it was so quiet you felt you had to whisper. They still have the bed turn down system which has fallen out of favour in so many hotels nowadays and something the other half found quaint. As for breakfast it is nice to see bacon that is real and not a mass produced product, eggs cooked to order along with waffles and pancakes etc. Great choice and well worth paying the extra to add it on to your room rate, even if your other half just has coffee!! You can walk to all the main shopping streets in London so you save on the hassle of the underground. The price for a cup of coffee at Â£5.75 did seem a little steep but you are paying for the surroundings. Cheaper beer and coffee can be obtained at the pub just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up to its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: LiandYu
Reviews.Content: The Grosvenor House is possibly a little less glamorous than it used to be, but overall it is still one of London's better hotels. We got a nice upgrade and the staff were, for the most part, courteous and helpful. Some bathrooms are more modern than others.

Reviews.Title: “Sales in London”
Reviews.Author: Motorsportenthuisias
Reviews.Content: Traveled to London with family after Christmas, they wanted to be near shopping and this hotel is the best location for Oxford street. A very good hotel, reasonable rates for London and close to a couple of very good restaurants in North Audley street, Prezzo and La Genova.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: rometohongkong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, with easy access to everything. The room we had was good sized and extremely comfortable, with a nicely appointed bathroom. And our room was very quiet. Excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing when considering the price.”
Reviews.Author: t11myb
Reviews.Content: The Grosvenor is very impressive on arrival with its flags flying & security wearing formal suits & top hats. The door attendants opened our taxi doors & were very welcoming, getting our luggage out and offering to carry it inside for us. They also open the door for you everytime you leave/enter & are really friendly each time & ask if you need a taxi calling. The reception hall really is grand & smelled beautiful the whole time we were there. The lounge & bar areas were also tastefully decorated and very clean at all times. As were the toilets downstairs. I also thought the little shop was a nice touch & very handy. The location of the hotel is very good as we were staying for New Year & wanted to visit Hyde Park's Wonderland & go shopping. Park Lane is also a nice area to walk around so we felt safe there too. There weren't many staff on the reception & a couple managed to push in front of us at another desk which was a little annoying, it wouldn't have been better if the 2 staff they did have were on 1 desk so people could adhere to normal queuing practices. The lady who greeted us said our room wasn't ready yet (understandable, we were early) and that we could wait in the lounge we got with our Junior Suite until 3pm however, it was only 11am so we did not want to do this! We asked what sort of time the room could be ready as we wanted to go out for lunch & did not get an answer, just another description of the lounge & a point towards the lift! She told us to check-in in the lounge and did not offer to take our luggage from us until the room was ready (we presumed they would do this upstairs at this point). We carted all our stuff up to the lounge on the 7th floor only to find we needed a room key to get in which we didn't have! Had to knock for a while until a guest kindly let us in - we could have been anyone of the streets though! The lounge was quite small so not enough room for everyone to sit, we went to the check-in desk there & were still told we couldn't get in our room but they could call us when we could. We then had to drag all our luggage back downstairs to leave with the consierge while we left as we couldn't do this upstairs! They did however ring us whilst we were out to tell us the room was ready. When we got back to the hotel the consierge brought us our bags but no offer to take them to our suite, quite disappointing when we were paying Â£1200 for 2 nights stay! The room was quite nice, very clean & no problems but there were not tea/coffee amenities so we had to keep going up to floor 7 (from 5th) to our lounge to get free teas & coffees. The view wasn't good either, only looking at other buildings which again was disappointing for the price. On New Years Eve we sat in the lobby having drinks with some friends & a lovely Indian lady waited on us, unfortunately I didn't catch her name but she really was sweet. We watched the firworks at midnight along the Thames & came back to the bar afterwards for more drinks. We ordered some sandwiches at Â£16 each but were disappointed when brought us brown bread (we asked for white) and really salty fries after a 45 minute wait! It wasn't that busy either at 1.30am! Had they have been normal prices we wouldn't mind but we expected more for Â£16, we didn't complain though for fear of waiting another 45 minutes! The same lady waited on us still though & was as friendly and kind as earlier. The housekeeping staff were also great, our room was cleaned nicely and turned down at night. They were also polite when they passed us in the corridors. I have been to many nice hotels around the world including Dubai, New York & Paris so I wouldn't moan over nothing, just a little disappointed with some things considering the price paid for 2 nights - it was never going to be cheap I know but other hotels did have better rates. I would stay again so I hope these few problems can be rectified for the sake of others.

Reviews.Title: “Three nights in December, all good!”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here arriving on Boxing Day right after Christmas. We walked from Victoria Station though you can take a bus or taxi to hotel. Stayed on 7th floor and had access to Elite Club. Had a wonderful relaxing breakfast, afternoon tea, early evening cocktails and appetizers there every night. Room was quiet, big size, nice shower especially for Europe. Staff is excellent! Decor is fine...Location ROCKS! We walk, we really walk. Picked up a bus tours map and in two days we did it all and more from our hotel. We loved eating on James Street just off Oxford (shopping) which was only a few blocks away. Short, very short walk to Hilton for some awesome drinks (below Hilton). Very close to theatre. Took a taxi to see Billy Elliot and then walked back at night past Buckingham Palace. Right across the street from Hyde Park. Plan on returning with my two daughters in February. Not cheap but money saved with Elite Club, walking without paying transportation makes this hotel worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “London at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: CS1Dallas
Reviews.Content: There remains no place better for the Christmas vibe than London with the city decorations and the hustle and excitement of the residents and tourists alike. The GH Marriott is superbly located for that morning run in Hyde Park and that afternoon stroll around Mayfair. The rooms are clean and attractive, the front desk very hospitable, delightful doormen and competent dining/drinking services provided from three outlets. Ask for a corner, slightly larger room with extra space to hide your luggage (323/322)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be a Better Location and Hospitality Experience in London”
Reviews.Author: rikwynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. It's right on Hyde park - a short 5 minute walk from anything going on in the park (Winter Wonderland for example). It's also a 5 minute walk to Oxford Street and 10 mins to Regent Street with all of the shopping you could ever want. We toured London for 3 days and never had to use the tube. The double decker tour busses are a 5 min walk from the hotel. The Concierge Lounge here is fantastic with food and drinks available all day. The room was beautifully appointed and everything worked well. Bathroom is white marble everywhere. JW Steakhouse food was excellent. Dont miss the fresh baked rolls! Can walk through the park to Harrods and that part of the city and even home from the British Museum if you want. Almost everything is walkable from this hotel! Paddington train Station is a 15 min walk and the Heathrow Express train runs directly to Paddington making the journey from Heathrow to the hotel 35 mins including the walk. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average rating for provision of low standard for 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_Ilkley
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Park Land Marriott and the Grosvenor Square Marriott I was looking for to staying for 3 nights at the Marriotts flag ship hotel J W Marriott. I was very disappointed by my stay. I travelled with my son of 11. We asked for a twin room. On arrival after a short wait at the reception we were given the keys to our room. It turned out to be a room suitable for wheelchair requirement/access guests. The red chords hanging down by the beds were a bit off putting but i guess needed for guests with special needs. However the bathroom didn't have a bath and the shower was suitable for a wheel chair to be rolled into. Personally I rarely shower and love to soak in a big tub. The room was also very dark and over looked a grim scene out of the window. So we asked to be moved. The next room seemed ok until the morning when the maids started working. The noise was incrediblly loud. We actually felt like they were in the room with us. We had a door in our bedroom which inter connected to the maids room. Again we asked to move. This time we had to pack everything up which was a bit of nuisance as we were missing out on fun times around London. The hotel did offer to move our bags so off we went out for the day. We got back and asked for new room keys. This time when we got to our room there were no twin beds just one king size. By this time we gave up and decided to stay. Given the bed was so big it wasn't so bad sharing but still I think it was poor service to not provide a twin room. The view from the room was also slightly better. However the lighting in the room was very dark. We made use of the executive lounge while we were there. This was also probably one of the worst exec lounges I've used. The food was ok but there was always a shortage of tables and seating. In addition the soft drinks in the coolers were nearly always warm as the fridges were too small for the stock needed. The ice bucket never had any ice. It was always melted. The staff in the lounge always looked miserable too. The hotel also felt incredibly un British apart from the two jolly door staff we met and had a chat with. I think they were Londoners. They made up for the fact the place was staffed mainly by people whose first language was not english. In fact they were a credit to the Marriott as they were so helpful getting us a taxi and ensuring we got in and out of it OK. They made the trip that little bit more special. However I think next time I will be staying at the Grosvenor Square Marriott. The trip was paid for on points and we did complain about the service and treatment to the management of the hotel upon our return. We did receive a letter of apology and 16% of the points we used to pay for the trip back. Which I actually thought was poor and we should have been recompensed with a few more points.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at the Grosvenor House”
Reviews.Author: LivingstonBfi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Grosvenor House in London in December. the hotel is elegant and the rooms are spacious, lovely and comfortable. There are several bars and a wonderful coffee shop for snacks. As Marriott Gold Card members we had use of their Executive Lounge which provided a decent breakfast and snacks throughout the day. That was a great perk since everything in London is so expensive. The hotel is located in a very upscale area and not a far walk from most places with easy access to the shopping on Oxford Street, Hyde Park, and Knightsbridge area and Harrods Department Store.

Reviews.Title: “Great combo of old world and new in a super London location”
Reviews.Author: trvlgirl13
Reviews.Content: Although I usually choose Marriott hotels since I'm a sucker for the points, I have to say that The Grosvenor House was an excellent choice regardless. The location is fantastic -- easy walking distance from all the main shopping and just steps away from the Underground. But besides the location, the hotel has a great blend of old-world charm with the modern touches you want away from home. The bathroom was large, which for me is unexpected in a London hotel, and there was ample space to move about the bedroom. As a Marriott rewards member, I was able to take advantage of the business lounge which offered free breakfast in the morning and snacks and cocktails at night. The breakfast was a nice bonus as food can be expensive in London. This hotel is definitely geared towards the business traveler, but my 14 year old niece liked it as well and really took advantage of the free wi-fi in the business lounge. If you are looking for a central spot to stay in London and are used to the amenities and size of an American-style hotel, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of High Rating”
Reviews.Author: JWK_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2011 The front desk was extremely friendly and obliging The room was beautiful and the bed as in all Marriott was super You can not get a better location in London,combined by great service excellent food and overall excellence this Hotel deserves all the praise heaped on it

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RussS11
Reviews.Content: Looking a little dated inside with a poor bar but great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the 3 nights at Grosvenor House....great location. The deluxe rooms were excellent size for London and the facilities can be faulted. Internet charges are expensive. Brilliant facility for informal meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: outonthehills
Reviews.Content: The warm friendly welcome from the staff in the lobby set the scene for a great stay. Room was spacious and comfortable with plenty of character. The location was good and I chose to stroll along Park Lane to the tube station which was a treat for a visitor to London. The perfect hotel for a relaxing trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Grosvenor House Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodderRER
Reviews.Content: I am highest Elite level with several hotels and Executive Platinum with American Airlines, so I travel extensively. Some of the highest rated hotels are good some a better. The Grosvenor House was by far one of the best hotels I have stayed at. From the time of check in, the bar area, concierge, every aspect of this hotel was outstanding. The location was perfect. Close to Harrods, Selfridges and other attractions. Walked to these â€œattractions.â€� I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: traveller021
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel which we could not fault. From the excellent attention we received on check in to the excellent attention we received on check out. Our room was a large king which did not dissappoint. A bed to die for, superb storage and wardrobe space and good size sitting area. The bathroom was equally impressive with towels having been changed every time we returned to our room. The staff throughout the hotel were helpful and courteous and could not do enough to ensure our stay was what we hoped for. Food in the Steakhouse was excellent and the atmosphere was excellent. Excellent location for travel with tube stations and bus stops very close to the hotel. Taxis also sat outside the hotel and were readily available. Walking distance to Knightsbridge shopping.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would be happy to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grosvenor House for 3 nights on a recent trip to London which cost 35,000 Marriott points per night. Here are the highlights of our stay: 1. Location- The Grosvenor House was located on Park Lane, halfway between the Hyde Park and Oxford Street tube stops. I think it was slightly closer to the Oxford St. tube but it was a pleasant to walk through the streets of Mayfair to get to the shops on Piccadilly. We also liked the fact that we were near the Piccadilly line which we used to get to/from Heathrow. Hyde Park was just across the street. 2. Room- Our room was well appointed with all the usual features (flat screen tv, safe, minibar, umbrella, robe, slippers). There was a turn-down service each night and a complimentary Times newspaper was delivered daily to our door. There was also complimentary Hildon water left in the room each day. Last of all, I really appreciated the fact that the desk had a plug for American electrical items since I had forgotten to bring an adapter. 3. Wifi- There was high-speed internet access available for a charge but it was free for Marriott Platinum and Gold Elite members. 4. Service- Everyone we encountered at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. 5. Fitness Center- The Grosvenor House had a decent sized fitness facility which consisted 7 treadmills,some elliptical machines and a free weight area. 6. Executive Lounge- We had access to the 7th floor lounge during our stay and it was amazing. There was an enormous breakfast buffet from 6-10 am, tea in the afternoons and then happy hour in the evenings where a variety of beer, wine and heavy hors dâ€™oeuvres (cruditÃ©s, cheese, empanadas, spring rolls, hummus, etc..) were served from 5:30 â€“ 8:00 pm. After that, I think there was a dessert buffet til 10 pm. Everything that we sampled was excellent. The only drawback to being in the lounge was the overwhelming number of families with small noisy children whose parents permitted them to run around and yell. However, we got around this simply by taking our food and beverages back to our room (blessedly quiet despite facing Park Lane). Admittedly the Grosvenor House Marriott didn't have â€œolde worldeâ€� English charm, we thought it was extremely convenient and a perfect base for exploring central London. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: des16
Reviews.Content: A lovely grand hotel, only a bit weathered by age. The bathrooms are all updated, but contain the magnificent fixtures, marble, and character of days long gone. They have done a good job maintaining the character of the hotel, keeping it updated and fresh looking. But if you are looking for intimate charm and a modern comtemporary look, this is not the place for you. Room sizes vary dramatically. If you are in one of the large kings, or even larger queens, you have plenty of space. Beware that there are many small queens with hardly space for a chair.

Reviews.Title: “A old grande dame, still”
Reviews.Author: suitcasepro
Reviews.Content: This well known landmark hotel is, after many decades, still an ok place to stay. It has been renovated (yet again), and still has nearly all the attributes it had when I first stayed there in 1980. How many hotels have a separate ballroom entrance? In any case, its strong points are its location on Park Lane, many (but not all) quiet rooms, and the low rate we get. It has some weak points too: (1) very few, somewhat inattentive staff behind the desk who take 10-15 minutes just to check you in, and seem much more interested in chit-chatting; (2) very narrow hallways--at one point my hallway was just 30" wide!; (3) vast groups of slow-moving tourists who clog up the taxi line just when you are in a rush. Internet very spotty. All in all, really pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Very good central London luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_constant
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this very large hotel (500 rooms) on about 6 occasions, always on business. The hotel is very well located in central London on Park Lane, close to the main attractions and shopping areas. Rooms are very comfortable, are well-appointed and soundproofed, and the staff have been helpful. Overall a good top-end London hotel in the manner of upper scale Marriotts. On one occasion I was upgraded to a suite which was fantastic. On the downside, everything is very expensive in the manner of central London hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fcmoll
Reviews.Content: We have tried other hotels in London but we know what we are getting at this hotel and we like the service and the location. We are alway guaranteed a good comfy bed and a clean room. Rooms are not that big even when you have a suite and the bathrooms are considerably small. But it is clean and comfy. Our daughter loves this hotel, whenever, we bring her to London she wants to stay here. When at breakfast she noticed one of the ladies waiting the tables was the same lady that had been there on her first visit 9 years ago - that speaks volumes for this hotel. And that lady went a long way to keeping my daughter loyal. It is such a shame they have done away with their Theatre Concierge - this was alway a great asset. Having lounge access is a great bonus, such a shame they don't make this room larger and with a view. Afternoon Tea is always a delight, highly recommend you take time to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Adventure09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within easy walking distance of Oxford street and Hyde Park so is ideal if that is on your agenda. The hotel was full the weekend when we were there which meant there were a few minor issues, like queues and no tables in the bar. The executive rooms are well worth the extra money as food and drink are essentially included in the price at the help your self executive lounge, which had a great choice, although again this was very busy. the extras in teh room such as robes and slippers are a nice luxury touch. The rooms are quite small but perfectly formed, we asked for and got an upgrade. The air conditioning in the corridors is quite noisy so if you are one of those people that can't sleep with annoying humming noises give it a miss!

Reviews.Title: “a generally positive experience”
Reviews.Author: dutch68008
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively including return trips to the UK. This hotel has become a favorite of ours. The staff is attentive, the amenities very good and the rooms, particularly for London, are spacious. The Marriott Chain has done wonders rennovating this fine old hotel while preservign its historical charm. In short the experience was way above average. Our only complait was that we were accomodated on the 1st floor and the street noise...even with the double pane windows was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jomf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights during the week. We were allocated a queen room at check in, after viewing it we asked for a king room. Good move. Lovely large room, sumptuous bed, on the eighth floor. No noise disturbance from either guests or outside (unusual for London Hotels). We didn't eat at the hotel but will try the restaurant next time. It was busy, which is always a good sign. Close enough to the tube to be walkable. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will use this hotel in the future for our London trips.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Definitely old world feel but adds to the charm of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room... 3rd time lucky!”
Reviews.Author: mkjan13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Grosvenor House just one night a year for the past 5 years after attending an annual charity function at the hotel. We have always had a large room with a huge bed and have always been highly delighted with the service and facilities. This time I checked in on my own to be met by my husband later in the day and was given a room on the third floor, which I discovered had a standard 4' 6" (small) double bed. We have a super king 6ft bed at home so a standard double feels very restricting compared to what we are used to. The hotel room was a good size and would easily fit a king size bed and having previous experience of the hotel and knowing that one night's b&b is Â£282 (though we were not paying) I rang reception from the room and ask to change. I was told that the hotel was full and therefore this was not possible (even though it was only 3pm so obvious that not all rooms had been allocated). The girl told me she was responsible for room allocation so it was no good me asking to speak to anyone else. Also, I looked out of the window and saw a rooftop of noisy generators so, feeling fobbed off I decided to change tack and went in person to reception to ask for a quieter room. Sure enough it worked and I was allocated a room on the 8th floor which the receptionist assured me had a different aspect. When I got there I look out of the window and saw that it had the same aspect just a higher floor, and this time there was the added noise of generators from the roof (plus the same small bed). I returned again to reception, and this time met with the guest relations manager who acknowledged my inconvenience and gave us a free upgrade to a junior suite on the 2nd floor, overlooking a quiet side street. It was a huge room with a large living area... with what I really wanted all along... a big comfy bed! At the end of the day we just wanted a quiet and good night's sleep, and even though we only stayed one night it really made a huge difference to the enjoyment and comfort of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime spot on Park Lane”
Reviews.Author: SalisburyFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and a friend in a single room, visited Grosvenor House in November and had an excellent stay. We had a large room overlooking a quiet side street, and could see the London Eye in the distance; our friend had a large room on the opposite side of the hotel. Both of the rooms had excellent beds and bathrooms, and each of the rooms had wonderful appointments. Although the rooms' decorations were a bit old-fashioned, the elements--bedding, towels, closets, incidentals--were top-notch. We had such a peaceful and comfortable night's sleep each night. The service to the room was impeccable. We used Marriott points for both rooms and, as a consequence of our Platinum status, were given access to the Executive Lounge. The lounge was most pleasant and had delicious and plentiful food mornings and evenings, and a delicious assortment of cakes and scones at tea. ( It is always so disappointing at American Executive Lounges in the Marriott group--while breakfasts can be fine, food at other times of the day is perfunctory and it is incredibly disappointing that the U.S. lounges are not open on the weekends.) We also loved this hotel's location, right across from Hyde Park and so close to all the shopping and other attractions in Mayfair. We did notice enormous queues at the check-out desk in the mornings, but were delighted that we could check out in the lounge. All in all, a wonderful five days in a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott does it again!”
Reviews.Author: STAR_CHASERS
Reviews.Content: The goal of the entire staff is to satisfy the guest... I have had the privilege of visiting the UK four instances prior to this one, my entire experience was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, top location, lovely food, snotty service!”
Reviews.Author: colinlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my family and it was an absolute treat! Lovely room, possibly the best location (poshest location!) in London and lovely food. Only 2 downsides were: The price of the food is a bit on the silly side! The cheapest steak (6 oz) was Â£33. 3 x mini burgers for lunch, no veg, salad or chips - Â£18!! We also had no tea and coffee making facilities in our room which I had to ring down for, twice, as it took an age to be delivered (I get the feeling one is supposed to pay for posh tea/ coffee at Park Lane prices) Some of the staff have a seriously miserable attitude. I read a few other reviews highlighting how they speak to apparently more 'important' looking guests in a different manner and I agree. After a long day in London we pushed our 3 year old in her push chair in past the door man, who when my wife asked where we could get something to eat suggested the petrol station down the road (I presumed he must have misheard the request or I would have had some serious words!). At check out, which had a long que, my wife finally got to the front and Victoria at reception asked her if she had just que jumped! Victoria et al need to remember they are receptionists in a Marriott hotel and not millionaire guests! The one real positive was the Indian chap in the hotel Steakhouse who was very very friendly and gave my little girl a Grosvenor dog (teddy bear) which she loves. Thank you :o) Would I stay again?? Oh yes, but staff please lose the attitude, learn to smile at all guests as you never know who you're serving. If you really are miserable get another job!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TraceyTurnip
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel really for the location, for a weekend break. Swanky address without the swanky pricetag. Overlooking Hyde Park, and ideally located for the famous shopping locations. Efficient check in, without a great deal of warmth, and unfortunately this seemed to be a theme throughout the weekend. Our room on the 8th floor was nicely decorated, and the marble bathroom was impressive. The room itself was small, but was fine for a couple of nights. Our room was to the side, so our view was across to the landmark of Battersea Power Station. Walked all weekend, which was a nice way to see some of the poshest parts of London, however the hotel is handy for the underground. We got a cab to the Apollo Victoria to see Wicked, and I think we were Â£10 one way including the tip. On Friday night we had a late reservation for Corrigans Mayfair, which although in the same building is actually outside and round the corner. Wow, was so relaxed for a high end restaurant, and amazing food and drinks, although very rich. Didn't bother with breakfast on Saturday morning as my husband had a shave booked at Trumpers in Curzon Street, but did venture in on Sunday.....wish we hadn't bothered. Remember my earlier comment about swanky price tags! Breakfast in the hotel is an expensive affair, which would be fine if it was reflected in the service or quality of food. My husband ordered porridge to be followed by eggs benedict, the waitress couldn't understand why you would want to, or manage to eat your porridge at the same time as your eggs, and my omlette was a sorry excude. On checking the bill we had been charged for a fruit juice which we didn't order. The host 'inspected' our table on the way past to have a very animated conversation with the waitress. Honestly after spending Â£50 on breakfast, I'm hardly likely to try to con an orange juice. My husband refused to pay the service charge, which was still on the bill when we checked out. Had afternoon tea in the Park Room on Sunday afternoon before leaving for the airport. Sat facing huge windows overlooking Park Lane, and across to Hyde Park. Felt most guilty scoffing my scones & clotted cream, while watching the personal trainers 'working' their clients in the park! Was a lovely experience, very relaxing listening to the pianist knocking out tunes from Ave Maria to Beyonce! Beautiful selection of dainty sandwiches and cakes, and plenty of tea.....yum yum!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gman48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the JW Marriott Grosvenor House for a special occasion using Marriott points. Firstly the hotel is an a great location 5 minutes walk to Marble Arch underground and Oxford Street and slightly longer to Hyde Park Corner and Knightsbridge. Located on Park Lane this is a very exclusive part of London, the hotel exudes luxury from the moment you enter the lobby. Check in was quick and we were welcomed by the guest relations manager personally. I am a Marriott Rewards Gold card member and we were upgraded to a Junior Suite on the executive floor (Level 7). The room was very spacious with a large 46" TV in the lounge area and a smaller TV in the separate Bedroom area. The bathroom was also spacious and fully marble. There was a rain shower with a separate detachable head temperature & pressure were good. The room was in immaculate condition. We went to the executive lounge which is quiet and has room for about 20-30 people. There was complementary wine and beer with snacks - this was the first JW Marriott I have stayed in where there was complementary alcohol. When we got back to our room they had left a dozen chocolate dipped strawberries and a note to welcome us to the hotel on our special occasion - very nice touch. The bed was very comfortable and the room was really quiet all night, probably one of the most silent rooms I have ever stayed in - we live in the country and staying in the city normally upsets our sleep but not here! The staff were excellent during our stay from the concierge who helped us with West End theatre tickets to the Executive Lounge staff who were very attentive and pleasant, even the cleaning staff were courteous and pleasant which can be hard to find in London. Overall we could not speak any higher of this hotel - I travel a lot and have stayed in JW Marriott's around the world and this was possibly the best experience we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Extortionate Bar Prices!”
Reviews.Author: col35
Reviews.Content: Attending an Awards Ceremony in this impressive hotel was a great experience. The venue was excellent and was laid out superbly well. However, whilst you would expect to pay premium prices for such a grand venue - they were not just preium - but "rip off"! At Â£36 for their cheapest bottle of 'house' wine and almost Â£7 for a 330 ml bottle of Peroni beer - make sure you have deep pockets or access to a visa!! Great experience - would have been so much better with affordable drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, upscale with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: CheapAssTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in the Grosvenor house in London, one of the nicer hotels I have been at the bed was very big and comfortable, large room and bathroom. Very clean and a good view. I used up some Marriott points to stay here, although if doing again I would have stayed at the marble arch Marriott right down the street for two reasons: 1. less expensive, alot less points and 2. much closer to a subway station. Grosvenor house was in a good location but it was a bit of a walk to get to any underground station, probably not a problem for most of the guests here (very upscale). I thought I would splurge with my points and yes it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old Lady”
Reviews.Author: rich5wolves
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a while ago and found the lobby and restaurant and particularly their grand function room to be very elegant indeed. The same cannot be said fo the rooms however.
