The bathroom was immense, just the actual bed area was quite dark and not I would describe as below average size, certainly for one of the big 5 star London Hotels. Location is great and I reccommend Signor Sassis Italian restaurant which is easily walkable! I would stay here again for a good rate but would deffinately choose the Dorchester over this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hot-Sauce-50
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, as you might expect from the 5* rating (and the prices) Rooms are well appointed and the super king size bed was a great treat. Am I being churlish to say that in room Tea/Coffee making facilities would have made it even better? Couldn't believe that you can still get smoking bedrooms in UK - as a smoker this was great but my partner was delighted that there was no smell of smoke in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The best accommodation I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Potakas
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect according to my stay there. I booked online the cheapest guest room and I was upgraded at check in on an executive suite (>Â£1000) because of my Platinum status with Marriott. The club lounge is not very good but the suite was excellent. Concierge desk was always very helpful and they were able to sort out all of our requests. They got us a chauffeur service transport to Heathrow with a Jaguar for only Â£50.

Reviews.Title: “Great service-comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: mellengal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a recent business trip. I arrived ~ noon from US & asked if I could check in early. The available room was smaller than my reserved room so the staff member immediately "comped" me free breakfast for my stay. My room was small but the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and very clean. Due to a business meeting, I was only able to use the free breakfast for 1 day. So Uupon check-out, I asked if I could get free internet instead & charge was immediately removed from my bill! Toll-free numbers are only 2 pounds to connect- which was cheaper than the international rate my mobile carrier provides. This was a bonus & I was able to participate in teleconference with home office for a reasonable rate. Staff was very helpful guiding me to local restaurants - the Running Footman is a great nearby pub . Bond street is close by & I was able to do some shopping one evening as most stores close at 9 pm!. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott option in the heart of Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: RLB_NYC
Reviews.Content: I personally love this hotel. Great bang for the buck, especially if your stay earns you Marriott points - or if you redeem them here! Recently renovated rooms, great bathrooms. Maybe it's not the Connaught or the Dorchester but it's totally lovely, the prices are reasonable (for a 5 star hotel in London) and the location really cannot be beat. The 7th floor executive suite is quite nice as well. This is my go-to spot in London and has been for a LONG time (even before the Marriott flag!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - But Staff / Service Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jleeman
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at the Grosvenor Hotel. The hotel itself is very nice although pricey. About $800 per night for the room we stayed in. I suppose thats on par with other hotels in the area but unfortunately much of the staff and overall service wasn't what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. One gentleman at the concierge desk was fairly rude when asking for directions. Made eye contact with him asked him for directions, and he then walked into the back room for a moment without saying a word, came back threw a map on the desk and point to where we should go. He seemed upset that we asked him for directions to begin with. I will say that the others working at the concierge desk were helpful during our stay. Then there was the girl minding the door on the backside of the hotel near the restaurant. She just stood there with her hands in her pocket looking at the ground. ONE TIME she actually opened the door when we were there, and that was when a gentlemen of Middle Eastern descent was walking ahead of us. She opened the door, he went through and as we followed behind she said "Where are you going" I said "excuse me", and she asked again "Where are you going".... We said "To our room" we are staying at this hotel.... (really strange). That actually happened twice over the course of 5 days. At the end of the day the hotel is very nice, but do not expect pleasant staff or high end service you would expect from a hotel marketing itself as "5 stars". I've stayed in hotels all over, and I can assure you that the service at this hotel is 3 stars (at best) They do little to make you feel comfortable. On my next trip to London - Ill look for a true 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: romandavydov
Reviews.Content: Spend only one unsleepy night in this hotel from 3 nights booked, because of terrible bed and noise from outside. From first point of view hotel located in good part of London, in it's heart, but 24h traffic around the hotel was terrible. I found staff at reception not attentive taking into account category of the hotel. Arrived by taxi I open the door by myself and no one offer assistance with our luggage. Very arrogant ledy in the hall where check-in even don't send a smile to our side. Absolutly neutral check-in, without any kind of happines from guests arrival. And then, again, no any assisance with our luggage. After 60 countries travelled, and hundreds of hotels stayed through last 10 years, I found this hotel absolutly not worth you money and attention. In our small, but nice furnished room, located at second floor, I found the most uncomfortable bed in the world. Through the night I been unable to find a comfortable position to sleep. I was able to sleep only when mover to sleep to the floor. Finaly, after terrible night and absolute unattentivenes I left the hotel to allow me to sleep during next 2 nights in London. My friend decide to stay in our room, but I left the hotel, again, carrying my luggage on my own. Will never recommend this hotel to no one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Alshepuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our companies Annual Dinner and Dance which was at the Great Room. Our room was free so I cannot comment on value for money. All the staff I came across were helpful but there always seemed to be a queue at reception. I am a light sleeper so was shocked to see that a room was on a junction of 3 corridors. The way the room was configured I did not hear a thing. Saying that we did not get to bed until 02.30 and was out of the room by 08.30. Housekeeping were trying to get into our room at 08.00 so make sure you put the appropiate sign outside. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was very nice. One thing that surprised me was that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in our room. We did not have time for breakfast. The cost of a light breakfast served in the room was Â£26 per person. That seems very expensive to me but I am not used to stayng in top London hotels. If you can afford to stay here then I would say go for it. Great location close to Oxford Street and reasonable walking distance to other major atraction and the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and ideal for exploring the city....”
Reviews.Author: beatlejuice01
Reviews.Content: A typical 5 star hotel - grand reception rooms, good service and well appointed rooms. Good bits - room was spacious and well decked out with usual mod cons , big comfortable bed and a well stocked bar - no kettle though (am I being too British?). Staff were friendly and attentive and overall the hotel was decked out well. Bad bits - pricey (but not a surprise due to the tourist element), wi-fi a little dodgy, the view from the room was a bit grim (but this is an old Victorian Hotel so acceptable).

Reviews.Title: “Near And Better”
Reviews.Author: SikharKiller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very near to the so called shopping place The Oxford street. Very awsum services. Good place to stay in London. It is Just .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, even better with a free room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: mgwhu
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel we had the pleasure of staying in for a weekend break. Bit pricey but with a free upgrade from a standard room to a superior suite, well, thank you Marriott. Our suite was stunning, with a bit of a view through the trees over to Hyde Park. Staff were very attentive and helpful, food is top notch but drinks are heavily overpriced Excellent location for Oxford St and Hyde Park with the added convenience of onsite garage parking. Highly recommended if you can get your company to pay or if you want to treat someone special

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel apart from the queues”
Reviews.Author: Hayse01
Reviews.Content: One night business trip and with this hotel's reputation, I thought it would be really great. The staff were attentive and pleasant enough (though sometimes difficult to understand). The room was spacious and the bed comfy and huge. The fitness room was clean and well-equipped but could have done with some background sound (though that could be just that I am used to a noisier gym). However, breakfast fayre was decidedly underwhelming and the ambience completely frenzied, more like a school dinner hall. The other main problem was the queing. Queues to check-in, queues for the lifts, queues for a table at breakfast, queues at the buffet, queues to check-out, I felt like I spent my whole time in a queue! The hotel has an excellent central location but I would stay elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but the people are just ok”
Reviews.Author: Lottapud
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 5 night stay at the Grosvenor House. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are well appointed and the lobby has a scent to it that is just beautiful. We wanted to bring some of that smell home! Although nice as I have said, the people who work there are less than adequate for a hotel of this level. The front desk staff was not overwhelmingly welcoming; the doormen(women) were helpful on occassion and sometimes opened the doors, but many times could not be bothered even if you were carrying an armful of bags. (one woman in particular at the front who kind of just muddled around looking at the ground not even noticing you approaching); The housekeeping staff was good and kept our room very clean, but didn't seem very happy (rarely a smile from the bunch) and so on. I understand that many people feel the value of the hotel is on the accomodations alone, however, being a faithful Marriott guest, I find that the value of the hotel is not only in the accomodations but with the people as well...in how you are treated, in how they welcome you, in how they make you feel at home...and I must say this Marriott did not live up to that when it came to the staff. Again, the property itself is splendid, but the people need some work.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SparkleandDusty
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in August 2011 and were very pleased. The staff were excellent - competent, efficient and customer focussed. A request that we move rooms due to noise from a nearby elevator was dealt with swiftly and pleasantly. The room was spotlessly clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good, although on the expensive side. Location was excellent. All in all we were very happy with our stay and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night stay.”
Reviews.Author: alexanderleff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grosvenor House for one night with business colleagues and had a wonderful stay. The lobby smelled like heaven and the rooms were large and comfortable. They were extremely accommodating when we needed a late check out. Great start to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “JW Grosvenor House is an absolute homerun!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brendan K
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughters and I travel frequently. No question that the crew prefers/enjoys "first tier" properties. We routinely travel to London to see family and friends and, in the past we found our London home to be either the Dorchester or the Goring properties. NO MORE. We recently stayed (for the 2nd time this year) at the the JW Grosvenor. The location is unbeatable, the rooms generously sized, impeccably decorated/furnished (very quiet and super comfortable beds) and the bathrooms lush. But perhaps the real joy and constant is the level of "service". The entire staff has adopted a "can do" attitude and willingly offers to assist and anticipate every need ---and always with a smile and nod. Nothwithstanding the size of the property, all the desk, front door and concierge staff made sincere efforts to please at every turn. In this economy, we feel that it is increasingly important to believe that we have recieved a "fair" return on our trips. And with the JW Grosvenor we got that and more. For the PRICE, location, atmosphere, service and comfort there is no better deal to be had in London!!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Quality for a 5 star Price”
Reviews.Author: Butchdke
Reviews.Content: Ok, you're in Europe. The rooms are small. I understand that. But I'm staying in a 5 star hotel so I'm guessing they will make up for the lack of space. Not so much here. The public spaces: Gorgeous fresh flowers in the lobby. Polite employees at check in and they checked us in early thank goodness. The concierge was fine but not overly enthusiastic about her job. We did not eat in the restaurants but we did buy coffee every morning at their cafe since none is provided in the room. The coffee shop is fine, but provide neither a good deal nor an exceptional product. The room: The room is in fact quite small but was clean and pleasing to the eye. The bathroom is large and decked out in marble. The shower pressure was fine for us but the water wouldn't get hot, just warm. The wardrobe is small so if you're staying more than a couple of days, you will have to cram your clothing in or resign them to stay in the suitcase that will end up on the floor unless you're just bringing one. The bed was a huge disappointment. It was such that it sagged when you sat on it, like an old cheap mattress. The bedding and towels were fine, but far from luxurious, and not what I've come to expect from a J.W. Marriott. The prices here are kind of ridiculous, from the internet to the breakfast. If you want coffee in your room, plan to pay 6 pounds (per cup) for it. You get the idea. The Location: It is within walking distance of the Marble Arch Tube station, it's about 1/3 of a mile. If you've been on your feet all day, the walk gets old, especially in the rain. It is, however, just a few stops from where all the action is. The bottom line: When I pay for a 5 star hotel, I expect the place to be exceptional and the Grosvenor House failed to reach the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms and great location but service is so-so”
Reviews.Author: BotRoad
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice but smallish-bed was very comfortable-food was superior-great concierge lounge-no need to buy breakfast if you have access to concierge lounge. Service at the front desk and outside was subpar for the rates they are charging. Great towels but shower water pressure was weak. Great location to all shopping and train. Only downside was width of doors didn't accommodate double stroller which is typical of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Panna
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and extremely helpful, enquiring if we needed assistance with everything from directions to what to do while we were in London. The Grosvenor House JW Marriott hotel location is extremely handy to the tube station, Oxford Street and Hyde Park (the Barclays bikes or as we like to call them Borisâ€™s bikes are great for a whiz around the park). There are also bars, cafes and restaurants within minutes of the hotel. The room was extremely clean, comfortable and traditional in style, in our experience Marriottâ€™s always have great pillows perfect for a good nights sleep when you final hit them, so a definitely a plus. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel so canâ€™t comment on the food. We also stayed at the W, Leicester Square for twice the price on this London trip. The welcome and service at the GrosvenorHouse was certainly a million miles away from the W. We would stay at the Grosvenor House again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here in March, 2011 - Loved it. Stayed in July, 2011 - totally different experience. Not good!”
Reviews.Author: AXO1010
Reviews.Content: After a "overseas/international flight" I was eager to get into my room. I was told it wasn't ready and to "wait". I waited for hours, watching person after person checking in and getting their room with no problem. As it approached 3pm (check in time) my room still wasn't ready. I was told to go into the restaurant and they'd call me when it was ready. (At this point I was so tired, and really needed to get into my room to freshen up for a business meeting.) I went into the restaurant, paid about $50 US for a lite bite, came out after check in time, and room still wasn't ready. I had to quickly freshen up in the bathroom and check my bag as I needed to get to a business appointment. As a "frequent traveller" and loyal Marriott member, I was shocked my room wasn't ready. (I was also paying to have access to the concierge lounge.) When I did get my room it was fine - I was just disappointed with the poor service. When it came to the concierge lounge - it was not good. Breakfast time was so packed (and one morning I went in early, one morning I went in later, and both days it was equally bad) there was no where to sit. There was no staff trying to help you find a place to sit. I stood around for awhile waiting for someone to get up but no one did. I finally found concierge level staff and asked where we were supposed to sit. She then opened up a extra room for sitting. As i settled in there with my purse/ipad, etc... I then went to get coffee, and a few items to eat. I found tons of others looking for a place to sit. I had to direct them to the room I was in so they'd have someone to sit. I was just surprised their staff wasn't more on this. All in all for $600 US plus a night, this is too much to pay for such bad service. You'd be better off just staying somewhere clean where you can get a room when you arrive, and then just go eat breakfast in a restaurant where you can get a table. I was so bummed to have such a bad experience this July when I had such a fabulous experience in March. I guess the story is if it isn't season - then it might be ok to stay here. If it is season, and a busier time for the hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant grand lady”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker03
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights during an indian summer spell in London and it was all roses. Property/room: I used the points & pay option to book a junior suite for the 3 of us. Unfortunately Tiff had to use the rollaway bed which was really small and it barely contained her length. Our junior suite room had an odd layout because you walked into the bedroom before the living room. But the room was delightful with beautiful decoration. It was plenty of space for 3 adults. The king bed was humongous and the bed linens were sumptuous. I had the best sleep of my whirlwind vacation here after previously having slept at a Le Meridien and Hilton in other cities. The bathroom was very large, although we did not have a his & hers sink. The bath towels were thick and fluffy. Our room was on the 6th floor but we didn't have much of a view since it looked onto another building. Location: the hotel has a fantastic location in Mayfair on Park Lane. Hyde Park is across the street. The Marble Arch tube stop for the Central Line is 5 minutes away. Shopping on Oxford St and higher end boutiques on Bond St are also short walks away. Service: the hotel staff were cordial and efficient. I actually only booked a superior room for our 3rd night but the hotel was kind enough to let us keep the junior suite. It was a sublime touch! (Restaurant tip: we stumbled onto a wonderful neighborhood restaurant named Truc Vert which is a short distance from the hotel. Walk over to North Audley St about 3 blocks north. The food for breakfast and dinner was tremendously good. They also had WIFI if you asked nicely for the passcode.) My go-to London hotel had been the Renaissance Chancery Lane but the Grosvenor House has surpassed it -- this is a brilliant grand lady worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to try harder!”
Reviews.Author: LKW9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 day business meeting and was surprised at the apparent lack of customer care. Arriving at 2:30 I checked in - my room was not ready - 3pm check in - but when I asked the receptionist when it would be ready she shrugged her shoulders and said 'about 40 minutes?'. She kindly offered to call my mobile when it was ready. However at 3:15 no call had arrived so I returned to the desk and my room was in fact ready. No sign of the receptionist who was going to call me. The room was pleasant, lovely large bathroom. The fitness centre is 'fit for purpose' - nothing special and not very big but I could always access the equipment I needed. I did find the many CCTV cameras in the fitness suite rather disconcerting... The hotel doesn't stock the fridge with bottled water - isntead there is a water machine, all the other 4 and 5 star hotels I have stayed in provide water bottles so this seems rather mean given the prices guests pay to stay. On check out the receptionist was so rude, she was called from the back office by a colleague and clearly resented having to attend to me. She did not egnage with me at all, no smile or conversation. These small things all add up to a general feeling of disappointment. This is the sort of hotel you would expect to want every guest to feel valued - this guest certainly did not.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive hotel with good service and location”
Reviews.Author: KingmanP
Reviews.Content: I am a runner, and I find the location of this hotel to be spectacular. It is about 5-10 minute walk from Oxford street (shopping), 20-30 minute walk from Soho (bars and clubs and food), 15 minute from Big Ben and the palace. Across the street is Hyde park which is a massive park and great for running in the morning/early evening. The services of the hotel were great, and the staff were helpful during my weekend stay. I didn't get to sample the hotel restaurant, but the executive lounge in this hotel offers quite the services (breakfast, complimentary wine and liquor, snacks, etc.) Room was decent. Not a JW I would compare to the ones in Asia, but the room that I got was rather large. All in all, it is a good JW hotel, if you are willing to pay for it. The only down side was the the check-in process was rather slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but Overly Priced”
Reviews.Author: kt44did
Reviews.Content: I understand that this hotel is a classic, but charging Â£16 for a double espresso in their main dining area is a bit much. Also, there are huge discrepancies in the room sizes. I was first put on the 5th floor in a room that was filled only by the large bed. Since I was staying for 2 weeks for work I knew this would feel too claustrophobic had I stayed there. So I requested to switch and when it was available (the next day) they put me up on the 8th floor where the room had two windows and it was much larger. Very nice of them to do that, however if those two rooms are the same price I would be incredibly disappointed to have stayed in the small one the whole time. The JW Steakhouse is a great restaurant, and lunch and dinner service staff are friendly and the prices are actually reasonable. However, for breakfast the service is incredibly slow and almost bordering rude at times. Take your breakfast elsewhere! If you have a bad hip of any sort, the shower/bathtub is incredibly high to get into! I kept wondering how older people got in and out of it, since I was almost jumping out (though I am fairly short, 5' 3"). You can't beat the location though - right across from Hyde and Kensington with bustling Piccadilly a 15-20 min walk away. If you plan to stay at this hotel, I would say the novelty is the location so make sure you're itinerary keeps you out of the rooms as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel with an Amazing Suite”
Reviews.Author: perrystreet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful and in a great location for shopping and for Hyde Park which was lovely. We were upgraded to a very large park-view suite with a big bathroom. The bed was comfortable and had nice linens. The bathroom was large and clean with high-end soaps etc. And naturally we were thrilled with the front desk especially after they gave us a suite. The hotel has a lot of great history which I loved and I read that when Marriott bought it, they kept and refurbished over half of the furniture and refinished doors etc so it still feels authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SouthBay_Traveler
Reviews.Content: In keeping with the reputation of quality, this JW Marriott lives up to its calling. The hotel exterior and interior are pleasing to look at and have appeal to the tired traveler. The staff is efficient and professional, and the concierge level (7th floor) has many relaxation, food and libation benefits. The guest room we had (5th floor--non smoking) was spacious and the bathroom OK, but the tub/shower was a little scary. You have to get up into and over the elevated tub which seems about 3 feet off the floor and then use the traditional hand-shower attachment, being careful to keep the water inside those ridiculous 1/2 glass partitions and not fall out of the tub into the toilet. They do have hand rails to help get yourself out of the shower/tub successfully. The location is fabulous on Park Lane. It's a very busy street, but the sound proofing of the hotel causes the noise not to be an issue. Within easy walking distance are two underground stations for two different lines: Marble Arch and Hyde Park. You also have easy access to the Hop-On, Hop-Off bus line---for us tourists. The American Style Steak House on-site is pricey, but the quality is very good. Like most big time hotels in major cities, the price of adult beverages are borderline obscene---but it's what you've come to expect. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel as base point for our 5 day stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: kenjukes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and found the room to be spacious, well appointed and clean. The hotel is very well located making all of london's main shopping attractions just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amazing interior!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell_edi
Reviews.Content: People were unbelievably helpful and the rooms so nice and clean! of course great London location!!! would definitely go back as soon as possible!!

Reviews.Title: “"Great service"”
Reviews.Author: Laura-Alyssa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days & 3 nights, we arrived a bit earlier and the registration staff were so pleasant and even allowed us to check in earlier. From the conciege staff to the doorman every one were very helpful and nice to us great customer service. We stayed in a standard room and it was beautiful, clean and quiet, great location. We had brunch and the food was great service excellent. Drinks at the Red bar were delish. I would recommend this hotel to every one. We hope to be back and stay in one of the suites... Thank you most kindly

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtraveler98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights along with another couple as we kicked off our trip from U.S. to England and France. Having stayed here several times for business, I was familiar with the Mayfair location and high service levels. They checked us in early upon our mid-morning arrival , always a bonus following an over night flight from the states. We also were upgraded to access the concierge facilities, providing free breakfast, snacks and drinks.The room was huge by European standards, as was the bath with oversized shower/tub. The decor, linens and furnishings were top notch and in perfect condition. The staff and concierge were very approachable and helpful, whether we needed a late night bucket of ice, help storing luggage, clarifications on exhibits at the V&A and Buckingham Palace or recommendations for affordable restaurants and off the beaten path markets. The hotel is within walking distance or a short cab ride to all of London's major attractions. We felt very safe day or night walking in the parks, the shopping districts or simply exploring Mayfair on foot. A highlight of our visit was an afternoon high tea. While pricey, the unlimited sandwiches, scones and pastries and the various teas were scrumtious. We read later they received the best high tea in London award the previous year. We also enjoyed the small public spaces such as the intimate red bar and library-great places to get away from the crowds for quiet drinks and snacks, and unusual in large hotel settings.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments, great London property in Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: rjrdomer
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 2 nights. We used Marriott points for the room and it was a great trade. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the top floor overlooking Hyde Park. Aside from the lucky upgrade, the hotel was in a great location. The staff was friendly, and afternoon tea in the Park Room was great. We ate dinner at the JW Steakhouse inside of the hotel one night and it was very good. Prices were about the same as a Manhattan steakhouse. In all, I would stay there again. I would recommend anyone I know to stay there and would gladly use Marriott points again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: luckyduck63
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in London with the Grosvenor House as our base and had a fantastic experience. The location in the Mayfair district was prime, the Marble Arch tube stop was a quick walk (a block? maybe less) as was the Bond Street stop. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay comfortable. We had a BIG surprise upon returning to the hotel on our first evening to find paparazzi, red carpet, lines of limos....and the Pride of Britain Awards taking place in the ball room! Prince Charles as well as a large number of celebrities (Rowan Atkinson was my favorite!) strolled the carpet and that was a bit of unexpected fun. Turns out that Grosvenor House has the largest ballroom in London and there was an event every night while we were there. Thankfully, no noise or crowd issues affected us as we snoozed in our beautiful room. Our 7th floor room overlooked Hyde Park and was VERY spacious and filled with thoughtful details. It was wonderful to fall into a feather bed after a full day of sightseeing. We ordered room service just one evening, I honestly can't remember the prices (aren't they always too high?) but the food was excellent and the service prompt. I loved the cheerful greeting from the doorman as we came and went, and I will forever remember the hotel being filled with the scent of fresh flowers. I loved every minute of our stay at The Grosvenor House.

Reviews.Title: “great afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: colin ar
Reviews.Content: had a celebration afternoon tea in Park room on 5th Sep 2011 level of service could not be better selection and quality of food could not be exceeded refills of sndwiches as requested very good selection of teas will go again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pellanconi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11 nights ending September 13, 2011. On seventh floor overlooking Hyde Park. The executive lounge was great. No problems with crowds either morning or evening. Front desk staff great especially Victoria who checked us in. We are self contained travelers who didn't use concierge. Ate at restaurants all over Mayfair. Many choices. If you are a runner as I am the park is across the street with a couple of underground ped subways under Park Lane. Housekeeping was very good and the crew in executive lounge excellent. Bond Street tube station a 10 minute walk away as is Marble Arch. Fitness center is very large and well appointed. All in all everyone in hotel very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to returen

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bariatricrunner
Reviews.Content: You should expect a lot from the name Marriott and even more from a JW Marriott. But not this property. I should clarify that the problem was not the property, which is a nice hotel in a great location. Right across the street from Hyde Park. The overpriced food was good. House keeping was very good. The problem was with the registration staff who did not seem to care about you at all. When asked a question, no reply, or completely ignored. We stayed 5 days and all shifts wrer the same. Even the door man did not want to open the door for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but service needs to step up”
Reviews.Author: CruisinChris1
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay. Upgraded to a nice room "overlooking" Hyde Park, albeit on the second floor. Noise was not an issue and the room was very large by European standards. Enjoyed the special Rose Tea in the Park Room and had good food there - expensive though. I was impressed that my room was ready when I arrived at 7 am. Lots of American cruise passengers staying here pre- and post- cruise. The one thing that was particularly irritating is that the service line would ring off the hook, no one answering for 20 rings or more every time I called for anything. Room service was prompt. Was unable to get help with luggage at check-out, despite two calls over a 30 minute period. Especially frustrating after the desk called me to tell me my driver was waiting...I know...trying to get down there. I eventually set off down the hall with multiple cases by myself and ran into a bellman. He said they had never received the request. I really expect a lot more than that at a hotel of this "caliber." Also had a nice meal at Steak. Overall - very good but not good enough for top marks. Location is very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to visit!”
Reviews.Author: ctguy001
Reviews.Content: The Grosvenor House was an extremely well run and comfortable hotel. The room was recently updated and had one of the largest bathrooms that I've seen in a hotel. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating and helped us with all our requests. The location is very convenient, but does lack many close restaurants. The hotel restaurants are excellent, but the prices are quite high. I'd be glad to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kimmygSurrey
Reviews.Content: It being our 10th wedding anniversary, my husband and myself stayed here for 2 nights. We stayed in a premium park suite with views over Hyde park. It was worth the money as the suite was perfect with tons of space. Fresh fruit, flowers and newspapers were provided and a complimentary bottle of champagne also on our arrival. We had lunch in the Parkroom, which was tasty. The location was fine for us and there are lots of amazing restaurants close by. I had on another occasion stayed here as I was attending a function in the Great Room. Beautiful function room and the room I stayed in was just an normal deluxe but they upgraded me to a Junior suite, I didn't even ask for it, which was a nice surprise. This is a lovely hotel and the staff are very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the world's best cheesecake”
Reviews.Author: lkws
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grosvenor House for 6 nights on business and was very pleased with the accommodations. The room was a bit tight (as are most hotel rooms in the city), but was attractive and very comfortably furnished. The hotel's location is great - just off Hyde Park and a couple blocks from the tube. The service is top-notch. In sum, it's a great place to stay in London. The only way you could go wrong is if you visit the Grosvenor House and do not sample the cheesecake. There is a little pastry/coffee shop off the lobby that has quite possibly the best cheesecake I've ever eaten. They also sell the same cheesecake as a dessert in the bar/lounge area. It's a very welcome treat following a day of meetings or touring the amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: rustopher
Reviews.Content: We were hours early and able to get into a room which was wonderful. The room was fabulous with a bathroom larger that some Manhattan apartments. The staff were very helpful. Handily located between the Marble Arch & Hyde Park Corner underground stations just off the beaten path enough to be away from the maddening crowds. Only drawbacks: no free wifi - ethernet connection which opens to a page explaining the fees. Breakfast didn't show up when ordered & we had to leave without it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: pm2006
Reviews.Content: I saw other reviews that said they weren't happy with the condition of their rooms. All I can say is that none of the 20 or so of us who stayed this night had anything but the best. It was the epitome of elegance from the doorman and the bellmen in top hat and tails to the classic 'English brolly' (umbrella) and beautiful robe that was hanging in the closet. The rooms are EXACTLY as pictured, complete with the layered pillows and beautiful linens. The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were big enough to have a party. (This may have been that I just got off a ship) :) There are no ice machines but room service was very quick. It does require a tip though. The down side is that it is VERY expensive! A hamburger and coffee in the restaurant was $50.84. Of course, if you can afford to stay there at 400+ dollars a night, this shouldn't be an issue. :) I only gave it a 4 for value because I am not sure that any hamburger is worth $50.

Reviews.Title: “Decent JW Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feldgend
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious compared to other hotels in London. Hotel was clean and modern fixtures in room. Got a decent corporate rate, so chose this hotel over others. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel in a great shopping district!”
Reviews.Author: calkenneth
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel I picked for a romantic getaway in July 2011. I could have picked a bunch of other hotels, but having a corporate discount rate for this hotel helped :-) Made the price quite reasonable (especially for a top-of-the-line Marriott) and I earned Marriott Rewards points while I was at it. The hotel might be a bit pricey for those who are paying the rack rate! This hotel is near the Marble Arch Tube station and is very close to Oxford Street and all of the shopping that is on Oxford. The location is right by Hyde Park which is a very nice area too. It poured when we were there so we didn't get to explore the park much, but if you have luck with the weather, take advantage of the hotel's location and check out the park. The check-in process was pretty easy and the front desk was very nice. I asked nicely for a room upgrade and the lady found one for us. The room we ended up getting was HUGE and very nice. It had a very comfortable bed, plenty of space in the room, a nicely appointed bathroom, and cozy bathrobes. The TV was a little small for the size of the room, but acceptable. The hotel features an evening turn-down service as well, which is very nice. Definitely gives the feel that this is a high-end hotel, which it definitely was. We did not eat at the hotel, but definitely check out the cafe on the bottom floor. They have a cheesecake that is to die for. I've had a lot of cheesecakes in my time, and this was definitely one of the best. The graham cracker crust was done perfectly. Skip the coffee though - it was kind of bland. There is a Starbucks about a 10 minute walk away (on the corner of Green Street and N. Audley Street) which will probably be better. :) I also used the theater ticket booking service on the ground floor. It is operated by a separate company. They were able to get us great seats to a showing of Wicked. They do add a service charge (which they do NOT disclose) to the ticket fee, so if you want to save some money, go directly to the theater to buy the tickets. Not knowing this (and not wanting to drag myself to the Apollo Victoria Theater), I bought the tickets there. Overall, a great hotel. Have already recommended it several times to friends visiting London!

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Brit99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grovesnor hotel for a 2 night mini-break on points (equivalent room was about Â£329 per night), and had a fantastic time. Location - right across the road from hyde park and around the corner from oxford street and mayfair. Would recommend random walking through mayfair as it is a very affluent area and there are lots of interesting things to see here Room - we were upgraded to an executive level room which was nice and quiet, a good size, with all expected amenities (internet, sofa/large TV area, large numbers of closets) and a well appointed bathroom with excellent shower Staff/Public areas - the lobby area is very nice and we had no issues with check-in speed or service as others have described. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but it looked popular and the cream teas were very well attended each day. The concierge lounge was of a good size and had a nice selection of food/drinks in both the morning and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: booyah60
Reviews.Content: Not only are the accommodations top notch, but the staff at this hotel are the best I've ever experienced. They treated us like we were their most important guests staying at the hotel. I couldn't believe how well I was treated. Too bad not every hotel experience is like this during my work trips. Our bed was bigger than king size or at least it felt that way. Very comfortable down bedding and the sumptuous pillows gave me one of the best sleeping experience I've ever had (Melville Marriott was the best). Very nice bathroom and the shower was so soothing and therapeutic. We really hated to leave this hotel to go home. London is a beautiful city to visit and the people of England are the best. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Love it.....!!”
Reviews.Author: PatricSA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amizing trip. we loved the hotel. The location is excellent!!!! We didnÂ´t try the food so i can give an opinion. but we really love the room. it was big, the beds are wonderful!!The bathroom was very modern and big!!The satff is great and very helpfull... we will return.. and yes i really recomend this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LizFach
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Just stayed a couple of days but enjoyed every minute. Fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is looking better .”
Reviews.Author: Lynne009
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marriott Grosvenour House hotel recently .I have not visited this hotel for many years and used it quite frequently in the past , however it was looking very tired then but Marriott have completed a very nice upgarde to the hotel .All the public areas look very nice now as do the upgarded rooms .I am due to have dinner in their JW Steak House in the hotel next month so i will report back on the restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Vincent J
Reviews.Content: You can tell why this hotel has been visited by so many royals and famous politicians. It is a hotel with real class. It has a traditional look therefore may not be your first choice if you seek modern hotels. The executive lounge offers great breakfast / snacks / drinks throughout the day. The hotel tea lounge is unique for it's "high tea". Service and hotel condition are very good. Located right opposite to Regent Park and next to Oxford street (main shopping street in London)

Reviews.Title: “Glad to read I'm not the only one!”
Reviews.Author: nannygail
Reviews.Content: Not left reviews before but after using Tripadvisor ourselves I feel that the service is invaluable and therefore felt I must write about our own experience. We booked 3 rooms for a Christmas treat for the family expecting an exceptional experience but really it's a bed factory. Check in was very slow. Rooms are ok but no frills. Bathrooms tired. I totally agree with the majority of the reviews but must say that we had great service in the lounge and had an excellent dinner in the steak house. BUT be very careful when handing your car over to valet parking, our car still has the scars. We left on Sunday morning and didn't see the damage until we arrived home. We called immediately we got back but after a number of phone calls they denied all responsibility and therefore our whole weekend was spoiled by this incident.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST hotel of our Europe vacation!”
Reviews.Author: KarenAsher
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Breakfast buffet immense. Great location, fantastic restaurant, super staff, lovely room. Nothing negative to say. I can't wait to return to London and this hotel again! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, excellent location ... and what an upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: andyccpc
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for a weekend of merriment to celebrate our wedding anniversary and a trip to the theatre to see War Horse. We've stayed here on previous occasions and we love the splendour of this hotel. We were warmly greeted by the receptionist who willingly checked us in early (11.00 am) and who proceeded to offer us an upgrade on the 8th floor - and what an upgrade - it was a magnificent suite overlooking Hyde Park and needless to say we were delighted. It got the weekend off to a great start. The suite was immaculate in every way and we couldn't have asked for anything more. We decided to pay extra for the Executive Lounge access and what value for money that turned out to be - it was perfect for a couple of complimentary drinks before the matinee and was first class for a breakfast selection which was better than many experienced in superior quality hotels visited around the world. The bed was probably the most comfortable we've ever had in a hotel and the facilities were like home from home - even down to the Bose docking station. Brilliant weekend and thanks to everyone at the hotel for their warmth and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family vacation in London”
Reviews.Author: silasabby
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Hyde park, Five star service from front desk to wake up calls, excellent breakfast and high tea. Only downside was no free wireless in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ChilliRod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and at a very central location. The day I checked-in there was this Hard Rock Calling concert at Hyde Park and I was able to check a Rod Stewart show. Pretty nice! The staff is friendly though I have to add that there was always a large queue at the reception desk, maybe management should consider adding more people. One thing I would like to complain is that there was no wifi available in the room I was staying. Come on! This is 2011! Other than that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel !”
Reviews.Author: walinne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel with my daughter and was very happy with my choice. We arrived quite early, 9a.m, passed through reception very quickly and our room was already available. We had a twin room, space enough for the two of us, great wardrobe with everything needed, and a lovely bathroom (bathrobes, slippers, amenities...). Service was very good during all the stay and buffet breakfast offered plenty of choice (different kinds of cereals, of milks, fresh fruits, pastries, cheeses, hams, breads, salmon, bacon, two kinds of sausages, mushrooms... and eggs cooked as you wish. Next time we stay in London, we will be back at the Grosvenor house.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: traveller_lou
Reviews.Content: We came here for afternoon tea on my 30th birthday. I have to say that although the hotel is not contemporary, it has a certain charm and feels very grand. The tea was wonderful - lots of sandwiches, cakes and tea, plus beautiful champagne. We had a lovely time with the pianist playing in the background and adding to the atmosphere. We didn't see any bedrooms but I can understand why the hotel is being modernised, I just hope it doesn't lose its charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but VERY Expensive”
Reviews.Author: ferguskkeating
Reviews.Content: Visited here on a business trip, and thank god I wasn't paying. Food & Drinks were top class but the were definatly aimed at the Midle Eastern Clients. Service was awsome and the rooms were classy. Recomed stayong here once in your life (if you can justify the cost). Breakfast was Â£33, Beer $6.50 per bottle and a spirit and mixer over Â£15.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: madgun
Reviews.Content: My wish list while planning a vacation has comfort, relaxation and a little bit of luxury as top 3. The Grosvenor House was up to the mark on all of them. We travelled as a family of 3 with our 3rd one being a 7 month old infant. From a fast and efficient check-in after a 60 minute ride from Heathrow to well laid rooms with all requests made at the time of booking being catered to, the hotel made us feel good about our decision to splurge. I was impressed by the size of the room which was a boon with an infant who wanted to crawl around. The bathroom was big, clean and well maintained. Beds were comfortable. Room service was excellent even though the hotel was packed with guests. The daily buffet breakfast at the JW steakhouse was fabulous with a lot of options and staff that made sure we were well looked after. The hotel's location is superb with all major attractions being within a vicinity of 2-4 miles at max. Oxford Street was 5 minutes away so we were never away from having a quick shopping stroll in a lively area, although overcrowded most of the time! Regent Street, Piccadilly Circus and the up market Kings Road were also nearby. We did not use the London tube although the nearest Marble Arch station was only a couple of minutes away. The only let down at the hotel was the concierge service, which was not of great help. The desk was understaffed with long queues and by the time our turn came, the attendant was already irritated. Overall, a very satisfying stay. I would strongly recommend the Grosvenor House.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: flamboyant624
Reviews.Content: True marriott experience. Hotel is close to all the main attractions and one of the posh London districts and good property. The rooms were spacious, esp as per London standards and the service was wonderful. The hotel staff was very friendly and responsive. Luxury hotel so a bit expensive but worth it. The breakfast needed some more options for vegetarians, didnt have a veg bread when I visited. But other than that all good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and professional but friendly service”
Reviews.Author: CJMarbella
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay and would certainly return again if I were visting central Lonson on business or even for a long weekend. Ther rooms are ample in size, clean and well maintained and the staff in general are very helpful and professional. Certainly well worth considering for a stay in London and ideal base for shopping and sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay at Grosvenor House”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grosvenor House for one night and it was an absolute pleasure from the moment we arrived until we left. The doorman quicky organised our car to be parked and then we checked 3 hours earlier than the check in time. Our allocated room was not ready so they offered us a free upgrade to a suite which was a smoking room. We are both very anti smoking so asked to be shown the room before making a decision. A lovely girl from Guest Relations showed us to the room which was fab and we did not detect any traces of smoke so agreed to take the room. They arranged for our luggage to be taken to the room whilst we headed to Shaftesbury Avenue and got on with our weekend! The suite was lovely with a fabulous huge bed and luxury linen. Beautiful soft furnishings and elegant furniture made us feel very special. The staff at this hotel are all extremely friendly and efficient in all areas of this hotel. They certainly go all out to make sure their guests enjoy their stay and boy - is this hotel busy! Full of overseas visitors and a few english whilst we were there and staff on hand to assist with enquiries. A great hotel in a good location. Definitely recommend this hotel and want to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: robteix
Reviews.Content: Five nights at Grosvenor House, nice and clean bedroom, attentive staff, specially front desk. Package included breakfast buffet style, good variety and quantity. Near tube station Marble Arch and near Oxford St., Hyde Park... Would recommend and visit again!

Reviews.Title: “My London Address? - I Wish !”
Reviews.Author: Silvascoop
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for that special weekend away. Although I'd visited the capital many times with work etc, I'd never done the 'touristy bit' and so I decided to treat my wife and son to a relaxing Christmas break and splashed out on the Grosvenor House as part of a Theatre / City break. Situation is perfect for sightseeing, shopping or a just walk in the Park. The Grosvenor is a lovely place to stay, well appointed, upper class for sure, but very relaxing and with all the facilities you could wish for. The rooms are large and comfortable but be careful. I'd asked for a room opposite Hyde Park, for the view, but found it a bit noisy, so after one night I asked for a quiet room and was pleased to see that when we arrived back from an afternoon out, we had been moved to an inside room. Not much of a view, but a more peaceful night. The breakfast is the usual quality hotel fare, all well cooked and with a vast array that is just too tempting. I don't usually eat a large breakfast, but the food just will not be ignored. The staff were all very helpful and polite, the room change was handled superbly, they even moved our clothes and stuff whilst we were out, without being asked. Nice touch. Without doubt, the Grosvenor is expensive, but with a bit of browsing, deals are available and we felt that the hotel was well worth the price we paid. The drink prices in the Red Bar are quite steep, as is the norm in a hotel of this calibre, however, there is a great pub just a few yards from the hotels 'back door' where prices are more moderate and they serve good English beer. We didn't get around to sampling all the choices of eateries in the hotel, but did have a wonderful evening in the Steakhouse. The food is truly memorable and although expensive, we thought the whole evening well worth it. Try the 'on the bone' Rib Eye but bring a good appetite with you. So, a lovely classy hotel, but at a premium price. Worth saving up for though. If I ever do win the lottery, I may well take one of the private suites on the upper floors !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui101
Reviews.Content: Kind ,helpful ,caring and attentive staff from the minute you arrive at the front door. Rooms spacious and comfortable.Steakhouse restaurant a must to visit -excellent staff & fantastic food-don't miss the cheesecake.Great breakfasts..Love the reception area-so much space,always looks and smells beautiful.Will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bus1
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be clean, welcoming, spacious, and well-located. I arrived early in the morning and the friendly front-desk staff worked to find a room for me to check into early, and after a quick breakfast, a room was prepared. It was far larger than I expected from a European hotel, and when I had issues with the ethernet cable in the room, a new one was brought up within minutes of calling the front desk. The concierge was also helpful, providing restaurant and taxi/tube tips along with friendly conversation. As far as the room goes, the bed was 'sleepable' but nothing special, and the shower and bathroom amenities were pretty nice. The hotel is located across the street from Hyde Park, near multiple tube stops and has several dining options inside and nearby. I thought my room had a smell to it - not a bad smell, but some sort of scent, which I found a bit odd. Other than that, the hotel was a great place to stay and I'd definitely consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but staff are thieves. You can do better elseware”
Reviews.Author: Carathie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel approximately 30-40 nights over the last 6 months. The Good: - The rooms are OK - The people running the executive lounge are nice and will try to help when they can - Room service is very quick The Bad: - The worst experience was having a tube card stolen from my room (with over 45 pounds on it). To make matters worse, whomever stole it replaced it with a tube card that had 1 pound on it (clearly it wasn't the same tube card as it was very worn). After battling this for 2 weeks, and having security tell me the only person in the room couldn't have possible stolen the card because she was "honest", I gave up. Isn't there a law in London that you have to replace stolen property? In all my 300 nights at marriott hotels, I have never had this happen. Considering other people are also complaining about stolen goods, I would safely say there is a thief in the hotel. - Executive lounge is overcrowded. At 5 oclock, the lounge fills up for the food that comes out at 5:30. You cannot get a seat as people stay there the entire night. The same situation in the morning. The lounge has a more cafeteria / canteen feel to it then lounge feel. - Everything is extremely expensive. To give an example, a burger will run you around 30 USD / 18 pounds. If you order it to room service, expect another 5 or so pounds in service charges. - It took an act of god to have them give me a bigger room on the same floor (even though the hotel was not to capacity). I had to speak to about 5 people before the request was even considered. - No wifi (really?)

Reviews.Title: “Very Overrated-would not go back”
Reviews.Author: nancynurse73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very over rated They cannot handle surges in check in or check out process. They have poor service in the executive lounge cannot keep up with the volume of guests using the lounge. The conditions were unacceptable for the cost of staying at the hotel. An elevator was out of service our entire stay. The noise level was unacceptable-with the location across from Hyde Park the noise from the concerts were very disrupting and unacceptable-the rock music was non stop for 12 hours every day-hotel was unable to move our room or offer compensation. The staff was not informed properly to guide us on travel time to the theater-there were Palace events going on that tied up travel times that the hotel was not able to speak to as a result we were not given the proper travel time to the theater.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, but I don't think I will be back to this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: zaidq80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, but I've experienced some problems with the booking. I have booked and paid for deluxe room, but when I was checking in the receptionist told me that my room is the regular one and looking into the internal courtyard of the hotel. I had to call my travel agent to solve this problem. In the next morning when I went down for breakfast, they've told me that it is not included! While I have paid for bed & breakfast and it was there in the voucher. The first reply from the lady in the reception was: I don't care about what is written in your voucher, the booking I have is without breakfast! Isn't this rude and impolite answer toward a hotel guest?!! What I dislike in the room is only the towels. Some of them were old & teared up from the side. I wounder how haven't they noticed that!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with beautifully appointed service”
Reviews.Author: A_Norski_Rus
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of our vacation, witha five year old child. Otel is amazing in furnishings, full of details that separate a real high-class hotel and exceptionally polite and attentive staff. I travel a lot on business, and this is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed at. My small son was really welcome, with staff greeting him and offering small presents or a smile, or proposing to take our photo together....all, these things make a stay not good, but perfect. Highest regards to concierge desk staff for local advice and general help

Reviews.Title: “Camera went missing and so did staff action”
Reviews.Author: skm0803
Reviews.Content: My camera disappeared from my room and after leaving a note for the cleaner (to see if it had been tidied up someplace I could not see), I reported to management. Initial reaction seemed to take it seriously but that quickly fell away into inaction. I took a side trip for business and returned to the hotel and, as per the suggestion of the first security staff member who dealt with me, I again contacted security to see what had eventuated on the investigation. I could not have been more fobbed off with lines such as "...someone else was investigating this...", and "..we understand you reported it to the police for insurance purposes...", with the inference that I should be happy to just get the insurance money. Sorry to disappoint you but I WANT MY CAMERA WITH ITS PHOTOS BACK, as someone from your staff removed it from my room. Given the inaction of the hotel since then, TripAdvisor is my only resort to bring attention to the only hotel in the world where I have had something removed from my room. Next stop is to get this hotel removed from our company "Preferred place to stay in London'. I have read many of the other reviews and have experienced some of the other complaints such as: . doorman who ignored you unless you specifically ask for a taxi . another door man who opened the door of my taxi (at the Park Lane entrance), got my luggage out of the taxi and then disappeared , leaving my luggage on the street! I was left to lug 3 pieces of luggage into the hotel, down the steps and across to reception. I'm a 51 year old woman with a bad back and was mighy cheesed off at this lack of basic service. This hotel gets my "Worst hotel of the Year' award (I spend 50% of my year in hotels so feel I am qualified to judge).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay & a Visit from Obama”
Reviews.Author: lambertbunch
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very large room and bathroom Clean, Comfortable bed Executive Lounge had good food and drinks Free computer access in exec lounge Great people watching spot -Obama was at the JW for a speach when we were there Rec'd chocolate dipped strawberries and wine for our 20th anniversary Attentive staff Nice walk to Buckingham Palace or Hyde Park from the JW Cons Not as convenient as I would have like to the tube Expensive food options onsite Expensive Rooms. Marriott Grosvenor Square offers a better price and convenient to the tube I would recommned you purchase your theatre tickets online vs the Marriott ticket desk. They quoted me higher prices Overall:I would stay here again. I found the hotel to be very clean and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like this hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: jperf
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel. Decent rooms, comfortable beds, not a bad location across from Hyde Park. But the smell. When you walk in the lobby or get in or out of an elevator...the horrid smell overwhelms you. It's like really cheap, strong perfume. I've stayed at Four Seasons with the smell of fresh flowers. Right after this hotel - I moved to the Landmark Hotel - you walk in and smell fresh flowers (also a much nicer hotel). This hotel smelled like someone bought cheap perfume and sprayed it everywhere. It was overpowering. The other guests noticed as on a couple of occasions, others in the lobby were discussing it. The second issue with the hotel came on the day of checkout. At 1106am I was in my room packing. Suddenly, the TV comes on an starts blaring the sound of an alarm at an ever increasingly loud volume. At first, I thought it was a fire alarm. But the message on the screen said that I had a message - that checkout was at 12pm. I was taken aback by the rudeness of the message. It was an hour before checkout and the hotel thought it a good idea to blare at top volume an alarm? Who runs this place. But they weren't done. 10 minutes later - the TV started blaring again - once again giving me a message that checkout was at 12pm. I stay at hotels at least 15 weeks a year. I've never seen this before. This will be my one and only stay at this hotel. For the money - there are many other London hotels that are nicer and seem to value their guests. They also don't feel the need to spray their lobbies with cheap perfume.

Reviews.Title: “What a superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: keithreddy
Reviews.Content: We have always enjoyed Marriott's hotels, but this is miles above a normal Marriott. Exceptional room, the most comfortable bed I have slept on, and an all round excellent function location. How on earth they delivered so many beef wellingtons cooked to perfection is beyond me. Only compaint, the coffee shop was a disappointment. Poor service and cardboard cups - yeuch!

Reviews.Title: “CRIMINAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: Criminal!!! That hotels like this think it is ok to charge Â£20 for 24 hours of Internet. Hotel was nice but not worth Â£540 per night. Service was NOT exceptional had to wait 10 minutes to check in and out, had to ask the doorman to get us a taxi while he stood there doing nothing. We had to call housekeeping twice to bring up an extra bed, which was ordered at time of reservation (an additional Â£48). I suggest you spend you hard earned money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: lou1533
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel overall. We stayed in a standard room which was well sized for london. It was well maintained, traditionally furnished with an ultra comfortable bed. The only slight drawback was the fact there were no coffee/ tea making facilities in situ. Looking at the hotel guide these could be provided on request but personally I prefer to have a kettle/filter machine ready and waiting. However small niggles about coffee aside I have to say this was one of the best guest experiences I've had. The staff are truly fantastic and seem to really take a pride in their work. They are professional, well trained and truly interested in providing the best service. 5 stars without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Total decadence”
Reviews.Author: l0vaduck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night after a concert. The service at reception was polite and efficient. The room was very luxurious with a bed big enough for a whole family, never mind a couple. About 10 minutes after we arrived we received a phone call asking if everything was ok. I said that I was disappointed there were no tea and coffee making facilities, and they told me that these were available, just not left in the room. When we returned later there was a tray with tea, coffee and fresh milk. So much better than those little pots of UHT milk you normally get! Breakfast was the best I have ever had in a hotel. There was so much choice - everything you could think of for breakfast, and all of it delicious. They even had multigrain croissants which I've never seen anywhere else. Together with a lovely stroll through Hyde Park this made a real treat of a weekend and we are saving up our Airmiles so we can stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but...”
Reviews.Author: Ana MarÃ­a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Grosvenor House for four nights with Marriott Reward Points, and it was ok. But if you have to pay cash, this is too expensive for nothing really special. But if you still want to spend that amount of money I think that itÂ´s better to stay at the Marriott Grosvenor Square that is just few blocks away and was more convenient because the metro station is right out the door and it is located in a more vivid place. The breakfast was also way too expensive at $50.00 dollars per person. So we found a pretty cafe just one block away called Richeaux, very cozy and just $10.00 per person with eggs. IÂ´m not used to have breakfast in other place but hotels, but the ambiance of the cafe was so nice that we really enjoyed going there every day. I recommend two excellent restaurants just few blocks away. La Caricatura, italian restaurant well price and delicious and China Tang at the Dorchester Hotel, expensive, but you got to have the Pekin duck! Rooms were clean, normal size and the shower, as most of JWs, spectacular. But thatÂ´s it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: AXO1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in March, 2011. I had never stayed in this part of town before, but wanted to try it out. It is a great hotel. Fabulous rooms that are clean. Nice sized bathrooms. You are a few blocks from the closest tube station, but a few blocks is a nice walk to me. You also can walk easily to the other areas of the city without even getting on the tube. My room was a corner room, and was pretty big. Very spacious! Check in / Check out was easy. Staff was nice. I stayed on the club floor, which was great, as you could go into the lounge and get breakfast, snacks, drinks, etc... throughout the day. They also have free WIFI in there, and someone to ask questions/directions of. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat when I return to London.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't my sort of place, although it is very good”
Reviews.Author: Tripper064
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's well done out. Yes, it's on one of the best named streets in London. But it all comes at a massive price. Â£58 for breakfast for two, that's $100 my American friends, is an expensive piece of toast. If you like big, impersonal hotels (admittedly, how could you ever make a hotel this size personal?), and money is no object, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “mattress problem”
Reviews.Author: seniorcouple49
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel except we could hardly sleep. We were 2 nights (June 3 and 4). We first got room 250. I weigh around 200 p and my wife 155 p. In room 250, I was almost always falling off the bed as the mattress was so flabby on the side. We were easily transfered to room 614 on the 2nd night and it was exactly the reverse. In this room, we were rolling against one another in the middle of the bed, it was the only way to stop rolling. I really dont understand, nobody seems to complain on the beds. Are these the only 2 rooms having bad mattresses?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility, Great Location, and My Rate was Favorable to other Marriott's in the Area”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the JW Marriott - Grosvenor House when visiting London. The building is classy, service is excellent, and the location right across the street from Hyde Park is terrific. When coming to the Grosvenor House be aware that it is one of at least three Marriott properties in close proximity to one another. A colleague's assistant booked him into the Marriott at Grosvenor Square (on Duke St). It only a few blocks from Grosvenor House, but it is by no means in the same category of hotel. And, to boot, I got a better rate at the Grosvenor House than my colleague got at Grosvenor Square. The Grosvenor House executive lounge seems a bit small, but it somehow manages to handle to constant traffic (this is a popular hotel) very well. The lounge is open on weekends, as well as weekdays, with various food and snack services throughout the day. The service is outstanding! The "fitness suite" is above average. I've seen much worse in my travels with Marriott, even at JW's. There are plenty of machines, free weights, and a good amount of floor space. There are pubs and eateries nearby, and all of London is easily accessed on foot, by tube, or in taxis. London is expensive, perhaps on the same order as NYC for the cost of hotel room. However, my room at the JW - Grosvenor House was much, much better than anything I've experienced in NYC! Will definitely stay at Grosvenor House on future trips to London.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best London hotels”
Reviews.Author: Thepollizi
Reviews.Content: Very very nice hotel lovely breakfast, definitely come back to try the steakhouse. Being a JW Marriott the rooms could have been a bit different from any other Marriott, otherwise very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just your normal Marriott. Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: Coming from the USA and paying these rates for a Marriott seems absurd, but oh well. This is just your average Marriott. The location was fine, but actually a bit of a walk to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “So So...”
Reviews.Author: GZMOA
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is nice. Very close to bond-new bond-oxford streets. the hotel is very clean. I have stayed at the hotel for 4 days, 2 days in a standard room 2 days in an executive. The standard rooms are nicer than the exec. sutites. and exc suites is not worth the price. I was told to have the breakfast at the executive lounge which is really low quality as compared to the completely satisfying breakfast for the standard room guests at the hotels restaurant. Since I have been staying at the exec. suit, I was told to pay 10 pounds for regular breakfast (or to have free breakfast at the exec lounge on the 7th floor which was low quality). The ballroom of the hotel is very popular as I understand, since every night at the hotel was so crowded with good looking dressed people.

Reviews.Title: “Ok building, boring hotel with arrogant staff”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: I didn't know this was supposed to be a fancy/special/luxurious hotel and to be honest, it felt like any 3-4 star hotel anywhere in the world. We arrived at the hotel for a one-night stay with our guests. Having booked more than 5 rooms, with our company using more than 10, they weren't able to check us in! We had to wait for two hours. Also, the sauna was under renovation, and this was not mentioned on their web site when making the booking! To me, that's like leaving a mattrass on the floor and claiming they're replacing the beds... The room had a small TV, although it was quite big for London. I had to get some toiletries and tried to find my friend at the same time, and the front staff seemed rather uninterested in their work, not just one of them. Maybe they had a bunch of trainees working the front during our stay. The doorman didn't even know that usually when there's a customer with large bags he holds up the door! Not once during our stay did he do that. The location was excellent though, and I would stay here again but overall but only if it's cheaper than all other 4-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just one teeny tiny complaint”
Reviews.Author: MildredCambridge
Reviews.Content: This is a super comfortable hotel. Our room was excellent as was the bathroom. The breakfast is exceptional, we've had a few buffet breakfasts in our time but this is really good, didn't need lunch. All the staff we met were cheerful, friendly, and very helpful. They all seem to get on with each other too which gives the place a friendly atmosphere. It is in a great location and the view from the lovely Green Room, where we had a wonderful (husband's birthday treat ) big tea is a joy, as was the live piano music. Our only gripe is that we had to ask for a tea/coffee tray which was promptly delivered but with instant coffee!! Arrgghhh!!!! We asked if we could get some real coffee instead but were told it was only possible thru Room Service. I really think that if you're paying a deluxe price there should at least be some good coffee available. This was our only dissapointment though. Maybe the catering manager will read this and get some good coffee organised?

Reviews.Title: “great service.”
Reviews.Author: bratalie
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here to attend the publican awards 2011. as soon as we arrived they upgraded us to a deluxe suite (complimentary) which we didnt even ask for. we arrived there quite early so the room was not yet ready but they looked after our luggage and gave us a call as soon as the room was ready (which was still earlier than check-in times) the room was really nice, very clean and was provided with plenty of toiletries, slippers and dressing gown. the bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. we ate at the steak house which was nice and the waiters looked after us the whole time. check out was 12 o clock so we even got a lie-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for history and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: TeBay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 41 years ago for about 5 days, while on a business trip. Great hotel. Marriott recently took it over. Probably for the better. Since we stayed this time there as part of a post-cruise package I'm not certain if we could afford to stay here again paying regular rates. But it was great. Only negatives---No free newspaper, no free coffee except for the make your own in the room stuff, and very expensive internet with no free print your own boarding pass privledge anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same but still very nice”
Reviews.Author: AnaTBall
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Grosvenor House before it was a JW Marriott. We just loved the place but stopped coming for years when they started a huge renovation. Although it certainly lost some of its cache, it is more american, the Hall Porter now is called a Concierge, it still is a beautiful hotel with very attentive staff and superb location. We had a nice one bedroom suite with access to the executive lounge. The staff there was very nice, specially Ai. I will surely return to the Grosvenor House and recommend it to others but it would be nice if they installed free WIFI access in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “To get somewhere so central andof such a high standard really made our stay in London so enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: FlemingR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to be highly recommended. The day always starts well with such an excellent and unrushed breakfast and with staff for whom nothing seems too much trouble. Courtesy seems to be the byword in the Grosvenor house. Well done and thank you. Roy Fleming

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: wannabRB
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s only the location thatâ€™s going for it..assuming that matters to you.
