Itâ€™s definitely not worth the money and that too after getting a super corporate rate on this that brought it to about 190 pounds for a night. Didnâ€™t think much of the room or the corridors. The bathroom was decently sized. Housekeeping was a disaster. After a 10hr flight, I got to the hotel by noon which was a bit early for a check-in and eventually came back by 8pm to check-in. First, we were given a smoking room without a twin bed even though we were told it was before we headed up to the room. Got back down with the luggage, got another room assigned and this time it was non-smoking but still no twin bed. Informed the front desk who said it would take about an hour to set it up and we headed out for dinner. Got back past midnight only to find the room in a complete mess because the housekeeper had left the job midway after â€˜doing his partâ€™. Showered, got ready and dozed on the chair till 1am as they fixed the bed. The airconditioning was noisy and not cool enough. Didnâ€™t make for a very comfortable night. Then, the joke around internet access. Only wired access in the room and no wifi. Wifi was only available in the lobby and at 6 pounds for an hr it seemed like a rip. Welcome to London I suppose. At the time of checkout, Dildora Vasliddinova at the front desk was super helpful and compensated us well for all the problems. If I ever return to this hotel, it will only be because of her.

Reviews.Title: “My wife loved being greeted by the valets in top hats”
Reviews.Author: T_Dang
Reviews.Content: Relatively large rooms, well appointed with attention to detail. One negative is the tiny bathrooms, small to the point the sink and toilet are unusable if the door is open. However, it was pristine and equipped with towel warmers, a rain-shower, as well as standard shower heads. We were traveling with our infant and what tipped the scales into 5 star territory was the crib and associated bedding provided was pristine. The maid service was also exceptional. The turndown service maid actually folded some baby's clothes that we left out. The location on Park Lane is convenient to marble arch station, oxford st shopping, Hyde Park, we even walked to Buckingham Palace from there.

Reviews.Title: “Reminder-ok if you get a bid deal”
Reviews.Author: McInfarkshun
Reviews.Content: Just a reminder--JW would like you to pay as much as possible for this hotel. Although it's nice, you can stay here for far less if you use a prominent bidding site as I did last year in Spring. $140/night was my winning bid, and you might get it less if you stay off season. On the other hand, there are nicer 5* hotels which one can bid upon as well, also at a discount rate....

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel, conveniently located, great service and hospitable staff, rooms can be bigger”
Reviews.Author: amitsach
Reviews.Content: Found it very convenintly located right next to the oxford street and sprawling hyde park. The restaurant - J w steakhouse - is quite cool though the food is ordinary. The staff is very courteous and responsive. Room service was quite fast. However, the concierge was unreachable most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in London.”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this property, so obviously we enjoyed the first. The room this time was much smaller than last time, despite booking a club floor room both times, so there must be considerable variation in room sizes. Furnishings were very luxurious in an 'old world' style, beds were very comfortable, and service was impeccable once again. The club lounge is fabulous, on a par with Ritz Carlton club lounges, with very attentive service and wide variety of snacks and drinks, as well as computers with internet access and plenty of lounging areas. While the price varies quite a bit, good deals can be had if you keep tracking the prices, and be sure to check for AAA and Marriott Rewards special rates. One warning; the Marriott website lists both the "JW Marriott Grosvenor House" (this property) and the "Marriott London Grosvenor Square", which is not nearly as nice, so be sure not to book the wrong one (as we once did!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that still has a "traditional" old-style hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: PerfectJourneys
Reviews.Content: I arrived mid-morning, after an overnight flight from the States and was not surprised that my room was not quite ready. Receptionist was friendly and apolgetic and offered some tea or coffee while I waited. I only had a short wait though and within about 15 minutes was on my way to room 840. The room was very spacious with a lovely large bathroom. I have put pictures here of the room and the view from it. I only breakfasted at the hotel so cannot really comment on the restaurants or the food. The breakfast was buffet style and I only ate some yoghurt, fruit and toast, but there seemed to be a lot of other options. One negative was the fact that there was not a kettle for making tea (or a coffee brewere) in the room. I know that a lot of 5 star hotels like to say that they are too posh to offer such a thing. That all you need to do is to ring and they will be more than glad to bring you a cup of tea. Well, I very much like to have a cup of tea in the morning while still not dressed and don't really feel comfortable having room service coming in, nevermind the cost and tipping. So, if I could make one recommendation, it would be for the hotel to reconsider their position on the electric kettles. The best bit about my stay was the concierge. I had arrived from the States with two gifts for family and a friend living in the UK, that I wanted to send off. I really didn't want to cart them around for any longer than necessary. They were two small grafted Japanese maple trees from my husbands garden nursery. We had wrapped the roots in damp newspaper and plastic before I left Maine. So, I went down to the desk in the late afternoon and placed the two trees on the desk inquiring if the concierge could help me get these sent off to Scotland and Herefordshire. He didn't bat an eye. "Of course, ma'am, what is your room number? Just leave them with me." After returning from dinner I went to the desk to see how it had gone and he said they were all set, that he had carefully wrapped them, boxed them and had them taken for posting. He then inquired about the variety, telling me that he had grown Japanese Maples himself at one time. It was just a nice experience and I felt good knowing that my trees had been well taken care of. I had not chosen this hotel, I was staying there as part of a small group, and while I would recommend the hotel for people who have a generous budget, there are other hotels in London in the same price range that I personally would prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Eat breakfast out”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler056
Reviews.Content: Room service for breakfast was a disappointment. Pastries tasted stale; eggs were cold and runny. After the first morning, I ate breakfast out. I was right to be skeptical about 5 star boasting on the hotel's website. How often is any Marriott (outside of their Ritz-Carlton line) ever really five star? Service was adequate and professional and followed a Marriott formula, but was in no way personal. As an example, I arrived with colleagues who were of course staying in separate rooms, and bell staff grouped all of our bags together - highly effecient (typically Marriott), but impersonal (also, typically Marriott). Neighborhood is nice, though the hotel is not particularly well located within the neighborhood, so a walk to a good neighborhood restaurant is easily 15 minutes. The intelligent construction of the hotel where it is set back from the street is a real plus for those of us who like a quiet room. The hotel has a very large and well known ballroom which is popular for mid range events, so expect continuous foot traffice through the hotel lobby. I observed no royalty, celebrities or business leaders (as boasted on the hotel's website) attending these events, but it was certainly not a bad crowd of people either. Room was quiet, clean and comfortable; bathroom was nice by Marriott standards -- 4 star, not 5. In public areas on my floor, there was a musty smell which made me feel that the hotel is in need of a renovation, notwithstanding the one recently completed, per to the hotel's website. A surprise on the upside was the terrific dinner at the hotel's steak restaurant, which is nicely laid out and serves high quality food. Overall, my stay was comfortable, and I might return if I needed to be in Mayfair. I would just go with proper expectations: 3 star lobby service, 4 star room, 5 star steakhouse and 1 star room service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: cwuer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here and was impressed with the old word charm of this hotel. Our cab driver was not familiar with the hotel at first as we were apparently not pronouncing the word Grosvenor correctly and the JW Marriott part completely threw him off. If you mention the word Marriott to the cab drivers they immediate think you are talking about the Marriott on Park line. Just call it the Grosvenor House (pronouncer Grovenor, the s is silent) leave off the JW Marriott part or you will confuse them. When we walked into the lobby it is large, open and inviting with an old world charm to it. There was a line at reception and we waited about 10 minutes to check in. The receptionist was very friendly and being Gold members were given a room on the executive floor although we only booked a standard room. The room was HUGE, and I mean even by American standards. There was no view, but coming from our previous hotel it would have paled in comparison anyway, so was not a disappoint to us. The bathroom was equally as large with beautiful black and white marble floors. The bed was extremely plush and comfortable. While the lobby atmosphere was lively and hectic the room itself was very quiet with excellent soundproofing. We had access to the executive lounge and the staff there were extremely pleasant as well as helpful. Juliet even went so far as to go online and try to help us find theater tickets, which is certainly outside the scope of her job. The happy hour had complimentary alcohol, beer, wine, and hors d'oeuvres. The breakfast was OK, mostly continental with some poorly cooked scrambled eggs thrown in, but as it is complimentary I can't complain. What made this longue so special was definitely the friendly staff. The only thing about this property that I did not like was it's distance from the tube. While it may not seem far if you are not walking a lot throughout the day, it seems a long haul when you have been sight seeing all day. We dreaded the walk to and from the tube stop each time we had to make it. While certainly within walking distance it is about a 10 minute brisk walk each way. We were sure wishing there had been those little rickshaw's about to give us a ride back and forth, but never saw any at this location. That really is my only complaint about this hotel and certainly not a reason to keep me from recommending. Location of the hotel otherwise is very good, close to many of the tourist attractions. We did not eat in the restaurants as we had use of the longue. One thing to be aware of is to be very cautions in using the concierge to book theater tickets. We really wanted to see Les Miserable while we were there and were willing to pay a little more for the convenience of having the concierge book tickets for us. We went down one morning and after a quick phone call were told the show was completely sold out but that he could get us good tickets for 109 pounds each. We decided to pass as we knew the most expensive tickets at the box officer were 60 pounds. He told us the show was sold out except for obstructed view tickets for the whole weekend. We were told by someone outside the hotel not to trust what the concierge told us and to go to the box office directly and inquire. We did that and were able to get good seats for about 40 pounds. I do not mind paying extra for the convenience of having a concierge book my tickets but he blatantly lied to us and this kind of markup on tickets is exorbitant. As we were trying to purchase several tickets even at the most expensive tickets he was looking to make about 250 pounds profit on the deal. This leaves a very bad taste in my mouth and I just want to warn others to use caution when looking to book theater tickets from this concierge and don't believe him if he tells you it is sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money- a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: RaDay
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in London together last summer - he working, me visiting family and vacationing. We only stayed a few nights at the Grosvenor House because we were so disappointed and frustrated with it that we moved. We had expected a top-quality, elegant, London hotel with exceptional customer care. What we found was a hotel with staff who didn't seem to care, terrible decor, bad lighting and worse rooms. Ok, so decor is personal taste - but the rooms were garish and badly appointed. They weren't big enough for the size of the furniture or to handle the colour scheme (I felt totally overwhelmed by the bright colours and bold prints and there was only a few foot of space around the bed to move in.) There was next to no closet space. With two of us there, we genuinely couldn't find space to put our clothes (we weren't asking to keep a store-full there, just two week's of clothing for two) or to keep our bags there without falling over them. They offered to store our bags, but then what should we have done with our clothes? Leave them on the chairs? The bathrooms there were small and non-memorable. I never got to see their pool/spa - it was closed while we were there. Worst of all was the view. We had an inner courtyard room. The "view" was of a series of air ducts, bits of construction debris and rubbish. It was awful. I wasn't necessarily expecting a view over the park, but this was tragic. When we complained, they offered us a room on a lower floor with the same view. Odd. The staff member who came to show us the new room said something to the effect of "When I first started, a customer complained because there was a dead pigeon out there, at least that's not there now." We declined the other room and asked them to see if something else came available. After countless conversations about a room change, they finally made one available to us with a street view on our second day. Actually, it looked out over the street and a part of the roof below where bits of rubbish and cigarette butts had collected. Not what you like to see just a few feet from your window. The move itself took forever. Having been told someone was on their way, I ended up waiting in the hallway for almost 45 minutes because housekeeping insisted on cleaning just then and there was literally nowhere for me to stand or sit in the room while she did. Eventually a maintenance man working on the room opposite called front desk for me (twice) to get someone to come up and help me move. We stayed one more night, on a bed that made my arms go numb, and then moved to a new hotel. While they were apologetic about our experience they also promised we'd hear from them by mail and we never did. I can't imagine why anyone would think this kind of experience worth the sort of money they charge for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SubaruDriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room that had it's own living area with sofa and chairs as well as TV, and 2 bathrooms. The bed was massive, and incredibly comfortable. The toiletries were of very high quality, the size of room impressive. I can't get for the life of me why a hotel that charges this much means you have to pay for internet access. I also don't understand why a business hotel doesn't have a trouser press - it's not as if you are struggling for room. The TV has plenty of channels - many being in languages that are not English - which is great for such a well established hotel. The location - on Park Lane is excellent for the West End, Buckingham Palace, Oxford Street, Piccadilly, Harrods etc - all being walkable or a short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury, a perfect stay for my parents 40th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: PassportUK
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend visited this hotel with my parents in Dec 2010 to celebrate my parents 40th wedding anniversary. I booked this hotel as I wanted something special and close to all the big attractions and I was not disappointed. From the moment we arrived, and our car was valet parked, to the moment we left, we received nothing but first class service. Every member of staff was happy and polite and not once did we feel we were being looked down on. I had a standard room, with a good view, and was more spacious than I expected from a hotel in the centre of London. It was finished to a high spec, with everything you would expect, except tea and coffee making facilities. The bed was huge and very comfortable, a good nights sleep was had by all. Despite being in London the hotel is extremely quiet. My parents had a suite which was amazing. It had a lovely seperate lounge area, large bedroom with a 4 poster bed, and an enormous bathroom. It was so nice they did not want to leave. My parents loved their room and also had an excellent night sleep. Because we had so much planned such as a West End Show, London Eye, Thames Cruise, London Dungeons, Madame Tussauds etc we did not have time to sample the food at the hotel or experience any of the other facilities. The hotel was only a short 5-10min walk to the nearest Tube Station so getting around is easy. Overall we left feeling very special and pampered. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay, comfortable bed, and great ambience in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TamaraSomerset Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Grateful for the surprise upgrade, added to our stay. Enjoed breakfast, great choices. Bed very comfortable, Will definately go back to try the steak restaurant next time. The extra large bed was so omfortable

Reviews.Title: “Class... no more could be said”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Lowestoft
Reviews.Content: Absolutely outstanding, perfect in every manner!! Whether it be for 1 night or a week, go for it

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: DessertGirl79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grosvenor House in December for 6 nights and had a wonderful stay! The room was very large (especially for London) and was beautifully decorated. The beds and sheets were very comfortable and the bathroom was white marble and had plenty of towels and robes for both of us. The hotels location was perfect and was a short walk to hyde park, shopping and many restaurants. The staff was super friendly and helpful with all of our requests. It was an easy location to get around also and it was a short taxi ride to nightlife. The fitness center was the best I have ever seen in a hotel and was brand new! We also had the privlage of the executive lounge and that was great and always had a nice selection of food for breakfast and apps at dinnertime along with drinks. Overall, I can't wait to stay here again and I can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but too proud of itself”
Reviews.Author: DougStevens
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in London and chose the Grosvenor House for location and quality. We were pleased with both aspects. What irks me about the hotel was a general snobbish attitude from staff and it was overpriced to value. Both showed through when we checked in and assigned a roomsthat looked out against a brick wall (there are probably only a half-dozen rooms in the entire hotel with such a view).. We got a fairly good deal with a prepaid, non-refundable rate and it appears we paid the price by being assigned an inferior room location when the hotel had only a 10% occupancy at best. I don't understand this type of decisioon by management.

Reviews.Title: “My London stay.”
Reviews.Author: victoriafrommiami
Reviews.Content: My friend and had the pleasure of staying here when we visited London and we just loved it! It is a true 5 star hotel with top service and beautiful surroundings. We got lucky and were allocated a corner room which was massive. Gorgeous marble bathroom and lovely beds. We treated ourselves to a cocktail downstairs in the Red Bar, which was super swanky, albeit a bit pricey! It was about 10 mins. walk to Oxford street and all the amazing shops, and you must go to the famous store Selfridges which was fantastic to spend the day wandering around. We loved it here and dream of returing one day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: doyleb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grosvenor House on business from 31 January to 5 Feb 2011. On check-in, the friendly and efficient front desk clerk allowed me to check in early and provided an upgrade to the Executive floor. The room was small but comparable to other major city hotels (i.e NYC or SF). The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large enough with all needed amenities, good water pressure and temperature. The main restaurant is their steakhouse which I only ate in once. The meal was good but again rather pricy. The Executive floor lounge was open for a full breakfast at 6:00 AM and remained open until midnight. Never had the time to see what they offered in the evening. The hotel location for touring is very good - across from Hyde Park and within walking distance to many areas, although again my trip was from the hotel to the tube station and back again. Overall I would stay in the property again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: MP-Norway
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at this hotel. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite. We got a great room with a king bed zize, lovely to sleep in. We also had a living room with sofa and a chair. Flat Screen TV in both bedroom and living room. Coffee and tea facilities were brought to the room. We got a friendly greeting from the hotel which consisted of a card, red wine and strawberries with chocolate coating. Fluffy bathrobes and slippers were in the room. Very nice piece of furniture in our suite. We had a cleaning staff twice daily. Both the suite and public areas of the hotel were very clean. The staff was wonderful, accommodating, pleasant. Nothing negative to say about the staff. Location of the hotel was good for us, close to everything. 5 minute walk to Oxford Street. 3 minute walk to the bus that goes to the Westfield shopping center, close to piccadilly + + + A great experience to be a guest at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the location”
Reviews.Author: Whatatraveller Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if a little tired looking. Excellent service, very efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 1 coworker and my boss. While it was a good looking hotel I just didnt think it was worth anywhere the money paid. I had no problems but there was nothing there that made this hotel one of the best I have ever stayed. Checkin No problems and they had me to my room pretty fast which was great since I was there so early on a Monday. The front desk girl was very friendly. Room It was nice but nothing special that made it worth the nightly rate and we were on the executive floor. Setup nice with a ton of closet space. There was a safe in the room also which I always like on trips to another country. Beds They were OK. Again the same theme that they were nothing I called home and said we needed to buy one of these beds today! Bathroom This might have been on the best things in the hotel. It was very nice bright and large. Hot water was no problem at all. Internet Way overpriced. I think it was 25GBP which made it like $40US. Concierge They were very helpful as you would expect in a fancy hotel. Doormen/Bellhops They were worthless to me. Most of the time they were talking and didn't open the door. They would barely even look at you to acknowledge you were close to them. Oxford Street Its a short walk to Oxford street which was nice. The reviews for this hotel seem to be repeating so I would never stay here again. I think they make people think they are in a top hotel with the rates they charge but it was not worth half of what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED!”
Reviews.Author: rotag99
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend too much money on a hotel I highly recommend this place. Dig deep and you can watch t.v. for 15 pounds a day...that means any television. How about digging your teeth into a burger that would cost you the price of filet migon anywhere else? Just not worth it. Good service, good location, otherwise save the cash and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Premier class hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: DAISYBOO17
Reviews.Content: Attending a Motor Trade Ball but had to wait 30 mins in line in the lobby whilst reception staff struggled to check increasing numbers of guests in - check in could best be described as chaotic and people were made late for the function as a result. Eventually reached our room on 5th floor to find the room key had not been programmed - back to reception! Room very small and nothing special - lucky we didn't spend much time in it. Skipped the over priced breakfast given the service so poor. Advised valet parking when we would require car back and still had to wait an inordinate time. Supposed to be a premier hotel - have received better service in a Premier Inn - save your money for the shops and avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: FortLauderdale17
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful, professional staff. First class rooms with all the comforts of four/five star hotels. Very comfortable beds. Great location for visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with the level of service”
Reviews.Author: soaper28
Reviews.Content: I am not sure about this hotel, maybe we are spoiled by Asian 5 stars. The service was not up to the standard of a 5 star hotel, for example when we arrived with our luggage no one offered to take it up to our room, concierge staff congregated around their desk so they were not busy. The door staff did not open the door for us and at one stage my partner found the door stuck and was observably having trouble opening it, and only his struggling brought them over to open the door for us. When we left it took a good 10 mins to contact some one to collect the luggage. On the plus side, we changed rooms because of the noise of an interconnecting room, and we were changed quickly and efficiently, and the Restaurant staff at breakfast were very attentive, the food was also good quality. The beds are very comfey

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great room and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: MJTG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 1 night in December 2010, got an upgrade to a superior room, the bed was big enough for 4 people and the room was clean and had everything you'd need for a stay of any length of time! Great central location, nice and close for everything! Might cost you a bit more, but if you're not on a budget and can afford to stay here it is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “perfect perfect perfect”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an absolutely wonderful weekend at the Grosvenor House. Although we come from London we like to play tourists once a year to do all the museums and trips you don't otherwise bother with in your home town! We just loved this hotel. As Marriot members we got to use the club lounge and I enjoyed a lovely afternoon tea whilst reading the newspapers then we went back later for wine and canapes before dinner. It was a very good home from home. Our room was sumptuously appointed, though only with a view of the inner courtyard - this is a MASSIVE hotel - and the marble bathroom gorgeous We had loads of snow that weekend and it was so nice to snuggle up in this lovely warm cosy hotel then walk for hours in Hyde Park outside Finally the JW Steakhouse was the best meal we had this year - you must go there. The food and staff were stunning and I liked the chalk boards and decor, really cool

Reviews.Title: “for the price, I expect more”
Reviews.Author: billyclyde
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights with my wife and daughter, who is a young adult. The hotel is nicely located across from Hyde Park. The closest tube stations (Marble Arch and Hyde Park Corner) are a couple of blocks away. Whether or not this is close enough for you is your decision. We were lugging our luggage around, and this was probably about as far as we'd want to walk. Unencumbered with luggage, we do like to walk, and the hotel is located near many of the primary tourist attractions -- we easily walked to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, Parliament, and the London Eye, before catching the tube back to Harrods, and then walking back to the hotel. In the morning, I ran in Hyde Park. The hotel is nicely appointed, but nothing special, and lacks ramps which are important when we are carrying lots of luggage. The doorman opened the door for us, but nobody offered to help us with our bags. In the morning, there were two long queues of people checking in or out -- making customers wait is simply unacceptable for any place, let alone a place as upscale as this. The internet fee is outrageous. In the room, the only option is wired access at 20 pounds. That's the steepest of any place I've stayed at. We went down to the bar and were going to have some drinks, maybe some food, and enjoy internet access there, but they also charged for access there. (I thought the woman who checked us in said it was free in the lounge.) If my daughter and I had use the internet there, it would have been another 20 pounds -- each. That really adds up. I'm an elite Marriot Rewards member, and usually I get free internet access, but not here. The room was nice, but our view was not. Beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was nice. The hair dryer did not work, and there was no in-room coffee maker. My wife and daughter got room service one night, and they said the food came quickly and was good. The fitness room was good, but (again) not great. There were five treadmills there, but two were broken. Overall, it appears that you are primarily paying for the location, and not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice location”
Reviews.Author: EvaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great location, near all the greatest shopping streets - walking distance - Gordon Ramsey restaurent. Great tub in room, no noise. What's not to like!

Reviews.Title: “false fire alarm going off at various time . . . :(”
Reviews.Author: sharona714
Reviews.Content: i am staying here currently 11/28-12/17.. Yap. its a long long time. Hotel: 1. anyways, lets start with the nightly false FIRE ALARM at 2am... the fire alarm went off 11/29, 11/30 and 12/5 at various times. It is not fun to be waking up at 1ish in the morning, gathering your personal items, walked down 6 floors, only to find out it was false alarm. 2. internet service. they charge Â£20 per/day for internet use. Â£140 for a week usage. It is only for single computer use. if you got 2 , 3 computers, (i.e. one for work, one for personal use, and my iphone) they wanted charge you 3 times. and NO wifi access in the hotel room, only WiFi access is in the lobby or business center. It is NOT FREE, of course, you have to pay for it as well. so just image my reaction to find out that I was charged Â£600 for internet usage. Hotel Room: 1. a/c in the room didn't work for the first night as well, took them 2 days before it was fixed. ( when I requested the space heater, they had none to be checked out. ) 2.one star for the large room size, and the bed is very comfortable. I really appreciate the large bathroom as well. so far I had a very disappointing stay here at the Grosvenor House.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, location and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: kdsama
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't stay at the Grosvenor House after reading some of the negative reviews; now that I've stayed there it will be my first choice hotel in London! The staff could not have been nicer or more gracious and the room and bathroom were spacious, lovely and beautifully appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds and bedding!”
Reviews.Author: Cathendo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grosvenor House for a couple of days following a trip on the Orient Express. Check in was swift and the front of house staff attentive. Our room was large with an equally impressive bathroom. Bathrobes and slippers were provided. Bathroom toiletries were of an excellent standard. The bed was enormous with the most divinely comfortable bedding. This is definitely the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. We had paid a rate which included bed & breakfast plus evening meal in the J.W. Steakhouse for two nights. The first night we found the restaurant to be quite noisy but the serving staff were very efficient. There was a slight hiccup on the second night with regards to the bill. We had been quoted a price for dinner for two nights but the restaurant manager said they only offered this for one night. Luckily I had brought the confirmatory e-mail with me which clearly stated dinner for two nights. This resolved things straight away. On the second night the steakhouse was much quieter. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and the service was of a high standard. There were plenty of waiting staff. We had afternoon tea in our room which arrived on a huge trolley. It was very impressive. We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay and would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but service not good enough and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: bobsmith3849
Reviews.Content: title says it all really. Paid big money for a room that was simply adequate. Staff serving me (banqueting facilities) were mediocre and lacklustre.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations--if you're a mouse”
Reviews.Author: AngieCD48
Reviews.Content: My single room at Grosvenor House was so small... 1. I thought I accidentally ended up in "Harry Potter" house elf Dobby's room 2. the last celebrity to stay in this room was Tom Thumb 3. should have been tipped off by the mobile above the bed that this was a child's bed 4. didn't realize the "6" and "5" in the room number referred to the room's dimensions (in feet). 5. thought a wheel of cheddar under the door was imminent. 6. as a 5-foot-2-inch tall woman, my feet hung over the bed 7. on the upside, if I needed a drink of water, all I needed to do was sit up in bed and reach for the bathroom sink. 8. not so much a window in the room as a porthole 9. at least I won't feel claustrophobic in a coffin after my 2-night stay here 10. my shoebox wouldn't fit through the door 11. it wasn't so much a bed I slept in as a it was a crib with the side rails removed 12. Room 650 is actually a broom closet with a bidet 13. It shouldn't be called a single. Better description is "half." 14. During my stay, I developed a curious craving for cheese and a fear of cats 15. Ah well, no need to visit the London Dungeon after staying here.

Reviews.Title: “All that you would expect for the price”
Reviews.Author: creolegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. There is a high price tag, but it is worth every penny. Upon arrival the staff was friendly and welcoming. There were a lot of check in's upon arrival, but they kept the lines moving and the wait was short. Our hotel room was spacious, clean, and beautiful. All of the surroundings in the room were plush and expected. Our only issue was the sewage smell that was outside of our room. The smell became unbearable and could be smelled from the hallway outside of our door. We were moved to another room upon notifying the front desk. The steakhouse in the hotel was good, but it is a bit pricey. The bar staff in the resturant was great and we even ate at the bar from their menu for two nights. There is a small cafe with coffee and snacks at a very reasonable price. I would suggest going there if you do not want a hot meal. I would stay at this hotel again and plan to on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Goood hotel”
Reviews.Content: I styayed 2 nights on business and found the hotel to be well managed.We arrived early and were given rooms after not too long a wait. Ther staff are well trained and service crisp.Well done

Reviews.Title: “Everything is just right and solid”
Reviews.Author: kcym
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night following a birthday celebration. Good location near Hyde Park. The room was neat and good size for central London standard. Helpful staff and despite the small size (okay for London standard but otherwise small), every part of the hotel was fully utilised in a nice way including the setting of the room. The afternoon tea was of a high standard, the scones deserve a special mention. The sandwich bar was helpful in the sense that they ordered me a fresh salad from the kitchen upon my request. Parking overnight was very expensive though, but not unexpected from Mayfair. Overall I would stay in this hotel again. Good value for a 5 star hotel in Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Brand on Ritzy Road”
Reviews.Author: RSuzuki
Reviews.Content: Comfortable American-size rooms on Park Lane. You'd be amiss to expect service at par to the neighboring Dorchester or Four Season and it doesn't compare to other JW hotels in Asia which can be quite spectacular. The hotel construction is grand and I appreciate the attention to detail: large towel warmers in the bathrooms, substantial pillows and full bedding, elegant electronic room keys, and the hotel's own china with Grosvenor House design throughout. Visiting from the States you will feel at home. Unfortunately the hotel felt servery understaffed. Always a queue at the front desk and at the concierge. We hosted friends on three occasions in the lobby tea room... service was slow and inattentive. I was forced to fetch our waitress for orders, refill, etc. We stayed on the executive level with access to a crowded lounge. Same here as in the lobby. Rubbish and half eaten biscuits were left piling up on tables while the few staff members rushed around trying to keep the space as tidy as possible. The food offering at breakfast and hors d'oeurves was quite minimal. Beyond these annoyances expect a friendly staff and, of course, a grand location perfect for visiting London. However, if you are looking for a Marriott n London I recommend the Grosvenor Square hotel before this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Housekeeping highly praised”
Reviews.Author: klh717
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel which I mentioned to the check out staff that I would certainly give my review at TA and I got it at priceline & again I am goin back this Feb11. Prompt check-in and room is extremely clean. (I called the hotel to request for non-smoking room and they reply to my e-mail in seconds, this Marriott is definitely higher end than Marriott Park Lane which we stayed in Feb10 & I don't mind walking a bit further from the Marble Arch tube station for the extra comfort of this hotel). Concierge is also highly praised for their professional service render. Keep it up & can't wait to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Purrrrfect”
Reviews.Author: Shivens
Reviews.Content: Beautifully located, great staff, Absolutely amazing steaks ( in my expert opinion the best steaks I have ever had anywhere) . Great rooms. Lovely lounge for club floor guests with lots of stuff to eat and complimentary drinks. A special counter to get you the best seats to any play you want to see in London ( don't miss the lion king) Just no complaints. If you don't mind putting your hand a little deeper into your pocket then staying here is an absolute no brainer. Booking in advance off their website had some great deals often.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value if you Priceline it”
Reviews.Author: mariahbay
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Mayfair, but not at the steep tariffs normally charged. Worked Priceline and landed the J.W. Marriott, Grosvenor House. What a treat. Completely refurbished. Everything from incoming reception (yes, reception and thank you Ann), room service, food and bar experience was top of the line. We upgraded to the next level room for only 30Â£. Location was great too; easy walk to Marble Arch Tube, but taxis made more sense while staying here. Great neighborhood dining options (think Scotts for seafood. Oh, yes and those with high-end car envy will have more neighborhood eye candy than they can handle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, solid Marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: This is a JW Marriott hotel. It's not an old English dame, but a high end American chain hotel which has retained the name "Grosvenor". This is not a criticism - I love the consistent quality of the Marriott brand, it's just that you won't find much English eccentricity in these accommodations. And for me that was great. I can just visualize a marketing team at Marriott corporate headquarters in Bethesda Maryland looking at focus group reports on the name "Grosvenor". All this is not to say the hotel doesn't retain a certain amount of wonderful English charm and character mixed with top notch service. The rooms are beatifully appointed with sensitively chosen bathroom fittings, luxurious drapes and the best linens. Maid service is top notch and discreet, and there are wonderful little surprises like bath salts, turndown chocolates and luxurious touches that make all the difference. The platinum lounge is also wonderful with a delicious breakfast selection and a great tea room atmosphere. All up, it's exactly what you would expect from a JW in London - excellent service, luxurious accommodations and a very high quality product.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBuchanan3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel located on Park Lane. Staff are very friendly and efficient as you would expect in a hotel of this standard. Public areas are very well maintained and presented. Rooms we were in was spacious with very comfortable double bed and well presented bathroom. We were at a function in the hotel and enjoyed a beautiful meal - would like to imagine restaurant would be up to the same standard. Breakfast was very enjoyable also. Looking forward to having a chance to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A classic English, grand and posh city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TomKuhne
Reviews.Content: A classic English, grand and posh city hotel excellent situated next to Hide park. Oxford street is on five minutes walking distance as well as metro station Marble Arch. The spacious rooms are very classic furnished with contrasts of dark wooden furniture and light colored walls and curtains. The bed is fair enough as the matrass could be better. The room is equiped with a medium flat screen tv, safe, alarm clock and a mini-bar with charged beverages and snacks. The small marble bathroom has a bath with rain shower. The service of the on-floor staff is sufficient but the expected class and professionality is missing. The cleaning is done on-time and very decent! Continental/English breakfast is splendid with a good various choice. It is served in the cozy ambiant Park room which reflects an English living room. The hotel has a class entourage, but the overall staff could be more professional. It is well situated, the room is good and breakfast is splendid!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury personified”
Reviews.Author: kellclan
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with wonderful amenities. Only disappointment was no free wifi and very expensive hookup charges. (6 Â£ for only 1 hour!) Wonderful concierge service gave us great directions and suggestions for restaurants close to our theaters.

Reviews.Title: “average corp hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tjctravels
Reviews.Content: despite my title, the one knock on the location is that it's not that close to tube stops, which is semi important as london traffic is renowned. the basic problem with the Grosvenor is that it's very expensive (every single thing is extra; welcome to the world) and the product is just not at that level. concierge can't help out with a reservation? need i point out that wifi is something like 30eu per day and not available in the rooms! however, to be fair, wired inet access is available at 10eu/hour! so, think ...very expensive, not very good, and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “You will probably expet more than you get”
Reviews.Author: girlieee
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed while shopping in London. It's quite out of the way, it's about a 20 minuet walk to the centre and Â£10.00 in a cab. The hotel it's self was lovely however it felt like you was walking for miles from the Lobby to your room as the place is so big! The rooms had very high celings but was quite small. We had no facilities but had use of the exsecutive lounge which was nice but i would much prefere self service in my own room.The big window next to the show was not very plesent, although you could not see through it, it still freaked me out. There was also an alarm going off at 11.00 in our room to wake us up because we was checking out at 12, i found that rude and inappropriate. The drinks are well over priced but the service is good. I would reccomend this hotel for Business purpose, not so much leisure.

Reviews.Title: “The best I've seen in London”
Reviews.Author: sg8109
Reviews.Content: After writing all the negative reviews for all the other hotels I stayed at in London, I have to be fair and write about this one as well. This hotel is by far my favorite. Their rates won't make your expense report look obnoxious and the place is devoid of all ills other London hotels suffer. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. Good mattresses, which is important. Excellent room service, good food. Can't beat the location. Staff was very helpful and polite. I stayed there in April 2010, during the volcano eruption, and they provided discounted drycleaning and some sort of entertainment for stranded guests (which i did not end up using but thought it was a nice touch). Overall, thumbs up, next time I am in London this is where I am staying.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to use MR Points”
Reviews.Author: DC20something
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well taken care of and the staff was helpful and polite (but rarely friendly, not necessarily a negative). Prints of London landmarks on the walls in the halls were a nice touch. The bathroom has a towel warmer which was nice and our room had a slim view of Hyde park! Located in swanky Mayfair, just a few steps from Hyde Park Corner or Marble Arch but far enough away that there isn't a ton of pedestrians. Nearby pub The Audley is nice, and Mount Street Deli is an amazing place for breakfast/lunch/snacks. We walked to Regents park, Soho, the V&A, Buckingham Palace, even the Tate Britain. Concierge was able to get tickets to Tower of London which allowed us to skip the queue. The Executive Lounge staff was very polite but we seemed to always miss the hors'd'oeuvres but free booze and waters is always appreciated. The gym was really nice! There is a JW Steakhouse but you may not get it "to go" and you may not order from that menu to room service. Room service is VERY expensive, but it does have an Arabic/Halal menu.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, iffy service”
Reviews.Author: kceteew
Reviews.Content: I was there on a short work trip, arrived Monday Sep 13. There had been a mix up on the booking - not the hotel's fault - but the hotel was very unhelpful about it. when they promised to get in touch with me when it was corrected, they didn't. in fact, i had gone down repeatedly over a day to the hotel's reception to sort things out. only to be told their sales person wasn't around to solve it. but if you took away that, it was a nice room and it's so near Hyde Park it's nice to take a stroll, especially when you feel so let down by the service at the front desk. another big problem: the lack of free wifi. at the rates being paid, and with so many hotels providing free wi fi, it is shocking that you have to pay forwifi in the hotel and it costs so much to get it here too.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay---a few complaints though”
Reviews.Author: levittr
Reviews.Content: I got this on priceline for a really good price. I generally ignore all positive feedback on here because I assume the hotel is writing it. I thus look for negative reviews and see if there is a common theme. The common theme I found about this hotel was that the service sucked. We generally did NOT have bad service. We got there and had a queen size bed. They wanted Â£30 per night for a king size delux room.....I was REALLY nice and asked if we could have it free since the hotel wasn't full. They finally said okay. We were on the 6th floor. The view wasn't great but we didn't care. The room was decent size. Great marble bathroom. Location: pretty good. Easy walk to marble arch. this hotel has as good a location as any for all of the sites. However, if you plan to be in soho a lot, then keep in mind that after clubbing you have to pay a Â£10 cab ride to get back and/or walk 30 mins to the hotel....not a big deal if you ask me. My one gripe: Internet cost Â£20 per day which is RIDICULOUS! I refused to pay this so I went to a vodaphone store (there are a few on oxford street which is the same street the marble arch underground station is on) and got a sim card for my unlocked iPhone. The sim card cost Â£5 but came with Â£5 in credit. For Â£5 you can get 250mb of internet to use for a month!!! If you go over it is only 50p a day for 25 more MBs. I tethered my iphone to my computer and thus had internet for Â£5 TOTAL rather than paying Â£20 per night. Also, t-mobile sells a USB wireless modem for Â£20 that you can plug into ANY laptop. For the Â£20 you get the USB stick, and one month to use 3 GIGs of internet on your computer! I'm sure the other mobile phone stores have similar deals. My suggestion is to NOT spend Â£20 per night on internet and use one of these other options. Service: never had room service or had any problems. The only time we called the front desk was to get a new do not disturb sign since ours was missing. They came within 5 mins which met my expectations. The maids came twice a day (the second time to turn down the bed)...and they cleaned the room well. For two days they were fixing hot water....the hot water was shut off in the middle of the day for a few hours. No big deal but I'm sure if I was paying full rate and complained enough they would have done something. As it was I didn't complain....weird though that they chose to do repairs during the middle of the day rather than in the middle of the night. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and stay here again. I would never purchase internet for Â£20 a night though. In addition, if I was going to pay full price, I'd stay at the renaissance chancery court because for ME, the location was a little better (I was out very late in soho every night).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels - but the service ...”
Reviews.Author: Censuwine
Reviews.Content: I won't write at length about the quality of this hotel. It is up there with the best of them and everything about it is top notch stuff. However, in common with many London Hotels, management does not seem to invest too heavily in staff development and general upgrading of language skills. I would like to mention two incidents in particular: 1) Check in for three people took 32 minutes and the girl insisting in registering us as Portuguese despite asking for our passports. The rooms reserved were King/Queen/Large Twin. By the time of check in (circa 1 pm) we were told that only one room was available (I believe it was Room 573, possibly the most claustrophic place in London). On drawing the attention of the receptionist that we had booked higher quality rooms she said ... what for it ... here it comes: "Wait until 3pm and you might be able to try to change the room". Wow! How's that for a non-committal answer? She must be given every encouragement to pursue a career in the diplomatic service. Eventually, the Manager was summoned and the three rooms made available more than satisfied our expectations. 2) The hotel had some problems with hot water supply (6/7 September 2010) and the management left a note in each room explaining the situation to its clients. Apparently, the problem was solved and staff were given instructions to retrieve the note from each room. On the second floor, a member of staff barged her way into the rooms allowing the best part of 1 nanosecond between her knock and opening the door. One of my colleagues had just emerged from the shower. The lady mumbled something possibly apologetic in broken English and barged straight out. To be fair, the charming lady on the first floor went about the same duties in a more discrete fashion. Go on Management, go the last mile and make this a truly perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: AuditorUk
Reviews.Content: I note that some visitors to this Hotel have been somewhat hard to please. All I can say is that this is a superb hotel with equally superb staff. The room was large and comfortable and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Food was exactly what you would expect for a 5* hotel. Staff were attentive, efficient yet unobtrusive, ever cheerful and courteous I would particularly single out 'Matt' on the reception desk for praise. He is a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good enough”
Reviews.Author: LondonPilot
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at the hotel was long winded and laborious. Having pre checked in, the registration staff had no idea and could not locate our luggage which had been delivered the day before! As we were part of a wedding party, the delay at reception had the consequence of us missing half of our own drinks reception!! The room was ordinary at best and the internal facing window opened up to side drains. Not pleasant at all. The staff were friendly but ineffectual. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Service, Smelly Room (but great breakfast!)”
Reviews.Author: dklondon
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews before staying here I had low expectations, but these were unfortunately confirmed. Our room was OK with a very comfortable bed, but the view into an internal light well (rather than the park!) was a little disappointing. However, it was obvious that the previous guest had been a smoker, and even airing the room did not remove the smell. My major complaint was the service, due to an amazing issue with an airport pick up. We booked a Mecedes car with the Concierge to collect our Client from Heathrow, and the car basically got bored waiting and went home. We then had to deal with an angry Client who, like us, had flown from China to attend a meeting with us in London. This soured the first meeting when they finally arrived and basicly ruined the trip. An incredible cock up for a 5 star hotel. The only good memory was the (inclusive) breakfast which was truly outstanding. One of the best I have ever had, in any hotel, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: salli_10
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was worried about the quality of the hotel. I must say, some of the reviews were probably a bit harsh. Our room was beautiful, well decorated, with a comfortable bed. The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and the hotel more than lived up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved since last stay - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Holliday
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December 2008 and it was a poor experience. Back then, the hotel had just opened under the new branding odf JW Marriott and was still finding its feet. After nearly 2 years, decided to return and try it again. On checking in (I am a Platinum Marriott Rewards member) I was greeted warmly and the Duty Manager actually escorted me to the room. To be fair, they had remembered on my last trip that I had to complain about noise and service quality sisues, so they were out to impress!! The room, a spacious corner room overlooked Hyde Park and was wonderful. I visited the Executive lounge that evening and was pleased to find that complimentary food and drinks (including free flowing Champagne) are still available between 6pm-8pm. The Exective lounge is an excellent perk and on this stay, was very quiet throughout my 2 day stay. Continental breakfast is served daily from 6am-10am. a delicious afternoon tea aof sandwiches and warm scones with jam and clotted cream is also served daily from 3pm-5pm. I found all staff from housekeeping to Management, very friendly throughout and everyone had time for a quiet word or two. Had dinner on my final night at the newly opened, JW Steakhouse - the food was amazing and well worth a visit - servcie was attentive and friendly throughout. I found my room very comfortable and really enjoyed my visit. The hotel is not cheap, but you do get what you pay for - so if you are after luxury with friendly service - this hotel is worth a visit. I will be back and already have my next trip booked.

Reviews.Title: “How are the mighty fallen...”
Reviews.Author: Flying-Duchess
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a great hotel with brilliant service and a lovely ambiance. I have stayed here every time IÂ´ve been to London for 10-15 years, but no more! The three last stayes have been very disappointing, and despite of the staffs promises to "have their manager call me after the weekend", I have never heard anything from them again. The first time this happened, I thought there had been a mistake, but after three occurences of the same issues, I have resorted to changing hotel. When I asked for something, I had to remind the staff several times before the problems were fixed. I will not list all problems, as I donÂ´t have the time, but here are a few of them: My fiance and I asked for separate duvays at our arrival at the hotel in the morning. *The following evening, we asked again. The following morning we asked again, and four eight later they had still not acomplished to change them and we gave up. * I delivered a blouse for cleaning and specified "no ironing" on the label. The blouse was ironed and ruined, but they still hang it on my door withour even mentioning that they had ruined it. When I noticed, they appologised but did nothing about it. I asked to speak to the manager, they told me that he would call me after the weekend but he never did. *I became ill at one time when I was there, and called housekeeping to get some extra towels. I waited three hours and called four times to remind them. Finally, I had to get dressed and go to the reception myself to get the towels. *Some of the rooms are very small and some of the so-called double beds are only one and a half bed. I have stayed in connecting rooms, suites and normal single- and double-rooms and the quality is very varying within each booking category. If you are so unfourtunate to have to stay at this hotel, make sure you get everything fixed while you are there and donÂ´t believe the staff if they say they will have someone call you - it will never happen! (Please excuse my bad English).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: BfmacSingapore
Reviews.Content: We used Reward Points to book so I cannot tell you the actual cost of the rooms. The location was perfect, just a five to 10 minute walk from the tube station. Our room was not ready at 3:00pm but the hotel staff were kind enough to offer us free coffee and pastries from the coffee shop while we waited for just 30 minutes. The room was very nice with most likely the most comfortable bed I have slept in for quite some time. What can I say? its a JW and I have never stayed at a bad JW. Taxi ride to LHR was around 60 pounds

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough.”
Reviews.Author: dodds77
Reviews.Content: nice big room, huge comfy bed, his and her sinks in the bathroom, which again was huge. Terrible view though and a handyman came into our room when we were sleeping to change a bulb, which he continued to do, that really irritated me. Good location though, 10 minutes walk from Oxford St and 2 minutes from Hyde Park. Also, the most extortionate cup of tea ever, but it was worth it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment, but Staff Did Not Care”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Cotton
Reviews.Content: After having read about problems with rooms, I telephoned the hotel a week before arriving to make sure I was given a room with some kind of view. I had bought the room at a discounted rate, from a third party seller, Travelrepublic. I have bought many rooms through this site and have never had a problem before. I was told by reservations that I had not paid enough for my room to be able to choose a view. Very nice response, I did not think, certainly did not make me feel a valued guest. I did at least confirm that my booking was correct and when I was due to arrive. On arrival at the Hotel, my booking did not exist, they had lost lost my booking. I was told that the failure was down to the travel site I booked with and should have booked with Marriott direct. The receptionist called travelrepublic a 2 bit organisation who dont know what they are doing. I have booked a number of hotels through this site and have had no problems before. They had me arriving on the 1st October, yet my booking was for May. They argued with me, even though I had the accommodation voucher stating the correct dates. I was told that travelrepublic must have filed the dates wrongly. I pointed out to the receptionist that I had called the Hotel the week before and all dates were confirmed as being OK. He even argued with me and told me I had not called the Hotel. I was treated in an abysmal way by the Receptionist because yet again and I quote "I had not paid enough for the room and I had booked it through a third party". I am sorry, but if someone at this Hotel, makes a decision to sell a room at a certain price, should I be penalised for buying it? The simple answer to this is NO! The receptionist made several phone calls and after 20 minutes admitted the error was the Hotels not mine or Travelrepublics but gave No apology. We were not given a coffee while we waited, no recompense, nothing whilst we waited. Very very disappointing. Not what you would expect for a Hotel of this nature. The room was OK but complete;y soulless. Red walls, strange corridor wall paper, nice bedroom and comfy bed......and in the end wonderful views of the park. The bathroom and shower unit were not the best. Turn down service was just that, they turned the bed down. No gift, no slippers, no mat. We are talking a top 5 star property and a 3 room suite and nothing but a sheet turn down. For me, a 5 star experience begins and ends with the small things, that 4 star hotels don't give. This hotel does not know where to start with customer service, never mind the small touches. At breakfast, I was not asked if I required toast or coffee. I was ignored by staff who were too busy talking to themselves or by managers who were busy talking to other managers or by managers introducing guests to the managers. I was sat on my own with no service. I had to ask for both coffee and toast. While waiting for my toast, a manager in a suit came over and without saying anything removed my plate of jams, whilst I was sat at the table. He lent over me without saying excuse me and took my jam and honey, unbelievably rude. Can you imagine this happening at a top USA Marriott or in the Far East. This abysmal service could only happen in a London Hotel. I had to get up and ask for them back. I needed some information, so went to the Concierge. The prevailing could not care less about guests attitude, was even here. I asked for some information, but was served as he was also dealing with another guest. He went to google, did a search and printed off some material, that did not match what I had asked for. He could not care less. I felt like a second class citizen at this hotel. reading other reviews about this hotel, I am not the first to be dealt with in this manner. The hotel is trading from its name and former reputation. I highly rate the Chesterfield in Mayfair. I recommend anyone thinking of booking this snob ridden ignorantly staffed hotel, to book the far superior Chesterfield, which is usually cheaper, where they know how to treat any guest. I am still looking for a London 5 star property that can match for service the Hotels I have stayed in in the USA, EU and Far East...my search continues. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: peely95
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a weekend break to london . the hotel is in a good location for central London but it is not up there with other 5* hotels we have stayed at .the biggest annoyance is that the maids insist on entering every room at 8.30 every morning come what may and the bathroom was very small .Nice but for the money could be better !!

Reviews.Title: “Great area and service”
Reviews.Author: vegasitalian
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place and very friendly staff. Since we are not used to the high prices in Europe, I appreciated the little area like Starbucks for breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of the days gone by”
Reviews.Author: MelPai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a company occasion. The hotel has a wonderful old and grand feel to it, apparently it was built in the 1920s. They were planning to go under renovation, so i don't know what it looks like now. It faces Hyde Park. The location is great, a lot of the historical areas and places of interest are walking distance and the Subway is a min away (Marble Arch). Even the shopping areas like Bond Street are just a stroll away. The staff are wonderful, the ballroom is GRAND and the food is excellant. I'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea was amazing”
Reviews.Author: mec980
Reviews.Content: I went on my own for afternoon tea. This coswas t Â£33 inclusive of 12.5% discretionery surcharge. There was a pianist playing in the background and the tone was just right and the songs were appropriate to the setting. I pre-ordered my afternoon tea as I was not keen on everything on offer which was no trouble, I was given fruit salad, 10 sandwhiches, 4 scones, 7 cakes and 3 coffees and could have had more but had to take some away in a nicely presented doggy bag. Staff were excellent, the take your luggage to a room, give you a ticket and then bring it back after tea. The window seat was great overlooking Hyde Park. this is an experience of a lifetime and well worth a visit, I am going again at Christmas. Its not posy as you would expect but very relaxed, not rushed, I was there 2 hours and could have stayed for 3 easily but I had a train to catch. I challenge anyone to find any faults with this experience and the price you pay should not put you off, if you want quality you pay for it, if you want a cheap meal and bicker about the price go elsewhere. Overall this was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE RUDE ILL MANNERED ARROGANT STAFF AT FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: mikey1902
Reviews.Content: We went to the grosvenor house for a special break for my wifes birthday, when we arrived at the hotel we checked in being told they had a loverly room for us with large king size bed so that sounded great. we then got to the room to find they had gave us two single beds we were shocked. went down to speak to hotel front desk to get room changed treated us like idiots saying that it was not there problem and we got a good rate for the room i was not happy at all and said i wanted a different room but i was told they were fully booked !!!! but then told that they did have some superior rooms but i would have to pay for an up grade. terrible hotel rude staff go else were and get the five star service you are paying for. this hotel needs to learn some manners !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Top Location”
Reviews.Author: SAAAMumbai
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, great breakfast place, gracious service...all right at Hyde Park, make this a great place to stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “would not allow adult with 2 kids in Deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: originalsix
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before on business...so I knew the size of the rooms. I booked a one night stay in a "deluxe" room for my wife and 2 young kids , ages 5 and 7. We had just landed after a 9 hour flight, and it was about 8:30am London time... we all needed a rest. They said that we had to buy an extra room or get a suite. And only the suite ($$$) is ready now. They were completely unaccommodating. Also, the good steakhouse inside the hotel is not available through room service? The location is ok, but not central to the action, or restaurants. Its across from Hyde Park. A several block walk to either Marble Arch or the park next to Buckingham.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKMaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the Gosvenor for my birthday.It is our second time so we must like it.It's in a great location , opposite Hyde Park. The rooms are lovely , huge beds and the bathrooms great although the hot water needed to be hotter when I used the bath. My biggest bug bear with Hotels of this standard is WHY no tea making facilities?????. I suppose they reckon that if you have enough money to stay there you have enough to order room service but this penny pinching stratergy makes me go the other way and refuse to buy anything from them.First thing in the morn before your even fully awake its nice to make a cuppa , not have to ring for blinking room service , grrrrrr, if guest Houses have to have tea making facilities why not the big boys !!!!! We found all the staff to be really freindly but they do need to brush up on their Veggie options for afternoon tea ,sandwich's in the room.A couple of sclices of thin tomato on a piece of white bread , aint gonna cut it, not when on the phone we were offered much more elaborate things and that was after we sent it back.Couldnt wait any longer after the second time, I was starving and had to eat them. The have got a really nice restuarant in the Hotel now and we were in there on the opening night , although we had to eat early and dash to the theatre , so they may want to think about opening the full menu half an hour earlier for Theatre people as it was too much of a rush to wait for the main menu to start.It was good food when it came though. The biggest let down of the hotel is the breakfasts.The first time we stayed was for Joe Calzagie's ( sp ? ) Help the Hero's charity Ball.The next morning we came for breakfast and the buffet was very poor and for Veggies , almost none existant and for Â£ 25 a head , I felt like I was Robbed.This time we walked out of the back of the hotel ( where taxis drop off ) , walked right down to the end of the road and ate in a great cafe called Richoux. The breakfast was very very good and for half the price of the hotel, so I'd advise everyone to give them a go. All in all a good hotel but I think we'll try somewhere else next time when we are next down in London , but we are 'Northeners ' so what do ya expect!!!Hahaha.

Reviews.Title: “Just came back from two days at this...”
Reviews.Author: lawman85
Reviews.Content: Just came back from two days at this wonderful Hotel . The location is perfect for exploring London and the hotel staff are very accomodating .

Reviews.Title: “Room was great but noisy, Breakfast should be avoided.”
Reviews.Author: Pete_from_Kelsall
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel to stay in London and celebrate my wife's birthday. The room was massive as was the bed and it had the best shower we have ever experienced. We were at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor facing onto Park Lane and the road was busy and noisy throughout the night and early morning. The air conditioning was also noisy! For a 5 star hotel the very expensive breakfast buffet we had was the worst we have ever had at any hotel. The scrambled eggs were watery; the bacon was fatty streaky bacon (I would have expected back bacon!); the pork and beef sausages were tasteless; the beans were cold and the black pudding squashy. Our tea and toast were delivered only after we had reminded staff that we were still waiting for them. It gave the traditional english breakfast a very bad name!!!

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Natali07
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and I wouldn't come back here at all. We had to queue to check in while personnel was available and talking to each other. For breakfast on Sunday we had to queue again, unbelievable the number of people that has to wait. The buffets were empty, the waiters were chaotic, tables were not cleaned up, I have never seen such a mess in a hotel. The hair cap and shampoo was taken away from our bathroom after one use but not replaced. Normally I don't care about these kind of things but in a 5 star hotel this should not happen. Worse of all was the noise we heard from the neighbouring room. We could hear them speak. Unfortunately it seemed to be a family room with a loud family and loud children. When we told the reception about it, they didn't care about it. They didn't even propose ear plugs or to change rooms, I had to insist to get ear plugs. I have never slept this bad in a hotel and I have often stayed in hotels/hostels without stars. What a shame !

Reviews.Title: “Location Is Fab. Rooms Are Lovely. Great Food. Pity about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: NEEDSPEED
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. A really fantastic hotel in terms of location, ambiance, decor, food.....let down badly by bumbling house keeping staff staff and a bit of the nose in the air attitude of the front desk. Remarkable view of Hyde Park when you eat breakfast in their coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cheber
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel a few weeks ago and will definitely stay there again next time we travel to London. Outstanding service; large, well appointed rooms; comfortable bed. Location couldn't have been better. Across the street from Hyde Park; within easy walking distance of St. James' and Green Parks, Buckingham Palace, British Museum, Harrod's, Picacdilly, tons of restaurants. Quick cab ride to West End Theaters and all other attractions. Close to two Underground stations. And located in the wonderful Mayfair neighborhood, perfect for strolling among lots of embassies and parks. Couldn't imagine a better spot.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlepoint
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on points. Great location, my favorite in London. Cafes nearby for breakfast, and Shephard's Market a few blocks away for excellent selection of restaurants & pubs. We had a courtyard room, no view but very quiet. AC is powerful and also very quiet. Rooms are nicely appointed and clean. As I do at all hotels, I asked for and was given a room without a connecting door to neighboring room. Didn't hear a peep entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “JW room below the ground level”
Reviews.Author: leokh
Reviews.Content: I stayed several nights in this hotel duaring the "vulcano" crisis waiting for my flight back home. I've got the room below the ground level and all I could see was some ventilation piping.For laundry pick up I had to call three times and wait two hours. At the end I got it not the same but next day. To reach my romm I had to walk about 15 minutes turning may be 5 times. Can imagine what will be there at emergency. Stuff is polite but not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Only If You Get A Deal”
Reviews.Author: HardyTack
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 day stay at the JW Marriott Grosvenor. The hotel is located in a very nice district. You can read the reviews from other people and get a sense of whether this hotel is good for you. This hotel is not worth Marriott's asking price. However, if you are smart you can go on the well known bidding site and bid on a 5 star hotel in the Mayfair/Soho District. Bid less than $180/night and start bidding as soon as you know you're going to London. Most likely, Marriott will accept your bid, or you may get lucky and get a nicer 5 star hotel. Try starting at $150/night.

Reviews.Title: “High End Hotel, Across from Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: Smartnole
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our volcano induced forced stay. If your interested in high-end shopping and dining, this hotel in the Mayfair District is for you. Approximately 4 blocks to the nearest tube station, but direcly across the street from Hyde Park. My only real complaint was that the bed was extremely hard. Service was top notch with the staff ready to assist with any request/need you might have. Hotel is pricey (as are most in this area) with internet access costing 20 pounds/day.

Reviews.Title: “Needs plenty of work - uninviting”
Reviews.Author: mocha88
Reviews.Content: My partner and i recently stayed at the Grosvenor house for several nights earlier this month and was extremely disappointed with the hotel. Yes the hotel is in a great location, opposite Hyde Park and several minute walking distance to Oxford Street and Metro lines but other than those pro's there is nothing else much more to this hotel. Staff looks uninterested and hospitality is nil. I have stayed in several top notch hotels and this doesn't come close to a 4 star ( as it claims) . Everything cost money at this hotel, even internet at $20 pounds her night. What a joke! Rooms look old and definitely needs a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Another Lovely Weekend With Just A Wee Niggle.”
Reviews.Author: TEEMILL
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Grosvenor House on their three nights for the price of two deal, which averages out at approx Â£130 a night room only, and is excellent value, considering the location. A few days before we arrived we had the usual email from the concierge asking if we had any special requests, which is always a nice touch and more importantly they really do take note. We arrived mid afternoon to check in. Now we really do love this hotel and will have no hesitation in staying there again, but they really do need to get their act together with regard to check in as exactly the same procedure has happened to us now on both occasions. There was a very small queue at reception when we arrived. Reception staff appear to disappear at the drop of a hat and some people were just walking straight up to the desk, ignoring those of us waiting. The splendid and efficient doormen noticed this and were quick to show us to a vacant desk and summon a receptionist from somewhere behind the scenes! Said receptionist was not at all happy, no smile, no welcome, just let's get on with it sort of attitude. The immortal words were then uttered.....your room is not ready at the moment, but if you would care to wait in the lounge area we will ring you when it is....same as last time!
