So we retired to the lounge and ordered a drink....it was 3pm. By 3.30pm still no word from reception and by now the queue for check in was almost out of the doors. I went to the concierge desk and asked if she could assist. Call to reception....yes our room was ready and if we would like to go back to reception they would complete check in. I informed her that l was not prepared to queue again. Concierge asks me to return to the lounge and she will sort it out. 3.50pm and we are still waiting so l again approach the concierge, this time with a serious complaint about the service. This complaint worked and a lovely lady came over to us, took DH orff to complete check in ( to the utter dismay of all still in the queue!) and profusely apologised for the cock up! Anyway, that was my wee niggle and l do hope that management will get this problem sorted out as it really is a pain and not a good start. Our room was just lovely, very spacious and immaculate. We had mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and a bottle of champagne was on ice for us, compliments of the hotel.Thank you. I have noted that some complain about rooms not having a view. This is an old hotel, with a very rich history. We don't expect a 'view' in London, unless of course one pays for a top suite with views of Hyde Park, which for most of us is not important as we only sleep there. Talking of which, the beds here are the most comfortable we have ever slept in and considering the location, we found the room very quiet. There was a star studded function on here in the Great Room on the Sunday night and we didn't hear a thing. In room tea and coffee facilities are useful, but how nice it was to ring room service and have morning tea brought to the room with the option of having it poured for you. Ok it's not cheap, but we didn't consider it expensive either. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel. Just a short walk away there is a lovely little Mayfair cafe that offers great choices for this at half the price. In fact, if you wander around Mayfair you can come across some delightful places to eat. We wandered down to the Shepherds Market area one morning, which is just behind the London Hilton on Park Lane. It's a different world, where you can get pub grub and a great London welcome away from the five star hustle and bustle at reasonable prices, with a cart load of history to boot. As other reviews have mentioned, the Grosvenor is ideally situated for Oxford Street, Knightsbridge and a whole host of major attractions. Just get out there and walk, it's surprising what one can discover. So then, to get back to the Grosvenor. All in all yet another lovely weekend which we really enjoyed. Will we stay there again? Damn right we will.....in conclusion, l have to mention a certain doorman by the name of Carl, who knows his job inside out, just take the time to converse with him, guys like him really do know it all, and are willing to share. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: juanereeno
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before the hotel became a JW hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The room was gorgeous, the bed was extremely comfortable, the location across from Hyde Park was great for a morning walk, and the breakfasts were spectacular. The staff were also very helpful and friendly compared to other 4- and 5-star hotels we stayed in throughout Europe. If it wasn't for the price we would stay here again, but when traveling to London just once in a while for a few days at a time we can stay elsewhere and save a few pennies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: azoutdoorsaug7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just around the corner from another Marriott - so, if you take a taxi to the hotel, be very very specific to the driver of the taxi. Though, it wasn't far - I had to walk to the correct hotel after being informed by the front desk of the "wrong Marriott" that this happens all the time. When I arrived at the Grosvenor, I was so pleased! It is right across the street from Hyde Park and just around the corner from EVERYTHING - truly everything one has ever heard of in London. Walk everywhere - and the entire walk anywhere is beautiful. The Grosvenor Hotel itself is very nice: pretty, clean, tasteful. Because service is "individual", i.e., depending upon the person providing the service, one may receive service anywhere from horribly rude to perfectly perfect - I wouldn't fault the hotel. The other reviews are true - I experienced the full range - but, keep things in perspective. Because I travelled so much and met so many people, I can't remember the names of the staff that were awesome - perfect in service, tasteful in behavior, polished is their own sense of self-respect: A lovely Polish gal who serves in the restaurant in the morning, and a French gal at the front desk...Corrine? Anyway, there were other staff members who were lovely, but these two gals stood out as leaders and should be commended. They were naturally splendid in providing the 5 star service expected in such a hotel. Their service was so superb, it overwhelmed the few folks who shouldn't be employed in the service industry - but could better be served sitting at a computer performing data entry. If I were the manager of this hotel, I'd have a staff meeting pronto and dismiss anyone who appeared slightly disinterested - they will be obvious to you. Otherwise - yes! The hotel is great for business or pleasure - Oh, the piano player in the lovely restaurant was the icing on the cake :)

Reviews.Title: “Felt taken advantage of...”
Reviews.Author: BrettBabs
Reviews.Content: I realize that this hotel is a luxury property, and most of the guests are not worried about costs, but I think this hotel went too far in charging for extras. Extra 20 pounds a night for internet service, that isnt even wireless?? No coffee / tea making facilities in the room? It just seemed that they were trying to squeeze every possible additional penny out of me at every turn. The rooms were actually not bad. Very clean, with high quality linens on the beds. Spacious enough. The green colour palette with the carpet, drapes and walls was not really to my liking but that is more personal preference than anything else. Bathroom was very spacious and clean. Service-wise, the hotel needs help. Service is slow, and no one really seems like they want to be there. I would stay here again if it werent for the fact I felt robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, offensive and patronising service. They communicate by deactivating your room key!!!”
Reviews.Author: BluebellWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in what it was supposed to be a deluxe room, they gave us room 166 overlooking pipes, bricks, and probably the air conditioning system. The good service comes from the cleaners, room service and waiters. The managers especially in reception are pompous, offensive and patronising. The room key was deactivated twice because they wanted me to contact reception to give them our credit card number, which they already had!!. They have the audacity to charge for the use of the internet and we had to ask for coffe/tea facilities. These are basic services nowaday. In any case, they made us feel like criminals and they couldn't care less. We will go back to the Waldorff next time.

Reviews.Title: “tired, not running smoothly, a bit tacky, old tatty decor, milking tourists”
Reviews.Author: hotelavatar
Reviews.Content: Poor service, crappy room, seems to think it is a grand luxurious hotel and it just isn't. if you pay for the top end you will probably get the level of service and accomodation you could get for a third of the price at lots of other more modest london hotels...it's just a two star joint with a five star ego and some five star frills e.g location...but it is history now - for me anyway! "discover Sherlock Holmes in the Grosvenor house hotel" is their web advert- that just about says it all - it isn't a place to stay, its an 'idea' of how to make a location work commercially - very different - can't wait to leave- simply depressing Britain at it's most hypocritical - service poor, reception a massive queue, valet parking ok but no one particularly smiling....like they are all pretending to be in a charles dickens novel selling London to Americans...anyway enough already - out of here - the UK has much much much better to offer than this tatty place....not a Marriott fan either so tough to please!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury ......”
Reviews.Author: Callycam
Reviews.Content: Grosvenor House is a very grand hotel opposite Hyde Park, very close to all the major shopping streets. We were very kindly upgraded to a beautifully luxurious and spacious room with an interesting street view. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable and we heard no noise at all from within the hotel even though we slept in late both mornings. Breakfast in the sunny Park Room was relaxed and varied with the added pleasure of a pianist quietly playing in the corner. Couldn't fault it and will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: pallmalls
Reviews.Content: In October of 2009 my friend and I traveled to london for the NFL's annual footbal game at Wembley. I arrived on Thursday, one day ahead of my friend and found the Grosvenor house a quick tube ride from Heathrow Airport. Since it was early my room was not quite ready, but I was offered a lovely breakfast in the Concierge Suite while I waited. Once my room was ready, I was quickly checked in and found my room to be quite spacious and very comfortable. I had learned that the New England Patriots would be staying in our hotel for the weekend, and assumed that it would be a circus type of atmosphere. I was impressed by how well the staff handled the entire production, and they still made me feel like I was just as improtant as any of the other guests. The hotel is located in the Mayfair district, which is the "high rent" area, but I was always made to feel at home, and found things at the hotel resonably priced considering the location. I took a quick cab ride to the other side of town and visited the Tower of london, and walked the entire way back to the hotel, it was not that far at all. The hotel is located accross from Hyde Park, and within walking distance to Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square, Big ben and the Thames River. I would most certainly stay here again, if I was given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “If i could afford it, i'd stay every weekend.”
Reviews.Author: lpski1 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything i would expect from a 5* hotel, on arriving we were greeted and shown to reception, we waited a couple of minutes in line to be checked in by the very polite concierge. We had room 503, it was very spacious and immaculate, a King size bed that was extremely comfortable and hard to prize ourselves from the following morning. The Grosvenor is opposite Hyde Park and although Park Lane was very close, with the double glazed windows you couldnt hear a thing. We had to walk to Marble Arch traffic lights to cross the road correctly to get into the park. There isnt a pedestrian crossing directly outside the hotel. We were attending a function in the Great Hall for 1200 people, it was very well organised and quite clear where we had to go and where to sit. The food was very good and the wine was not in short supply. Breakfast in the morning was also good, nice private table for 2, full English breakfast plus continental was available and as much as you could eat. Service was very good and quick. Some may say expensive, but nothing i wouldnt expect to pay for a 5* hotel. Im looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel all the way around”
Reviews.Author: You-and-Me759
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff was terrific, great rooms, great location, nice bar/restaurant. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 5* stay”
Reviews.Author: shed_gal
Reviews.Content: I was impressed from the moment we pulled up in our taxi at the level of service in this hotel. From the door staff to check in was very easy and pleasant. Our room on the 4th floor was very spacious and I loved the turn down service everynight. We had a few drinks in the various bars and although quite expensive, it is what it t to be expected in a true 5* hotel. We had a great deal through Yeego which included breakfast and the food was excellent as was the service, we were waited on hand and foot and the staff even went to get our juices etc from the buffet. Everything about this hotel is 5* from the decor, service to the comfortable bedrooms. The only slight grumble I had is when I checked out our bill on the guest service channel on our TV (very useful) they had charged us for 2 breakfasts that had been included in our deal but that was soon rectified at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business but that's it”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip recently and found it to central to my business meeting locations in London. However, that's probably all thats worth it about this hotel. The hotel has just about one restaurant which is expensive to say the least - a breakfast costing you more than GBP35 with a spread that finishes before you take 4 steps. Rooms are so small you can bump into the TV if you stretch your hands while sleeping. On the positive side, you ave decent service, cleanliness and other hygience factors. However, the property clearly is not up to the standards of a Marriott level.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Break”
Reviews.Author: HotelInspectorAssis
Reviews.Content: Grosvenor House is a wonderful hotel, the staff are welcoming, curteous and helpful. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a suite and it was amazing.On arrival we asked for a hospitality tray and a variety of teas, herbal teas and coffee. The only blot on the landscape was the breakfast in the morning, it was late and a little not the best breakfast I have eaten. The location is excellent for shopping and Hyde Park is across the road for some lovely walks. We ate in Corrigans on the Saturday night, the food and service was outstanding. Looking forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Special night.”
Reviews.Author: Mez306 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the reception was polite and very well organised, though it was rather busy. The hotel upgraded our room free of charge to an exclusive king size, which upon entering was an amazing sight. Cannot fault the cleanliness, service and experience of staying in one of london's premier hotels.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel as usual”
Reviews.Author: JimWicklow
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at the Grosvenor House. We stayed for 4 nights and were given an upgrade on arrival. We had booked through 1800hotels and got a brilliant rate. The room was spacious and was what you would expect in a 5* hotel. Could have done with a kettle maybe. We had Breakfast included and the food was excellent especially the omelettes. The Location is ideal being a 5 - 10 minute walk from Marcle Arch / Oxford Street. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: Very drab main reception area which needs to be smarter. Room was nice enough, the king bed was superb, super comtfy and very soft sheets. We could hear every conversation either side of us which was very off putting. You have to ask for Coffee facilities if you wanted in room coffee, Room service breakfast was very poor each morning. The cooked breakfast was very greasy but roon service at night was much better. Would not rush to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware connecting doors”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: The first night of a four night stay was ruined by a fiendish neighbour who took it upon him/herself to smoke in a non-smoking room between 11 pm and midnight. Call down to the desk eventually resulted in a call to the adjoining room, which I could hear through the un-insulated connecting door. When I checked out, the Asst. Mgr. happily told me that the guest had been charged a cleaning fee for this infraction. This is great for the Grosvenor House bottom line, but what about the person who had his sleep ruined by the incident? Is the news that hotel management is making money off the incident supposed to make me feel better? I would not stay on the 6th floor again, as most of the rooms on that floor appear to have connecting doors, which even when locked offer no sound or smoke insulation. You might as well be staying in a hostel dorm room for all the noise and smell that wafts between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “expensive hotel with a great location, stay here if you want to pamper yourself!”
Reviews.Author: kryptful
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights at the grosvenor hotel, it was a luxurious experience, no lesser than what you might expect from a jw marriot hotel. if you're to spend on lodging, this is it! room service was excellent, you cant really find fault with breakfast at bord'eaux (next to lobby), and room/ bathroom was bigger than your average sized hotel room in london. internet does not come free, but at 20 pounds for 24 hours, you can hook up easily with no issues, mini fridge/bar, you name it, they have it. my only gripe is they didnt provide one of those kettles, so should you want tea/ coffee, you probably have to call room service. alternatively, you probably can try calling reception, maybe they have a spare kettle lying around somewhere. hah. the hotel is about a 5-minute walk to the nearest marble arch tube station (walk out from door at the side entrance, then turn right. apparently it's walking distance to hyde park station as well, but i never tried), primark and selfridges is just around the corner, and shopping paradises such as regent and oxford streets is just 2-3 stations away.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful rooms but in danger of being boring?”
Reviews.Author: grinchee
Reviews.Content: The JW brand is almost synonymous with luxury and maximum comfort. Grosvenor House is no exception. My husband and I spent about 20 nights at this hotel last year over a period of a few months. We would usually spend around 250-280gbp per night. On rare occasion there were offers enabling us to stay for about 200 gbp. The hotel is within easy distance of alot of luxury shopping. Selfridges and Bond Strets designer stores (10 min walk) Harrods is 10 minutes taxi ride in the opposite direction. The hotel is also on the same road and within a few minutes walk of some of the big brand hotels: Dorchester, HIlton, Intercontinental and the more lively atmosphere on offer there. The rooms are quite spacious with the best sound proofing (and restful sleep) that I have ever come across in a London hotel. I always rested very well here. Ask for a room overlooking the inner courtyard as its a tranquil view. The climate in the room was perfect without the need in the summer for having the AC on and dry eyes/ throat in the night. The hotel is very well maintained in most areas although the style can appear a little dated in some areas. However I believe it has undergone significant refurbishment since we stayed there. It is nevertheless a very conservative hotel and probably not recommended for under 30s unless your priority is luxury and comfort. The concierge are very helpful and always on standby to help but sometimes the lobby can get very hectic as many black tie pre-events for the Grand Ballroom next door are often held at the Grosvenor. Always a chance to dress up in the evening albeit in very formal dress. There was a brasserie in the hotel when we were there with very atmospheric dark oak decor and beautifully tiled floor but unfortunately the food was not always consistently good. The restaurant has since changed. Now for some less preferred points. The gym is completely lacking in any proper equipment or accessories required for this kind of hotel. We were told the spa was being refurbished and due to open in 2010 but at the time of writing this it is still not complete and the gym is as it was then. The hotel is situated on one of the busiest roads of central london. The good thing of this is its always easy to hail a london taxi. But if you sit on the terrace for a drink in summertime you might find some exhaust fumes mixing with your beverage. All in all I would recommend this for a stay where you are not looking for lots of excitement but perhaps shopping/ business meetings in the day and getting some solid rest/ sleep at night. However I would not go as far as to put it in the category of pampering due to the lack of spa facility..

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious wannabe luxury hotel that lacks concept of Luxury & service”
Reviews.Author: ALR10
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently for 2 nights, although the booking was made for 3 nights but on the first night the staff at the reception could not find my reservation and I had to make alternative arrangements. Mistake on their part which was corrected the following day nevertheless. The Grosvenor House is at a great location along London's prestigious Park Lane and charges accordingly, with eye watering prices on everything. Alas the luxury that it claims to offer is no match for rival hotels along the same stretch of road and the service is indifferent (at best) to poor. The staff appear to be disinterested towards their guests and somehow inconvenienced by their presence. If you opt for the in-room service, don't expect to order anything other than a cold sandwich or overcooked cold pasta after 11:00pm. Even average pubs around the corner can better that, but not their claimed 24h service. On Saturdays the breakfast is served from 07:00am, so if you consult with their breakfast menu about the opening hours (which stated 06:30am) you might be in for an unpleasant surprise unless you have time to spare and wait. Also, do check the bath towels because on the first night there, 2 out of 3 of the towels in the bathroom stunk and had to wash again to rid the unpleasant smell. Would I choose to stay there again? Only if they price match similar 3-star level hotels in the area. For real luxury, I would definitely look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old world Glamour - High / Service - Low”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: This property oozes old world glamour from the well-appointed bars to the stunning lobby. So, I was rather surprised that check-in was as slow as it was. Everyone was perfectly friendly, but we stood for ages and the whole process was like molasses. Our room on the 8th floor was large and beautifully decorated. We were very impressed with the renovations in the bathroom -- it was modern, without losing its charm. The water pressure could have been better and the water was warm at best, but it was very pretty. The king-sized bed was comfortable and warm and we took full advantage of the flat-screen TV in our quiet room. There were two free (small) bottles of water provided in the bathroom, as well as shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, soap and bath salts. The room also contained bathrobes and disposable slippers. An umbrella, iron and ironing board were in the main closet and the safe was in the side closet. The service in the Bordeaux for breakfast was awful. We had a terrible time just getting into the restaurant, as there was confusion on whether breakfast was included in our rate. We were turned away and had to go back to reception, which I thought was poor for a 5-star hotel. We watched another guest encounter a similar problem (when we were finally seated), which again, I did not find appropriate for a 5-star property. We were misinformed by our server about the breakfast choices and it was very, very slow. Food was okay, but poor value for money and the buffet area suffered from over-crowding. It always amazes me that 5-star hotels never have free WIFI or a kettle in the room. Iâ€™m afraid the Grosvenor House canâ€™t rest on its laurels and the management needs to take a serious look at the service at this hotel. However, it is a beautiful property with an amazing history.

Reviews.Title: “Very glamorous but slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mrsjofus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here for New Year recently and the hotel itself is beautiful - very glamorous downstairs in the foyer and bar areas. I had emailed the hotel before our visit, explaining that we were visiting to celebrate my husband's birthday and asked for a good room, away from lifts etc. I only received a cursory reply back saying requests would be taken into consideration. Check in was quick and easy but no mention given about the birthday during any point we were there. We were given a room on the second floor which was ok but a bit pokey which looked out onto a window/flat roof scenario. Slightly grim. I had hoped for better. The room itself though was well appointed with large TV, bathrobes etc. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was great too. This is a very nice hotel but it did leave me feeling a bit jaded with their customer service - after all, staying here isn't cheap and I had hoped for more. The location is quite good, Hyde Park is across the road. It is a 10 minute walk to the nearest tube station though and Oxford Street. Overall, whilst we enjoyed staying here I would not stay here again as it left me disappointed in their service levels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible service. Watch out for hidden charges!”
Reviews.Author: Liberty72
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid for the hotel yet the staff neglected to tell me that they charged me $150.00 per day for "incidentals," even though I had no other charges. Front desk staff could not care less including the manager. Coffee bar staff was never present and was rude and slow. Room was rather small but clean. House-keeping entered the room without knocking every day we were there. They rarely replenished the towels, toiletries or loo paper without us having to request this service several times. They also threw away a bag of gifts. They later found the gifts which were damaged. Management refused to replace gifts. Hotel was quiet and location was good - close to Oxford Street.; though not very close to a tube station. Concierge was friendly and always helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: grichardson_10
Reviews.Content: This is a truly lovely hotel. The lobby area is very stylish. The rooms are beautiful and the restaurants were not silly prices. I am a frequent traveller at Marriott hotels and am a big fan, but other JW's that I have stayed at have really missed that feeling of a special high end hotel. This does not. It does not feel like a large chain hotel and is most definitely a 5 star hotel. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tikaye406
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights while in London for business. I really enjoyed my stay here and loved this hotel. It was the perfect combination of old, classic charm with modern upgrades. The rooms were well decorated with modern features such as a flat screen tv. Above the desk was a power strip with various electrical outlets (i.e. no adapter needed) -- another modern and convenient feature. The bathroom was my favorite part of the room. It was covered in marble with old fashioned fixtures...but also had a wonderful rain showerhead that was a treat at the end of a long day. Service was great throughout the entire hotel and restaurants. We ate several meals at Bord'eaux. The food and wine was delicious. A few of the servers were French (which added to the experience of this French restaurant). Location was fantastic. We couldn't ask for a better neighborhood than Mayfair. Shopping was great. Many stores to choose from... and we couldn't resist but follow all the Primark shopping bags we saw on the street. The hotel was within walking distance to the Tube. This was a great home base. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Ten Night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AVIATRIXXX
Reviews.Content: The check in desk staff was very pleasant as was the concierge staff. They gave very helpful suggestions for our ten day stay in London. The hotel is located in central London several blocks (about a 10 minute walk) to the Marble Arch underground tube station. We purchased a one week pass which was about 25 GBP per person Oyster Pass for Zones 1 and 2 which you can ride on the buses and subways unlimited. We used Prime Car, which is a private car service from Heathrow Airport to the hotel, which was about a 25 minute ride to the JW Marriott Grosvenor House Hotel at a rate of 35 GPB, much cheaper than using the regular cabs upon recommendation from a relative who lives here. I went on Priceline.com to book this hotel and stayed from December 24th through January 3rd, a period of ten nights and had an excellent rate of $170 US Dollars per night plus taxes on Priceline, which was less than half of what rooms were going for on Marriottâ€™s website at the time I had booked it. This is considered to be a five star hotel. We were given a nonsmoking king room on the eighth floor, which had a partial view of the park across the street. The bathrooms were adorned in gorgeous black and white marble. There was a bathtub which included bath salts. There were two shower heads, which included an optional mounted handheld and another one which had a rainshower type effect. Water pressure was great, very plentiful. The sink had great hot and cold water with good water pressure. Amenitites included daily shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, vanity kit and shower cap. There were also two bottles per day of free bottled water provided in the bathroom. There was a toilet as well as a bidet. Comfy soft white robes were provided along with white slippers. There was a separate heater in the bathroom which could be turned up or down for optimal comfort. There was a rack with towel warmers. We were disappointed that our towel warmer did not work. There was a scale in the bathroom as well. Overall we were very pleased with the bathroom and the cleanliness. The only thing was that five days out of ten the maid failed to provide washcloths and we had to keep calling down for them. Aside from that, housekeeping did an outstanding job. Our room had a comfortable king bed. Feather or foam pillows are available upon request. The sheets and comforter were very comfortable. There was turndown service each evening but no chocolates provided on the bed. Closet space could have been a little more plentiful, but we managed just fine. Laundry/dry cleaning service was available for extra charges. We were very upset that internet service was not included and cost 20GBP extra per day which was outrageously expensive. There was no free internet in the lobby area either. There was a coffee shop where you could get coffee, tea, juice, crossiants, muffins, etc. There was a full service restaurant Bordeaux which was very expensive. A cheeseburger cost $16.50GPB which could be had elsewhere for less than half that price. There was another restaurant/lounge area called Park Room, which also served afternoon tea. We didnâ€™t eat at all in the hotel restaurants because they were outrageously expensive. Room service and the mini bar were also very high priced and we didnâ€™t use those services either. There is a front and back entrance to the hotel. We came and went several times per day. 75% of the time the door men didnâ€™t say hello to us or greet us but just stood at the door staring off into space and didnâ€™t open the doors for us even when they saw us approaching. For a five star hotel, I thought this was very rude as I am used to door men being courteous and friendly by greeting the hotel patrons and also opening the doors for them. We experienced this from several different door men, not just one so this was representative behavior over ten days. Also, the first two days we had a smell of smoke in our room because the people next door to us were smoking in a nonsmoking room. We reported this to security who took care of the situation. After that, we did not smell any further smoke. Rooms were very quiet. We had a nice flat screen TV in the room. The closet had an umbrella, just in case you forgot to bring one. There was also a shoe care kit available in the closet as well as a mini sewing kit which came in handy when a button from my jacket came off and I had to sew it back on. There was climate control on the wall so you can select optimal temperature for your room. We had a nice quiet pleasant stay and slept very well each evening. There is also a theater desk downstairs where you can book shows. My husband and I saw several shows in London but I had booked them well in advance myself on the internet. There was free coffee and tea downstairs in the lobby each morning with mugs and takeaway cups. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: itsies
Reviews.Content: This luxury hotel is perfectly located, close to beautiful Hyde Park, excellent shopping, tube, and bus stops. We stayed in the Executive Room Category which gave us access to the Executive Lounge; although the breakfast was good, we were very disappointed with the quality, quantity and variety of the food they offered throughout the rest of the day. We specifically requested the Executive Room having had very pleasant experiences at other JW Marriott Executive Clubs, like the one in Lima, Peru, but we were disappointed with the food and service level they offered at this hotel. Some of the staff at the lounge seemed a bit overwhelmed during peak hours and really did not go out of their way as you would expect from staff at a five star hotel. Overall, we had a very nice stay and the rest of the hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful at all times. However, I would not recommend paying extra just to get access to the executive lounge. It is definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Need better service”
Reviews.Author: steve2sg
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the middle of Mayfair. Too bad about the mixed service. Some of the rooms on the 1st floor feel like you are in a cave. Make sure to ask for 2nd floor and higher. Like rest of London, outrageous internet fees. But cannot beat the location as everything within Mayfair is a 10 minute walk. Spacious rooms make up for lack of service..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Peregrine30
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights in two adjoining rooms on the 5th floor at this hotel last week and we all couldn't have been happier. Spacious and well appointed rooms with typically beyond comfortable Marriott beds and bedding and large, though a bit retro, bathrooms. My only complaint, which we knew prior to arriving, was that there would be no wi-fi in the rooms (although breakfast and pre-dinner drinks in the executive lounge gave us all enough time with our laptops). Staff was very helpful and friendly (and the lovely lady at the front desk went out of her way to accomodate our requested early check-in). Being within walking distance of Shepard's Market, Buckingham Palace, Oxford/Bond Street shopping was so convenient. Would love the chance to go back and stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “The old grande dame got a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: MsEllen88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grosvenor for several nights during a conference in November 2009 and was pleasantly surprised how much it had improved from my previous stay in 2002. Back then, I was given the tiniest broom closet of a room with a bed that was so old and lumpy that I am certain it was used by Queen Victoria. This hotel used to have the look and smell of an old lady who had seen better days decades ago. The Grosvenor has apparently undergone a major rehab and is now glowing and polished. Everything about this hotel is nice, from the all-marble baths to the deluxe bed and bath linens. The room this time was huge and had a super comfy King bed. Despite it being in a large hotel, my room was extremely quiet. I've been to London a dozen times and stayed at different hotels and the new, improved Grosvenor is now a hotel that I will return to. The hotel bar was really warm and inviting. The location is a short walk to Oxford Street shopping. One tip: the hotel has its own Theatre Ticket service just off the main lobby so you can purchase theatre tickets immediately upon arrival. The gentleman at this desk is very nice and has good recommendations. You can also get half-priced, same day theatre tickets at Leicester Square, but it is a long walk from the hotel and you take your chances on what tickets are available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: WellWornPassport
Reviews.Content: The Grosvenor House, not to be confused with the other Marriott hotel also on Park Lane, is well situated across from Hyde Park. This historic hotel didn't offer many amenities (I think the gym was under renovation), but the staff was gracious and helpful. I arrived after a red-eye flight, well before my check-in time, and was promptly given a room. For its excellent location in a major metropolitan city, I was surprised at how spacious my room (820) was. The breakfast buffet was grossly overpriced (30 pounds). The Red Bar is a bit of a scene with the beautiful people in London, complete with a Kevin Spacey sighting.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service. Fabulous Vibe.”
Reviews.Author: MisterKeithATL
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel on business during a few glorious days this September. The young asian woman at the front desk was exceedingly professional, and the check-in experience was flawless. Additionally, food and beverage, particularly in the lounge, was exceptional -- Great Cocktail List! What a fabulous experience your team provided. Thank you for a little bit of leisure during a grueling business jaunt. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 125”
Reviews.Author: aslanfamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel a few days ago as we were going to the xmas grotto at Harrods and ive stayed at this hotel when i worked for the marriott group 2years ago. The hotel is still amazing and the doormen are very friendly. Rooms are nice but i didnt know they have single beds and although comfy i prefer the queen size. View isnt great but ur not in the room long enough to worry about things like that. one thing i did find disappointing is that since changing to a JW marriott, they no longer have a kettle and tea/coffee making facilites free of charge. If anyone knows london u no the location of the hotel is amazing, lots of walking u just dont want to stop. The only downside to this hotel during my stay was the "stand off-ish" receptionist who would not let me have a late check out to enable me to feed my 9 month old daughter before our journey back and the worst thing of my stay EVER was from 8.30am-11.30am was having housekeeping knock and open my door 10 times, yes people TEN TIMES!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Du13
Reviews.Content: i only planned to stay there for 4night & had to change rooms 3times due to a/c problems. but i did get a free upgrade. nice staff, don't plan to eat at the hotel as there is only 1 choice of restaurant and a small cafe both of which are very expensive! also not too close to commercial are lick oxford street (15-20min walk), other locations must use transportation. Hallways are like a maze, good luck finding your room. Room service was surprisingly fast! Nonetheless, i would stay here again if i had to.

Reviews.Title: “There are better Marriotts in the area.”
Reviews.Author: mpiedlourde
Reviews.Content: i had one of the worst experiences in this hotel. it's not that the rooms are poor (they're fantastic - beautiful and impeccably well-kept). it's not that it's in a poor neighborhood (it's right off the marble arch stop on the central line, literally a stone's throw from bond street). it's just that both my travelmate and i constantly felt like riffraff in the very hotel we paid good money for. while entering and leaving our hotel, we were constantly stared at by both employees in the lobby and the doormen. we weren't greeted even once, and our hotel stay was about five days. while trying to fix a mess up on our bill, the hotel manager both argued with us and accused us of trying to get out of paying for what we were wrongly billed for. what kind of customer service is that? we were pretty much given that kind of similar attitude our whole stay there. could it have been that we were in our early 20s? could it have been that we were the only (ahem) ... foreigners in the hotel? maybe i'm being silly. but all i know is that i would never stay in such an unwelcoming place ever again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and excellent room”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyCodger
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Very quiet and elegant hotel. Bed was so big and comfy. Plasma tv and quiet night sleep even though you are right across the street from Hyde Park (which is gorgeous) and in the middle of the city. Very convenient walk to Marble Arch tube even with rolling luggage (about 10 minute walk). Highly recommend and staff was very helpful with maps, tourist info, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: yanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now, our favorite hotel in London. Rooms are very comfortable and spotless. Staff are always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: voronUk
Reviews.Content: The positives are pretty clear-cut. Marriott's renovation was superb, the hotel is clean, feels warm and relaxing and is superbly positioned in central London, squarely between the placid, clean, village-like atmosphere of the expensive streets east of Park Lane and the massive green spaces of Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. The basic rooms are beautifully laid out, spacious enough - this is London, not Vegas, and a hotel should be a refuge, not a bunker - and well equipped with Marriott's standard kit : in-room safes, big televisions, cupboard space, marble bathrooms, irons and so on. The public areas are also welcoming, particularly the 'library' and the Red Bar, and the staff are thoroughly professional. Better to arrive in the courtyard on Park Street, rather than at the back door on Park Lane, which would force you to traipse the length of the ground floor to check in; not all taxi drivers are aware of the distinction, and probably very few care. The downsides are relatively trivial and not all of the chain's making; given the limitations of such an old building and the need to secure its prime position on Park Lane, they've done a superb job. However, the building is as maze-like as previous reviewers have alluded to; I had room 250, which was two dog-legs from an elevator, and because of its position quite dark - it overlooks the flat roof between the towers, and a sliver of Park Lane, as must several dozen others, so if a view is essential to you, ask for one. The bigger issue is the cost of the ancillaries, which matters more now than it ever did, whether you're a business traveller or a tourist. Still no free wifi; in-room connection, or surf and print in the business centre at Â£3 per 15 minutes (behind reception; good luck getting there without swapping maps with Indiana Jones). Lovely as the place is, this is prime London real estate and a luxury business hotel, so a full English breakfast will set you back Â£27.50 a head, a bowl of soup at least Â£7.50 - somehow I managed to avoid the Â£10 bowl - and an alcohol-free two course dinner for two in Bord'Eaux, the attached restaurant, never ducked under Â£60. And as for the in-room minibar....take a five minute trip up Park Lane, cross Oxford Street, turn left a few paces, stock up at the supermarket over from Marble Arch, retrace your steps, repeat as necessary. Especially if you're from my company, or are employed by my government.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, I wasn't blown away -but I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Windsor999
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at this property for a week in October. I loved the location -being blocks from Grosvenor Park it was close to Oxford Rd and I used the Bond Street Tube stop a lot! I got the 7 day all you can ride pass and that really worked for me. The property itself was nice, the rooms small by American Standards. The bathroom was luxuriously appointed, the room decor was a bit weird -green and fuscia? I loved my big flat panel TV, plenty of closet space, and a small foyer space for suitcases and shopping stuff. The desk was not super comfortable for my 6 foot frame -but fine. The A/C worked consistently -which I'm finding is more of a surprise than you might expect from Marriott. The bed was very comfortable -which I've also come to expect from Marriott. The location was and the hotel were quiet and comfortable. Problems I had with the hotel were. There was no iron in the room, when I requested it -it took 3 additional calls and after waiting over 2 hours. Only after threatening to come down to the Lobby to demand an iron so I could iron my suit for the business meeting I flew to Europe for did I get the iron in about 30 seconds time. Other things that were sub-par were mold in my shower on the ceiling. The light fixtures in the bathroom were filthy. The key failed for access to the lounge and were finicky when they were used to open the room. The Fire Alarm went off in the middle of the night -one night -for no reason? (it turned off after 3 minutes.) They say they have a gym.... Technically they do, it is probably one of the WORST gyms I have ever seen -it literally consists of 5 cardio machines -no crosstrainers, and some weights. Overall for a JW (supposed to be the top of the Marriott Line) -I found the stay just satisfactory. Little things that I would expect to be effortless for this property -it struggled with. The Lounge never changed its offerings for meals, the turn down service was offered but didn't provide a chocolate. The bathroom had mold and the light fixtures were very dirty. The internet in the room was 20 pounds for 24 hours. The iron incident was really annoying as was the gym experience. But the Hotel has a great location, and was quiet and comfortable. The staff only seemed to be happy to see me -when I was checking out.....? The Hotel did handle the pride of Britain while I was there and seemed to be overwhelmed with the demand -so much that I felt more like a nusaince than a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 4andunder
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, extremely helpful staff and conveniently located to many great tourist sights! Walking distance to the Hard Rock and many beautiful parks. Concierge was very helpful and had many suggestions for sightseeing. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but not many food options”
Reviews.Author: jenaggie09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009 and enjoyed our stay. Everyone was very friendly but late night food options are minimal. The restaurants are very expensive ($25 for a club sandwich). Other than that, the hotel was great! Rooms were beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Grosvenor Perfect”
Reviews.Author: klima58
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! We used Marriott points as well for part of the trip. Terrific location, the most comfortable bed with true white sheets and pillows all over. What a treat! The whole place is in such a good taste.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: JGMAUGIE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this use or Marriott points, and they still upgraded us to a superior room. Great room big decent tv, big bathroom, super comfy bed, air worked fine.. we were on the 6th floor off a quite street so we were able to open our window at night. It cost 35 us for wi-fi access per day... that is the only bummer thing, The location is OK, you need to walk to the tube, but it is only about 5 -10 minutes. The staff is great, and very freindly.. The conserigie recommend the seafresh resteraunt for fish and chips, go there for the best fried seafood I have had.. Itis cool when a conserigie actually reccomends a place that is not on the "list".. We did the london walks ww.londonwalks.com, check them they are well worth your time, and money,

Reviews.Title: “The age of elegance is still with us”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraHampshire
Reviews.Content: There is something about this classic 1920,s hotel that gives me a buzz. It,s stylish, a little old fashionedn and a great place to stay. I booked an executive room which includes drinks, soft and alcoholic, breakfast, afternoon tea, so well worth the extra. I asked to stay in one of thier classic rooms, none were available so was immediatley upgraded to a suite. This was fantastic. (some recently redecorated rooms very modern) The beds are very comfortable. Breakfast was good but not outstanding. The location is great, within walkin distance to Hyde Park, Oxford Street, Bond street, Harrods and much more. Service throughout the hotel was excellent. A great stay

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and upscale in a ritzy location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddictSD
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to London and I was impressed when our taxi dropped us off to the front of the hotel. Parked out front were Bentleys, Aston Martins, S Class Mercedes, and Land Rovers. The hotel is off of Park Lane, one of the upscale streets in London. The reception area was immaculate. There lobby had beautiful chandeliers and floral displays with a classy appeal to it. After we received our room keys we went to our room. However we were not offer luggage assistance. I was a bit surprised not see any bell hops in sight considering the class of this hotel. We found the room impressive based on the size, dÃ©cor, and cleanliness. I felt like I was back home. The beds were plush and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean. Down the hall from us was the fitness center on the 1st floor. It had a yoga room, cardio equipment and multiple weights. I was satisfied by the fitness center. The concierge was great. She put us on the list to some of the top lounges in London. Be sure to advantage of this service. The hotel is near Marble Arch and Hyde Park. You will find many shops and Lebanese restaurants. Hyde Park is just a few minutes walk and a great place to relax and get away from the busy city. However, most of the pubs and clubs are not within walking distance and you need to take a taxi to them. The hotel is nice and tucked away in a nice location. If you want to be where all the happenings are at, try to stay in the Soho or Mayfair area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Average Cleaning Standards, Terrible Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: SwissLe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grosvenor House Hotel before it became a J. W. Marriott and had mixed expectations. My last visit was pre- refirbishment and the rooms were looking tired and dated but it still offered excellent service standards and a fanstastic central location. I booked a one night stay via priceline.co.uk, and paid Â£116inc taxes/charges but excluding breakfast. I emailed the hotel to request a non smoking room and upon arrival we were allocated one without question. Our taxi dropped us on Park Lane, the front of the hotel, whereas the reception is at the rear with the courtyard style drop off zone. There wasn't any assistance at this door, nor very clear directions to the main reception. The reception area is beautiful. Large floral displays and candles in storm lanterns with crystals are scattered around the area and a series of rich, gold and red colours complete the very Northern American with a touch of parisian feel of the lobby. The large wooden reception desk was manned by one lady who was busy number crunching when we arrived in front of her. After a few minutes of keyboard bashing, she looked up with a 'Yes?'. I started to state we had a reservation, interrupted by her request for 'sirname?'. After spelling my sirname she continued to type a huge amount of information and then added 'Credit Card'. It appears that sentences are not required when dealing with clients at this establisment. Once the card had been swiped, she pushed a card with two keys towards me and then finalised the transaction with 'lift behind you, floor 5 button'. I then added to her workload by confirming if the room was non-smoking - 'of course', with a waving hand guesture as my punishment. Again no assistance with baggage was offered, and there were no bell boys in sight. We made our way to the room. The Grosvenor is rather hard to navigate due to it's odd design, this isn't uncommon in London due to the age of buildings. It would all be simpler if you were escorted to the room, like most other hotels in this class. The public areas are again beautiful and very clean. The colours may look rather garish in photographs but do add a feeling of luxury and warmth to the hotel, something missing in many of the modern interiors hotels are opting for these days. All the corridors have new carpet and wall coverings. The signs in the public areas are false, they are laminated plastic rather than the brass they are designed to look like. When we found the room I was impressed with the size, smell and quality of fixtures. On first inspection the room looked clean. The bedding is of high quality, and very clean. A good selection of pillows are provided - including one GHH branded. At the end of the bed sits a large LCD screen with on-demand, local and internation stations and of course a clunky TV internet service. There is a special offer of Â£20 for unlimited movies, music and TV internet at the current time. This does not include the wired internet port. There wasn't a wireless signal in the room, but 3G works well on the 02 network. Within the TV cabinet is the mini bar and other honesty items, compelete with corkscrew and glasses. There isn't tea/coffee making facilities in the room, although these can be delivered to the room along with ice. A lamped desk area with leather chair is home to the hotel information, writing paper and local information. You will also find a comprehensive room service menu in this folder. The prices are in line with other 5* hotel in London and this is also true for the well stocked mini bar. All room service pricing excludes a Â£3.50 tray charge and 12.5% option service charge, again pretty normal for London. Two ornate chairs and a table with magazines create a nice feature between two large windows. Our room overlooked a side street but due to the secondary glazing noise wasn't an issue. Large wardobes with ample storage and full length mirrors create a feeling of space in the room. The bathroom was a good size, with large sink with mixer tap. There was a good selection, if not premium brand, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Two soaps were also provided, good quality and nice scent. The sink area appeared to be clean and well presented. The toilet, bidet and bath were divided from the sink area. The toilet was dirty, and the seat rather loose. The marble grouting in the bath/shower area was beginning to mould and covered in limescale. This was the first indication of cutting corners with housekeeping. The shower mat was also dirty and starting to mould. These are all due to lack of proper cleaning, it seems ashame as the refirbishment is a very high standard but keeping these standards is also important. When using the desk area I found a pack of open crackers and sweet packets under the chair. The room was clearly not hoovered in a statisfactory manner. It makes you wonder if the housekeeping team are required to clean rooms in a certain time, just doing the very minimum. After horror stories of cleaning glasses with dirty towels and sinks with toilet brushes in the media about London hotels, it does make you wonder what your eyes can't see that has been skipped during cleaning. The airconditioning was easy to use, and was quiet in operation during the night. There wasn't any noise from the corridor or adjoining rooms. We opted for in room breakfast and chose the continental option which was Â£21 per person. The full english was Â£27 and a healthy menu offered for Â£25.50. You have to add service and tray charges to this and you won't see much change from Â£50 for a breakfast for two. It was delivered on time, all items were fresh and all drinks were the correct temperature. The staff were excellent and even moved furniture around in the room so we could eat at the window. The member of the reception staff on check out was much more friendly and even helped us take our bags over to the concierge for storage during the day. He couldn't provide me with an email contact for the manager of the hotel but still an improvement over check in. After exploring London for the day using the nearby Marble Arch Underground Station (turn right out of the front of the hotel and head to the end of the road, just past the other Marriott). We returned back to the hotel and had drinks in Bord'eaux. The restaurant is beautiful and has a nice terrace looking over Park Lane to Hyde Park. We had two coffees and two cokes and the bill came to around Â£15. The location is lovely, and as it got cooler they put on large patio heaters and offered blankets for your shoulders. We were sat opposite Gary Rhodes who spoke very highly of the food. A very beautiful hotel, now restored to it's former glory. I think under it's current management they will be unable to continue to keep the standards in the accommodation and the very impersonal approach of the reception staff needs to be addressed in order for them to achieve the 'upper level' that is a J. W. Marriott. An excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for our 10 year wedding anniversary, returning to London where we visited on our honeymoon. We have stayed at Marriotts all over the world and this is among the nicest. Beautiful location in prestigous Mayfair area.. Nearest Tube station is Marble Arch (a fair walk, but not too bad). Room was beautiful and swanky -- very traditional furnishings, well appointed. Helpful concierge staff; coordinated a very nice guided tour for us; assisted with taxi and advice regarding catching Eurostar train to Paris. There was a mixup with our room upon checkin, but staff handled the situation very professionally, to our approval. Across from Hyde Park. Internet charge is ridiculously high (no surprise -- come on Marriott, charging for Internet is so out of style), so we passed (used free Internet at the nearby McDonalds at Marble Arch). Only real glitch was a false fire alarm in the middle of the night. Very classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great value (if you're using Marriott points!)”
Reviews.Author: GaddisGadabout
Reviews.Content: We really liked this place. The room was spacious with a very nice and large bathroom. The bed was super comfortable with excellent linens. We used points so we didn't get a park view but the hotel is very quiet. The tube is a bit of a walk to either Marble Arch or Hyde Park Corner. As with all "upscale" hotels - the charges for mini-bar or drinks in the hotel lounges are sick. Do they not want any business?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay in London”
Reviews.Author: kysupt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grosvenor House for 2 nights in early September. It was a truly enjoyable experience in every way. Internet service is over priced but that is the only exception to an experience that offers outstanding value. This is a beautiful property with helpful and courteous staff in a prime location. I recommend this grand hotel and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: solarkk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Mayfair, one of the best area in London. Located right across from High Park, it is convenient by tube (closest station Marble Arch) and you can basically access all the hot spots by walking (if you don't mind walking 20 to 30 mins). The shower is the highlight of our room for us - an incredible rain shower with tons of pressure. Size of the room is enormous by UK standard. It is a true 5 star with true north american king sized beds. Through priceline.com - name your price, you will not get a better deal anywhere else, just make sure you book it as soon as it is available. We paid only $140 USD per nite, friends of ours try to book 2 weeks later and their price was $375 USD per nite -so grab it while you can. The only negative is internet access was extremely expensive 50 pounds per day so if you need it for personal use, you may want to take your laptop to the Starbucks on Oxford St. Our last nite ended perfectly with fireworks in High Park which we saw from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Reyray
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grosvenor House for 7 nights, Aug. 30. The hotel was lovely. Fresh cut flowers were placed throught-out the hotel leaving a very warm pleasant aroma. Everyone, from the reception desk to the doorman, was exceptionally warm and pleaseant. Breakfast was included in our stay which made it even nicer. The room was very well appointed and large enough for two. We had turn-down service every night. The location was prefect across from hyde park (central london). We were within walking distances to the major shopping department stores (Harrod, etc.), shops, outside vendors and restaurants. For transportation we also used the tube and the Big Bus Company. Over all, we had a wonderful time in London

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find in a top-notch location”
Reviews.Author: LoveGrandHotels
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about this property - but I can tell you that my standard room was adequate in size, the bed divine, housekeeping prompt and excellent, very powerful shower, better-than-expected restaurant - and what I liked most - excellent HVAC/air conditioning in the bedroom. I have stayed in other top-end hotels in London, and ended up being warm in the room even though the rooms were supposedly "air conditioned." On the downside, the bill was messed up at checkout (internet charges that I never used for example!), no swimming pool or nice heatlh club factilities (although supposedly building them for opening in 2010) and the toiletries in the room were plain old standard - i.e., what I'd find in a Marriott hotel in a downtown USA property. In general, though - a solid property, beautiful environs, quiet, and excellent location. Walked everywhere right from the hotel. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toria28
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, absolutley stunning in all ways. The smell from the flowers in the lobby was gorgeous. We stayed in a corner suite which was one of the nicest rooms I'd ever stayed in and I have done an awful lot of travelling. The only downside was I found the price of the restaurant and bars to be extremely over priced (Â£6 for some toast) other than that I would definatley stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AirplanedriverNorway
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the JW marriott Grosvenor House in London. The hotel has a great location in Mayfair with reasonable walking distance to most attractions. The hotel is really nice in every way, Everywhere was clean and well maintained. The service was excellent. We arrived early on friday around noon. we had booked a nonsmoking superior room, non of theese rooms were available yet so the receptionist offered us the option of an upgrade to a large suite that was on the smoking floor or we could wait for a non smoking room or even change later if we thought the room was too smokey. We opted for the suite that didnt smell much of smoke at all since the suite was recently refurbished and had all new carpets and furnishings. The suite was massive and beautiful with a large sitting room with 42 inch flat screen and really nice plush furniture. the bedroom and bathroom were also large and really nice. Our rate included breakfast which was of above average hotel standard, we had breakfast delivered to our room on our last day which I highly recommend. We also had a 3 course meal included at the restaurant that was really nice. Will stay there again on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: mrstepheno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights here and we were very pleased. As soon as we entered the atrtractive lobby we felt this would be a pleasant stay, there were fresh flowers on the table giving the feeling of welcomeness. The staff was warm and friendly from the moment we arrived. When we entered our room we were pleased with the decor and the spaciousness. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. During our stay the room was immacculately clean and orderly whenever we returned to it. The concierge helped us plan our daily activities touring London and provided valuable information on using the underground to easily get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but may not be a five star property”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler40
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, although I don't see it as a five star hotel. The caring service just wasn't there in the hotel lobby. The positives: My room was lovely, with an extremely comfortable king size bed. We received turndown service each night. Any request, for extra towels or toiletries, was filled by the housekeeping staff. I never heard another guest, although the hotel was busy. Any street noise can be drowned out by use of the air conditioner/fan Breakfast each morning at the Bour'deaux restauant was one of the best parts of our stay. The restaurant staff were always pleasant and caring, and the food was delicious. The list price is extremely expensive, but it is a pleasure if it is included in the rate. Location is good. We walked ten minutes to Marble Arch tube. The negatives: The concierge desk misdirected us on several occassions. Some front desk staff were not helpful. (Lobby staff could learn much from those working in the Bour'deaux restaurant.) Television station selection is very limited. (But I didn't visit London to watch television. ) Pool was being renovated, and was not open during our stay. Fitness center was poor and appeared makeshift; perhaps the permanent fitness center was being renovated as well. Cost to use business center was ridiculous. Plan to go elsewhere to check e-mail. We saw many Internet cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: biniland
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Marriott. We were upgraded to a corner room which is quite spacious and quiet. The bed was very big and comfortable. It's certainly much better than another Marriott in London (Marriott Marble Arch) that we had stayed during this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: whiskey9
Reviews.Content: AWESOME Hotel!! Staff was outstanding food awesome!! Close to the Hard rock and lots of other things!!! Would go there again if I ever go back to London!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL STAY, SMOKE FILLED NOISY ROOM MATCHED BY TERRIBLE SERVICE - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: Vivvyp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grosvenor House Hotel on 1st August for 1 night to celebrate a special occasion. We booked this back in May and chose this hotel for it's reputation and because he is a Marriott Gold Elite Rewards member . At the time of reservation, we were not asked whether we wanted a smoking room or not but the miserable lookings receptionist at check in advised us that they only had smoking rooms left. As non-smokers we were both unhappy at this point but were actually pleasantly surprised that when we got into the room, it didnt smell of smoke and we decided to keep the room - our biggest mistake (apart from choosing this hotel!). The guests staying in the room adjacent to ours arrived back at around 11.30pm. Shortly after this, our room started filling with smoke and we realised that it was coming through the interconnecting door, which although shut, obviously didnt fit properly. We had to roll up blankets and towels to wedge into the gaps round the door frame, open the windows and have the air conditioning on full but still our room smelt absolutely disgusting. They started popping champagne and making a lot of noise and by 12pm, it was obvious that there were at least 4 and probably more like 6 of them in there. The noise got worse and worse and so we called down to reception to ask security to ask them to quieten down. Unfortunately, over an hour and a half and five phone calls later security had not checked on their room yet we got a knock on our door to ask us which room was making the noise - even though even at this moment they were having a full blown party and could be heard from the corridor! They did quieten down after security bothered to ask them to but were still going strong at 2.30am. With a room filled with smoke and very noisy neighbours, we did not sleep well and asked for a complaints form from another equally unfriendly receptionist on check out the next morning. Apparently Marriott do not have customer comment forms and since returning home, they also dont have any customer service contacts either as it took two days just to be given a phone number in Ireland that didnt exist. I called three times and waited over five hours for anyone at the hotel to call me back who then promised to investigate and call me within 2 days, which they didnt. This hotel could be lovely but it is relying on a reputation from yesteryear, which is does not deserve now. The location is great but our room was very small and very ordinary and for a rack rate of Â£260 per night, did not even include any shower gel or tea/coffee making facilities. No-one opened doors, explained the hotels facilities, carried our bags, showed us to our room - we were not welcomed in any shape or form and not one member of staff smiled the entire time we were there. The service from reception and concierge was terrible - inexcusable for any hotel - and the lack of any customer service at the time of our stay or indeed since is quite shocking. If , like us, you thought Britain had gone smoke free - beware - the laws for hotels are quite different to pubs and restaurants. There is nothing anywhere on the Grosvenor House website thats indicates that there is the choice of smoking or non-smoking and we would have chosen another hotel if there had even been the slightest of hints that we may end up with a smoking room. If you are looking for a luxury stay, a hotel where they look after or care about their guests or are trying to celebrate a special occasion (and ours was completely ruined), there are so many other hotels close to this one, you would be far better choosing somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and concierge and bellman service was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: kimber0668
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in they tried to put us in a smoking room even though we had specifically requested non-smoking. We obliged by checking it out before refusing, but the whole floor and room reeked of smoke. Went back to reception and after much discussion, a non-smoking room was suddenly available. The concierge desk and everyone servicing it was extremely helpful throughout our stay. Location is near Marble Arch so we were close to bus routes and the Tube, and taxis were plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Usual excellent Marriott standard”
Reviews.Author: KiwiPaula
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we had used the Marriott in the UK and this 3-day trip was courtesy of Marriott Rewards. We were treated very well and received best wishes from staff for celebrating our anniversary. We even managed to move to a bigger, better room after the first night. We enjoyed the proximity to Hyde Park and enjoyed a couple of early morning runs there. The buffet breakfast at Bord'eaux was yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like the beautiful girl in school with the nasty personality. The rooms and public ares are beautiful, and it is across the street from Hyde Park. The service, however, is not good and often condecending. If you decide to stay there dispite this, also be aware that they nickel and dime you for everything. Local calls are 1.25 lbs per minute, there is no free Wi Fi, and a light breakfast will run you about 20 pound (thats about 40 dollars0 per person. If you decide that this is acceptible try to get a rate on priceline for @ 200 per night. and don't be afraid to ask for a different room if you find that they put you in a tiny one.

Reviews.Title: “missing money met with unprofessionalism - dont expect 5-star service”
Reviews.Author: canada123419
Reviews.Content: for all intents and purposes the grosvenor house is a beautiful hotel. unfortunately the service is comparable to that of a 2-star. an envelope of money somehow went missing from our room. that wasnt even the kicker for me. security took down our information and told us they would contact us upon looking into the matter. they also said that if the envelope was not recovered they would assist us in filing an insurance claim. well, two weeks went by and i still hadnt heard from them so i took it upon myself to send an email. that email was met with a "we regret to inform you that your money was not recovered. we hope this does not deter you from staying with us again." that was it. i emailed back asking about the insurance process. that was over a month ago. they never responded. call me crazy but that seems a bit unacceptable for a "5-star" hotel. ive never encountered such unprofessionalism, and to be honest i feel personally insulted that they would ignore the matter in such a way. needless to say i will not be recommending the grosvenor house to anyone. if you do stay there, lock up anything that matters to you. it really is a shame because the hotel itself is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Stay at the Grosvenor House”
Reviews.Author: BostonAnglophile
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to London having enjoyed stays with many of the more recognizable hotels but quite simply, the hospitality aspect provided by the guest relations team at the Grosvenor House before and during our stay was nothing short of outstanding. The hotel itself is meticulously well-appointed and maintained, including the common areas and the actual guestrooms. Although the hotel is very large there is an undeniably warm and comfortable feel to the place, and that extends to the Grosvenor staff, all of whom are extremely accommodating. The Marriott team provided us with excellent service without being obtrusive -- a balance that is not always easily accomplished in the lodging industry. Guest services attention to detail is superior, right down to the coffee and cookies that were delivered to our suite with our morning wake up call. Both my husband and I got the sense that the staff had really gone the extra mile to make us comfortable. Now the only place we will stay at in London is the JW Marriott. We will go so far as to plan our schedule around the Grosvenor hotelâ€™s availability!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great bathroom - a pretty good stay!”
Reviews.Author: RachelSouthwood
Reviews.Content: I checked in to my room on the 4th floor (what a maze, but I got there in the end) and immediately felt at home - rare for me in hotels. It helped that I was attending a function downstairs in the Great Room that evening. Plus points: Room size, comfortable bed, pleasant view over the street behind, good-sized bathroom including scales - a rare treat! Lots of storage space, clean and well decorated. I ordered a delicious breakfast (Â£27, room service), which included loads of pastries, jams, marmalade, butter toast, sausages, eggs, bacon, mushrooms, black pudding, tomatoes and tomato ketchup. Down side: Not as many toiletries as I have come to expect of a five-star hotel, but when I called reception they quickly brought me a requested toothbrush and toothpaste. The bar was prohibitively expensive, but there was at least free bottled water. TV was a bit cumbersome to navigate. I had a long wait at check in on arrival and departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - a Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: drbdoubek
Reviews.Content: This was a GREAT hotel. I'm am continually impressed with JW Marriotts worldwide. I was immediately upgraded when I arrived, but I got the feeling that all rooms, regardless of price, were fantastic. The bathroom was huge. My only comment was that, as an American, it took 2-3 minutes to figure out the shower - 4 knobs to twist. However, the location is superb, the staff is very friendly (some of the nicest EVER), and the property is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetolearn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grosvenor House using our Marriott points for a stay of 8 nights. Upon checking in at 1:30pm we were told the room wasn't ready due to the hotel being full, but we could use the executive lounge because of my husband's Marriott reward status. We were in there maybe 40 min's before they told us our room was ready and gave us the keys. We have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. We had a king size bed, non-smoking room. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was above average in size. The room itself was very roomy and decorated in tasteful colors and well kept furniture. We did use the lounge everyday for breakfast, and some evenings for cocktails and appetizers. This was very helpful so we didn't have to go and find something every morning for breakfast. We were here for vacation and really have no complaints. Everyone was very helpful when asked for something. When we called every evening for a wake-up call for the next morning they would ask if we would like coffee or tea delivered to us for the morning. In past reviews there were some complaints of things being "gone" when they would come back to their rooms. I don't care what class of hotel you're staying in, lock it up if you can. If we left for breakfast just to go upstairs to the lounge for 30 min's we locked valuables in the safe. Anytime we leave the room no matter what hotel we are staying at, valuables get locked up. There were no problems with outside noise. Oh, and the tube is about a 5 minute walk. If you go out the doors in the back and walk up to Mount ST. and take a left then walk about 3 blocks there are a couple of good restaurants. Serafino's and Delfino's both were pretty good, but we liked Delfino's better and the prices were fair also. We would recommend this hotel for just about anyone. No complaints here at all. It was a great stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very High standard for the UK”
Reviews.Author: leeabbey
Reviews.Content: Hotels in the UK are not generally a great standard, but the Grosvenor was surprisingly nice and to a very high standard. I would recommend it highly. It was very modern and very high class it you want a good standard for London stay here not cheap though.
